reviewTitle: Read carefully what it does and doesn’t do before purchasing
reviewDescription: I bought this thinking I was getting a good price on a printer. It’s a good price, but that’s because everything has to be done manually. Want to make more than one copy? Press the little print button the number of times equal to how many copies you want, up to 10 copies. So, press the button 10 times for those ten prints. Want to copy something double sided? Check it out: it says double sided is possible manually. That means you have to copy one page then take that copied page out and put it in the paper slot and copy the 2nd page. Heaven forbid you want more than one two sided page! You’re going to be awhile! Want to fit something to page size? Well, too bad. You can’t. Squish it in the best you can, if it’s longer than a normal size page, because you can’t re-size. And, what about that print quality? More like a charcoal gray color rather than a black. I’ve regretted buying this since the first time I tried to use it to make a few copies, which was a few days after I purchased it. Unfortunately, I threw the box out the same night I purchased it and set it up. So, I’ve been trying to make do. But, for me, it’s just not working.My husband finally convinced me to see if I could send it back and get something better. He convinced me tonight. After all, it is Amazon, and Amazon often allows 30 day returns. Another unfortunate: I am now 8 days past my return date.Anyone want a printer, cheap?Update:I’ve had this printer 3 miserable months now. Last night, it malfunctioned. It said it was low on ink so, even though the symbol telling me to replace ink hadn’t come on, I tried replacing the ink to see if that would fix it. Nope. Didn’t even show there was now ink available. I tried going on HP to get customer service online. Hah! Even though HP has been sending me ink for 3 months, my printer isn’t registered. Inputting the printer and trying to do chat resulted in messages that said the function was not available and I should try later. I tried 5 times over a period of 2 hours and got the same message. I tried about everything I could think to get printer working - reinstalling ink cartridge, hitting the “X” to cancel the job I had started, turning the printer on and off, even unplugging and plugging it back in. Nothing.I went out and got a new printer. Then, I went on the HP app and tried the help for the printer ink subscription, which I do show as having, even though they don’t show my registered printer. I asked the chat bot to cancel my HP subscription. I told the chat I was canceling because the printer wasn’t working. When I got an agent, she didn’t know what I wanted. I told her I wanted to cancel subscription. When she asked why, I said the printer wasn’t working and I didn’t want the printer any more. I told her to look at the original chat. Twice, the agent tried to convince me that I needed ink for a printer I told her wasn’t working and I didn’t want. Twice, she tried to tell me what a good deal the ink was. When she did cancel, she told me the cancellation would take effect when this month’s billing was up. I’m still in the 6 free months! (BTW, that conversation took about 10 minutes, so don’t expect anything to be prompt.)I had an HP printer before I got this one. It was a good printer. It lasted 5 or 10 years. I will never have HP again.

reviewTitle: Printer is good.  HP+ is questionable.
reviewDescription: The printer is very good.  Not much needs to be said.  HP+ and Instant Ink that the printer comes with is not a bad thing since it gives you a fairly long time to print stuff without paying for toners, although, it also follows that people who don't have that much to print will find themselves not really needing that service much.  (I've found that, for instance, I may have a few occasions during a year that I might need to print quite a bit of photos, then go months without needing to print anything--this is exactly the worst combination of needs for what HP Instant Ink does.)  While Instant Ink is quite useful, I've found HP+ to be not particularly useful an app and it's not a good thing that you can only use HP's own cartridges once you have activated it (although some reviews of generic cartridges claim otherwise--I'm not entirely sure how this works.)  On the other hand, HP cartridges (for now) are not dreadfully more expensive and if you are not printing too much, it may not be too bad (although their cartridge reliability has declined quite a bit--I've just had a color cartridge die unexpectedly just when I needed to print a bunch of stuff.  This is exactly what HP Instant Ink is supposed to provide protection for and it just failed at it.  Apparently, I can and did request new ink, but the timing is most awkward--Instant Ink runs out in 3 weeks.  It may take up to 2 weeks to arrive, and it'll be a week and a half after I need to print.  Hmm....)  :/Edit 2:  I've downgraded the rating to two stars after running into more problems with HP support for Instant Ink.  I think the set up is not too bad if HP cartridges are 100% reliable so that the ONLY problems that could arise are either simple or just running out of ink.  They are not:  you always run into problems when cartridges that still hold lots of ink goes bad for whatever reason.  If you do, then the whole thing becomes more trouble than it's worth.  Normally, you'd just get a store bought ink to substitute in a hurry.  Instant Ink causes problems if you do that, though.  I don't begrudge HP cartridges for not being 100% reliable since stuff happens all the time.  I do begrudge whoever that came up with the way HP Instant Ink is set up for the presumption that HP cartridges are 100% reliable and basically screwing over any customer who runs into cartridges going bad without running out of ink and making the HP+ app tied with the Instant Ink.  (Besides the basic ickiness associated with the whole "subscription" model that entraps customers, too).I'd still endorse the printer for the fundamentals.  It works alright, although you'd suffer some functionality loss if you can't use HP+ app (i.e. it may not be as easy using the scanner, etc without the app--probably, there are workarounds,  but finding them would take some effort...)  But Instant Ink is deplorable (it's not too bad as long as everything works, but you will inevitably run into issues, and then it's far more trouble than it's worth.)

reviewTitle: Actual trash. Good for headaches, not much else.
reviewDescription: HP has been in the printer game for a long time. Long enough to have perfected printers. One would think.This printer has been a headache since day one for a few reasons.Most significantly, it doesn’t work when you need it to. About 80% of the time I go to print something, I get an error. What should have been me walking to the printer that worked last time I used it and picking up my print job turns into a 20+ minute troubleshooting operation. With absolutely no changes to my network, home setup, printer settings, etc., this guy will completely disconnect from and lose the network.When an error occurs, neither the app (mandatory download if you want to print remotely from phone or computer) nor the printer will tell you the reason for the error, so you end up walking through some series of steps and printing troubleshooting pages that make little to no sense to figure out why the printer refuses to print. Again. The whole thing is ridiculous and so far from user friendly. The photo attached is from today’s attempt to print, finally getting a troubleshooting page to print, which told me that the printer was connected to the network and in the next statement said the printer was not connected to the network. Then I tried to connect and got this error - while standing next to the printer. This happens almost every time.Technology has come so far and can do so much. Printing has been around for a while and evolved very little. I just feel like we should have figured it out by now…Additionally, you get a free trial of HP’s instant ink upon purchase. This is great if you’re using your printer regularly. Without thinking about it you get new ink in the mail. However, I moved during this free trial and gained some spare cartridges. After the trial and with inconsistent printing, I cancelled Instant Ink, intending to use the extra cartridges before I bought new ones outright. No can do. As soon as you no longer have Instant Ink any cartridges you got in the program are voided. They will not work.In the paid Instant Ink program, you sign up based on the number of pages you will print per month. It’s very affordable and great if you know how many pages you will print per month…less great if you don’t. Very much less great if you usually print 8/month but need to print one 20-page document. The pages don’t roll over.I also haven’t figured out exactly how these cartridges work or how full they are and if I’m actually saving money in the long run, since it’s based on pages printed and not ink remaining. Overall it just seems like a very wasteful and unclear program. Even during the trial the cartridges seem to get prematurely low more than once. But for a printer that actually prints about 20% of the time I need it to, it seems like the best option until/unless I purchase a new printer than will absolutely not be HP.

Update:You have to print through the HP Smart app. In other words, if you are on a website or file and click print and select the printer it will not work. If you are on a website or file and you select print with HP Smart App it will not work. You have to go into the app and open the file in order to print——I purchased this printer thinking it would be an affordable option when I only need to print a couple items on a rare occasion.First con, on setup the app wants you to have a subscription to monitor your ink usage and send you ink refills. The subscription is not worth it when you are printing only a couple things every few weeks. I declined it which may be the real issue behind the next issue.Second it is almost impossible to send documents to this printer on any device. The app on my phone, which says the printer is available and ready, will quickly get an error anytime you send something saying you don’t have paper loaded when you do or some other error like the printer is now offline.I wish that I hadn’t gotten this printer at all and invested in something from another company.

The price for this printer is what you get. The ink it came with didn't even work so I had to turn around and order ink right off the get go. (inserting eyeroll)  I was being optimistic thinking I'd found different printer at a cheap price and could get ink that didn't cost more than the printer.  NOTE: I had a Canon TS8120 Pixma printer that died after about 5 years and it was the greatest!! I'll be getting another one this week after finagling with this one for the last 2 weeks.  Granted I do a A LOT of printing since I homeschool and this printer just designed for the amount of printing I do. The amount of ink in the cartridges doesn't last long, it's loud, and likes to only print half of a worksheet every other time. Now, it'd be ideal for someone who prints occasionally. And I thought that purchasing refurbished ink would save a few bucks, but it's a hit or miss if the cartridge actually works on the remanufactured ones.

This printer is really not friendly to anyone, if you are not a tech person I do not know how you would even use it. I have a fault where I cannot connect it back to either of my networks to print. I like most people, do not just have a USB-B cable sitting around the house, if it was in the box I never got one to use, otherwise I would just use it in direct connection mode. Whoever designed the hp smart app really does not know how to make things simple and easy for anyone, you need to have the printer connected to the same wifi connection to remove it from your account, but to do that you need to connect to the wifi, I can't. I am stuck in a loop that someone really could have taken 3 seconds to think about and figure out that maybe, the solution should not be reset your wifi to default for a flippin printer, I have way too many things hooked up to the wifi that would need to be reconfigured over something that is just a poor excuse of programming.This is the first and last HP product my family or friends will ever know of, I have told them to not buy HP because this thing is a flamming pile of garbage. The app alone is enough to make anyone angry with how it is so poorly set up, let alone not being able to add the printer back to the same or even a new network. The guides online tell you to contact HP support, but then looking around you see countless threads of dead HP support tickets with no help in them. I should have read a review or two about this before spending money on it. Not upset with the price, and honestly should expect this type of issue with the price, but wow that's not confidence inspiring that a $90 printer is a flamming pile of junk. I've only had the thing 2 months and it's bricked.I gave it a 2 star only because it made me decent bit of money for it's low price, so can't complain there. It did it's job for me for 2 months, then decided it needed a union to work. Can't afford that here.Stay away from this printer if you don't know your way around a computer and networking. If you have someone you call for help with your computer, they will hate you forever for having to deal with this printer. Please spare them the pain of having to deal with this lousy excuse of a printer and program.

reviewTitle: Its 2024 and printers are still trash
reviewDescription: It's sleek in design, promises nice features, and prints rather well when it wants to. It was a somewhat simple setup process but don't be fooled by their promise of sending ink refills.. They are already discontinuing that promise because of terrible backlash on their new subscription services.It's a nice printer for the price, but its reliance on Wi-fi connection is a massive downfall. I've had minor issues here and there but now, at the time of writing this review, I just printed some Wine Tech Sheets that were in PDF form. I printed 4 of them with almost no problem, but now its just deciding it can't print the other PDF's that I have ready for it and it is giving no indication as to why. It simply just doesn't want to, I guess.I got this because of the 5 star reviews, but I should have spent more time researching. Spend your money on something else.(Update- Now running into an issue where it says it sent the file to be printed, but nothing prints. Again, no explanation. It's just doing nothing and I even tried unplugging it and turning it back on. Then 2 minutes later it decided to print the few pages I asked it to, but showed me nothing in the processes that it was still thinking about printing them.. It's not the first time I had to unplug it to get it to work properly again.)

Didn't think it would be this much of a hassle to setup a printer, given my last Brother printer i just plugged in the cable and my PC did the rest. This one you have to setup an account with HP plus, the whole thing is ridiculously annoying, can't print without it tho. Want to print from another computer? That one needs the HP app as well. Took probably 20 mins to get it all setup and going. Fast forward a week, go to print something, I can't print to this printer. It's offline, i can see it setting there with lights on, but nope, it's offline. I have to print to HP smartprint instead, that gives you a popup from HP, Do you really want to print the thing you just tried to print? I do, will it print now? Nope, have to power cycle the printer....  it starts printing, will this be what i want printed? Nope, now it's printing a 3 page network diagnostic(RIP ink) that i never asked for. Apparently more than 1 router has been found that matches my wireless network name (not true) but whatever. Stopped to write this review and trash on this thing because it sucks, bad. My guess is i'll have to go through the setup all over again, but at some point it might print what i want. Maybe, idfk. Ope, it literally sat there doing nothing for the entire time i was writing this review, then finally kicked out my document as i was spellchecking. Tried to print a second document and this thing is cooked, just flat out won't print. It does want me to align the print heads for better quality tho, because of course it does.

reviewTitle: I hope it was just defective
reviewDescription: I've liked HP, that's why I have used wireless printers for a long time and I've liked them a lot. Every time I put in new ink in it would dry up before I use  it.  After 5 or 10 sheets I would have to get a new cartridge. I ordered the HP Deskjet 2755. I had it all installed on four devices and a matter of minutes. It printed fine on all devices but after just a few minutes it went offline and nothing I could do for 4 days would get it back on line except unplugging the printer and plugging it back in. Then things would work normally for a few more minutes. After over 8 hours with several support people and second level support people I was finally told that I had to return the printer, the printer that was bad. HP claims there is no problem with this printer, so I ordered another one just like it to make sure. I will add to this review the results of the new printer whether it's good or bad.Then again maybe I'll keep it because it didn't cost that much, and it works for 15 or 20 minutes. I reboot it every time I need to use it. I don't use it very often. There's something defective, in the software, the hardware, or the printer. This model is the HP Deskjet7255e.2nd Printer orderedI worked another 8 days trying to get the new one to work. but it had the same problem. After a few minutes, the printer went to sleep and it wouldn't print. Out of many hours of valuable technical support  from HP, they again agreed that the printer was defective. I returned the second one today reluctantly and they're going to send me a different model all in one a printer. I purchased another HP printer just a little higher end. I still like HP. Their support is good and the value is good.

reviewTitle: It's ALL about signing up for the automatic ink delivery.  Boo.
reviewDescription: This printer was nearly impossible to set up as there apparently are "issues" with ink cartridge recognition.  The setup cartridges that came in the box with the printer, would not work.  H/P tech help was no help.  I bought new cartridges (color and black) and they turned out to be "off brand", but the packaging was similar in color/logo to H/P. ...... color cartridge was "recognized" by the printer, but not the black cartridge.  In person tech help suggested H/P printers "historically seem to only recognize H/P BRAND cartridges".  Purchased  yet another cartridge, this time H/P Brand, and the printer finally is working.  Four different young computer savvy people tried to get this printer working with no luck.  Online tech help was an hour long loop conversation that did not help.  I would never recommend an H/P printer to anyone as it is very apparent that it is most important to H/P that you immediately sign up for the ink delivery plan they offer.  Now let's see how long it functions.  D- is my grade.

TLDR: good printer, works with eero wifi mesh system, set up in less than 10 minutes - great step-by-step instructions via HP Smart app. If you need a basic printer for occasional printing that's super easy to setup, get this. I initially bought the Canon Pixma MG3620. Downloaded their app to get things setup and what a nightmare. I have an eero wifi and the PIXMA printer would not show up on initial scan. I would select scan again after clicking a series of buttons on the printers and then it would popup only to show my wireless network listed 4 times with me being left to determine which one I connected to. I assumed it didn't matter but it did given after selecting 1 and inputting the password, it wouldn't connect. I would click the series of buttons on the printer again to begin the process again only to have all the wifi networks show up (mine + other networks it found) but in a totally different order. This meant I couldn't even weed out each of my 4 networks to find which one was right. Also, the one time I did manage to get it to connect, I had to set my eero wifi in legacy mode for it to connect. As soon as I removed it from legacy mode, the printer began failing again only for me to begin attempting to get it connected again. I looked on many forums but eventually couldn't find a solution as many other people had issues as well.Why do I mention the printer above? Because I then bought THIS hp printer and simply downloaded the app, plugged in the printer, turned it on, and followed the step-by-step instructions (with animations) and it immediately found my network and connected. No duplicate entries, no hassle, it just worked. I was printing within minutes. I then tested printing on my mac, my downstairs PC, and my phone with AirPrint and it all just worked. I spent almost 2 hours on the canon printer troubleshooting and it was just a huge headache. As for print quality between the two, I couldn't tell you, but if you just need a basic occasional printer, you can't beat this for the price and simplicity. Hope this helps.

reviewTitle: Very Nice Printer for the Price!
reviewDescription: I've been using the printer for several days now and actually like it very much!  It's whisper quiet on the printing and the scanning.  While it was scanning, I had to check it to see if it was still working because I didn't hear anything!  It's THAT quiet!  The printed documents and photos came out nicely with vibrant colors.  Not bad for a bargain printer.  It was very easy to set up my account and HP Smart app. Printer sharing with friends and family was very simple too.  The printer came with free 3 months of ink, which is actually their Instant Ink subscription free trial period.  The box did come with regular starter HP black and tri-color ink cartridges.  I was pleasantly surprised to learn that during the 3 months free trial of the Instant Ink, although I chose a plan that gives me up to 50 pages per month, I am able to print up to 700 pages per month for free during the 3-month trial period.  Depending on my usage during the trial period, it will help me decide if the ink subscription plans are right for me or not.  If not, then I will just need to replace the HP Instant Ink compatible cartridges with regular HP ink cartridges before the trial period ends and continue using my printer as normal without the subscription.  The Instant Ink cartridges will stop working when the subscription plan expires after cancellation.  So far, I have enjoyed the printer.  The ability to print from anywhere is a great feature!  It's not the fastest printer in the world, but it definitely does the job!

Baught this needing a simple printer/copier for work and was a bit skeptical about the price, but this is great value! Prints really well,  copier is easy to use. It Bluetooths to your phone or computer so you can use it anywhere anytime, as long as you have a paper loaded. Sometimes it has a hard time connecting to wifi but it's easy too fix. I've also had a small issue with making sure the paper goes through properly but I believe it was user error cause I havnt had it do it recently.

reviewTitle: I Don't See What the Big Fuss Was...
reviewDescription: I had no problem setting this printer up. That being said, I am a millennial. No offense to the older generation, but if you are not one who is privy to technology or its many advances, this printer will not be the easiest for you to set up... To make things easier for those that might struggle with setup, here they are in layman terms:1. Take Printer out of the box.2. Take off all wrapping.3. Plug it in and turn it on.4. Slide up the back printer paper tray.5. The blue marker in the middle of the space on this this tray, needs to be slid over to the left, before you can add paper. You might have to pull it forward and up before you can slide.6. Open the bottom panel, open the inner door, unwrap the ink and insert the cartridges as directed by the illustrated guide.7. Get your smartphone, because this is how you are going to be setting this up. If you don't have one, then you have to go to 123.hp.com and set it up that way, but it's highly recommended to use the app on the phone.8. Download HP Smart from the apple store or the play store.9. Select the first option to set up a new printer. As long as the Wi-Fi light on the printer is flashing and the Wi-Fi/Bluetooth light is on, on the smartphone you should return a result of your new printer.10. From there, set up your new account or log in with your current HP account if you already have one.'This took me all of five minutes to do, not long at all. Very easy set up for someone who is technology-savvy or who is able to follow instructions well.Make sure to hit that you are replacing your old printer if that is what you are doing as well. If you want to set it up on a desktop, you can go to 123.hp.comTo me, this isn't hard to, but I do think that HP could have laid out the instructions much better than they did. It's like they assumed that everyone would understand to get out their smartphones and set up their printer like there was no problem at all. They need to work on that and make it more user-friendly.The printer itself is great. Nothing is broken, connected easily, looks very nice, and is printing wonderfully. I would highly recommend this printer to others as long as they are comfortable with this type of setup process.

The HP DeskJet 2855e Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer is an excellent choice for home or small office use. This versatile printer offers printing, scanning, and copying functions in one compact device. The wireless capability allows you to print from your smartphone or tablet effortlessly, making it highly convenient.One of the standout features is its ease of setup. The straightforward installation process, guided by the HP Smart app, means you can get started quickly without any technical hassle. Additionally, its reliable performance and quality color prints make it perfect for everyday tasks, from documents to photos.For a reliable, easy-to-use, and efficient printing solution, the HP DeskJet 2855e is a superb choice.

This is the first printer I’ve purchased in ten years. Previously had a printer for school work but then got a job with my own PC and work printer so didn’t need to use one at home. Now I’ve been thinking of taking some online courses and decided to get a home unit and not spend longer hours at work. For the price of less than $60 I am really impresseed. It is about as good as the unit I purchased ten years ago except then those types of printers were wired in to the PC and cost me well into the two to three hundred price range. But a wireless device for less than $60? Its way better.Print speed and print quality are also very good. I think my previous printer was 3 ppm for $280 but 7 ppm for $59, you can’t beat that. I even like the three months of ink free that comes with the printer. All around good deal.

But it's a lot of hassle to get to talk to someone on the phone it's been 4 days and still can't find or talk to anyone from hp. And the only way I get my 3 month "FREE INK CARTRIDGES" I have to buy a plan first. Makes no sense. If they say you get the first 3 months free then it should be free. The only thing I've been dealing with is that Virtual computer. I'm about to give up on this. I will believe hp on anything they say you get fkr free... and I'm a hp fan but this free ink thing never again. I give it 5 stars because it's a great printer. 0 stars on the free ink

First off these negative reviews are ridiculous. We had no problems setting this up. It took less than 10 minutes. Every time we ask the printer to print a job it’s done. The printing speed is surprisingly fast and looks great for small office work. I like the size of this printer, it fits neatly tucked away in a closet, or you can have it right on your desk. I love that the printer tells HP when your ink is low and they mail out new ink! I recommend this printer.

I debated about getting this printer based on all the bad reviews but kept coming back to it because I previously had an HP printer that lasted over 10 years, so being that I'm not super tech savvy I figured it might seem more familiar.I took some advise and said no to setting up an account or the free ink. I did not have to enter my email or anything. It sort of felt like I was not going to be able to do much without signing up but I just kept saying no, and was able to follow the prompts in the app to set up my printer. Once downloaded you really do not need the app anymore. I can print from any apple device that we have and my macbook without downloading anything. As long as you are on the wifi network you can print.I just needed this to scan/copy, and print basic stuff. I'm not expecting this to be a high quality photo printer, but the copies seemed pretty good in my testing. I printed some coupons off the internet from my phone and my husband's phone, and a document I needed from my macbook and all were passable.One thing I liked about this one is that I can leave the tray closed and since I have it on a desk it will spit the print right out the bottom. My old one I had to leave that door open. This has a door you can open if you need to but it's nice for us since we are just occasionally printing stuff like coupons to not have to leave that door open. I keep it on a small writing desk in our dining room, and there is plenty of room for other things on the desk.It does not come with any cords to hook up straight to a computer but it does have a port. My old printer had such a cord and even though I never needed it I kept it just in case someday I need to attach a laptop or something.One other thing I like about this one is that it just has a normal cord to plug it in. My old one had one of those big blocks in the middle of the cord. Apparently they figured out a way to put all that junk inside the printer.Anyway for fifty bucks I was up and printing in a few minutes and I'm not signed up for any kind of ink service. I know I will pay through the nose for ink but since we do not print that much I can live with it. They do warn you that there is a chip in the ink cartridges that forces you to buy ink from them but I our last one was like this and it would take some of the generic cartridges I tried. I'm sure the ink that comes with it is a small amount so I'll be buying more ink to have on hand.I'll come back and update if I notice anything pertinent that comes up.

This is a great deskjet, printing is quick, copying is very fast.  A free HP ink sub for 6 months comes in handy so if you buy this printer, check that out.  Ink cartridges are expensive so having HP speak to the printer and know how much ink you use, then automatically ship it to you, is so convenient and I don't think the cost per month is bad at all.  I consisder it a good buy.

Grabbed one of these 3 or so weeks ago, finally got round to setting it up. It was very difficult throwing out my old deskjet 1010. Over the years, I had located and secured several 1010s for backup in case one ever let me down.After seeing some reviews about the ink offer and how difficult they made it sound, I was a bit concerned it might take a while to set up. Folks, a first grader could set this up in 5 minutes.Pluses, cost, ink included, set up is a snap. No negatives at this early point in our relationship.Unpack, remove some plastic, insert paper, ink cartridges and you're just about there. Be in proximity to your wifi set up.Find the piece of paper that has the HP online link to downloading the driver.Make sure not to click on one of those sites that looks like HP, make certain it's the HP site.It will ask what version of Windows you're running, and have you WIFI and PW info handy.Follow simply instructions, ready to go.When you power up, if the BLUE LIGHT is blinking, it means it has found your WIFI.Hope this printer is as good as the original version.I highly recommend only for home use. Not a ton of printing, just there when you need it.

The packaging was nice and very protected. This printer took my husband and I almost 3 hours to set it up completely... Lol. We are not usually involved in printers and laptops until now though so, needed a little extra time. BUT once we got it I am really happy with the results. IT is working just fine. We got it set up on the laptop with HP app and after that it was pretty smooth sailing. Will probably be the only printer I use just because now we know how to set it up and don't want to deal with that agony again. Lol

This is a wireless version of a wired printer we’ve had for over a decade and liked. But we couldn’t print off our phones or tablet and always had to send it to email to use our laptop. Not anymore. We like it and we know the features already. Works very well for what we need. Occasional copying and printing.

No problem with it so far. It's fine for someone who doesn't print everyday. Small and lightweight so it's easy to move around if need be. Print speed is fine. But you will need to consider your printing habits and need for speed. Subscribe to instant ink so it's available when you need it. HP67 is a popular cartridge so it might often be out of stock when you need it most.

I needed a simple, small printer/copier for my home and this one is perfect.  I print from my cellphone and make copies with ease.  Works great if you have limited space and budget.  Highly recommend so far.  Have only used for a month so cannot speak to ink, etc.

reviewTitle: I haven't had one problem with it!
reviewDescription: I have had this for about 2 months and so far, no problems. It stays connected to the Wi-Fi and it works well. I love the ink membership for 4.99 a month I get ink sent to me every month. It is perfect for what I need it for. The printer prints clearly.

I had to find an All-in-One that will fit in my motorohome and I looked everywhere! After alot of searching I came across this one. It was easy to set up and I had it in the motorhome in 30 minutes. I did a few test test runs with copying, printing, scanning and no it's not as fast as my big Brother at home but the difference is very negligable. I've used it several times and have absolutely no complaints at all. So if you're space is squeezing you, this is the All-in-One for you!
This is smaller than the one I had before. It's not fast but it works and I only use it for the occasional thing I need to print. I also like the white. It also came with ink.

reviewTitle: HP Printer: The Unstoppable Paper-Eating Monster
reviewDescription: I’ve officially become a paper hoarder thanks to my HP printer. This thing is a printing machine possessed by a squirrel! It's like it has a vendetta against trees or something. I've printed everything from grocery lists to the complete works of Shakespeare. I even printed a picture of my cat once, just to see if it would freak out (it didn’t) Also extremely easy set up!!!!!

It is very easy to set up; the operating instructions are well described. You can bypass the "smart setup" instructions (despite them telling you not to) and operate it the traditional way. The copies are excellent.

I have struggled with this printed since I purchased. I wanted an HP WHITE printer. This was my only option. Whenever I am trying to print, I have to first shutdown the printer. Once the printer is up and running, I have to switch back and forth between HP SMART print and Printer 2700. Just depends on the day. I also dislike I can only scan and copy a document up to 9 times. Not feasible being a teach.My biggest dislike is the printer margins. No matter what you do or try ot change the margins, there will always be at least a 1in margin at the bottom of your document or your image is cut off. So anything you want to print, the size has to be shrunk to fit on the page. I wish this printer was like my other, HP Envy. I would have bought the HP envy, but it was not sold in white.

reviewTitle: This is simply not a good printer even for the price.
reviewDescription: I don't normally write reviews, but I had to because this one is just bad. set up was easy and the first few things I printed it was off my phone and it was pretty quick and the Wi-Fi was reliable. But that I quickly realize how bad this printer was the first thing I printed was 10 pages long, and I was already almost halfway out of ink. THIS THING EATS INK.The double side printer feature is simply broken. It will skip pages and print out blanks which messes up the order of everything else and taking more time to organize it with half the pages having both sides and half don't. On top of that it will skip pages and simply not print them and print pages I don't even select.The color option doesn't even appear on half of the applications I use to print stuff. Word is one of them.It picks and chooses when to print double sided properly. Meaning sometimes it's upside down and sometimes it's right side up. Even though my settings haven't changed.There's better printers for the same price. This simply a terrible printer and you will regret buying it.

I got this for an online class I had to take and 4 different times, it would go offline when I had to print an exam from zoom. I would print prior to my exam to make sure it works but somehow, it fails to print when I needed it to print most. Was it my WiFi? My laptop? My pdf file alone? Not sure but on my HP laptop, my printer would go “offline” and I’d have to plug it in and out of the wall, try to wake it up somehow and print test page etc to get it to print. Quality is fine, appearance is fine, it’s just getting it to print…

reviewTitle: Avoid - There are way better options than this
reviewDescription: It works occasionally, the quality of print is terrible with a lot of fading here and there. Connecting it to your network is one thing, but keeping it connected is a nightmare. I've had this thing for several months and I'm constantly fighting to get it working (just got finished with 45 minutes of trying to get it to print despite it saying its connected - printer queue shows the job waiting but says there are errors but no other information). I got this as a quick and cheap replacement for a more expensive HP all in one that simply stopped working. If you just want a piece of equipment with error and indicator lights constantly flashing, and enjoy your print jobs with a sizable dose of challenge then you found your printer. I give it 2 stars since every now and then it will print a few pages for me.

reviewTitle: Barely works, requires a phone, and begs you to subscribe.
reviewDescription: Has 5 buttons that do nothing except eat ink. The display is useless without the manual to lookup symbols. HP will ask you to pay for 3 subscriptions during the setup. The only way to interact with the printer is through an app. It doesn’t even automatically turn on when given power.  I gave it two stars because it was capable of printing 1 page after having to acknowledge an in-app notification that the alignment completed.

reviewTitle: We have had a problem every time
reviewDescription: Every time we try to use this printer we have to reconnect it or fuss with it in some way before we can print. It always takes at least 20 minutes to figure out what is going on, what needs to be done, and then get it to print. Once the print job happens, the printer is great. But the very next time we go to use it “Printer not connected”. 😑 It is VERY frustrating.

reviewTitle: This printer is the bane of my existence
reviewDescription: This printer only prints when it feels like it. It says it's offline when it's clearly online. It has errors all the time. I can't count on my printer to print when I need it.There doesn't appear to be any physical issue because when it finally does print, the page looks good. However, it only prints 1 out of every 10 times I hit the print button. I hate it so much.

This printer is a piece of garbage. I wish I want outside the return window or else I'd send it back.9 out of 10 times when I go to print something, there's something wrong. Printer is offline (it's not though...). Printer is busy (doing WHAT?). Power light is mysteriously blinking. It's incredibly unreliable and frustrating.The print quality is also bad. I have to reprint things because some lines are really faded, even though we've cleaned the printer heads and run the alignment tests and all that. Nothing helps.WORST OF ALL, they give you a few months free of HP+, but what they don't tell you is that after the trial ends, you'll have to choose a plan and keep paying HP every month or else the ink in your printer will stop working!!! I didn't realize that was even possible, but with technology these days apparently it is. I chose the cheapest package which is like $2.99 a month and allows you to print 20 documents a month or something like that, but it's so dumb that I have to pay HP monthly for the honor of using their garbage paperweight or else they'll render it more useless than it already is.I rarely bother to write reviews but this thing is seriously and truly awful. Don't buy it. Maybe gift it to someone you don't like.I had an Epson workforce printer that worked perfectly for like 9 years. I'm gonna go buy one of those and take a baseball bat to this HP pile of garbage. I only gave it 2 stars because it works sometimes and I guess that's worth something.

2 stars simply for the required app. Things can’t be simple like before . Bought this for a work computer but can’t use it because you need an hp app to use which is an issue for work. Even for my mobile printing they want you to have an app and other BS . I’m sure the printing is good , but the hoops you have to jump through isn’t worth it in my opinion . On top of that they want to farm your data . About to return sorry HP. I’m going on 1 hour trying to get this set up

The big draw other than the price was the supposedly easy setup and operation. The setup was ok, however, I still have yet to get the printer to print.  I have installed all sorts of of smart features and still cannot get it to work.  The sample page printed fine.  Threw the box out already so the next step is the garbage can.

The set up was as simple as 1,2,3. I was looking for something practical and I found it in this printer. It may not have all the bells and whistles like other printers but does the job perfectly for what I need. Thanks HP.
Good size for house use and easy to setup.Shipping was delay took a 10days to get here but So far so good!
Got this as a great deal. It was pretty easy to set up. I have already used it to print multiple items and copy in color and black/white. So far happy with the quality as I got it as a great price.

reviewTitle: Very simple printer easy to set up
reviewDescription: Now that I'm retired I no longer need a printer for major jobs. Just need one to occasionally print hard copies for me. This fits the bill. Was very easy to set up with my iPad and the HP app. Didn't take 5 minutes and it easily replaced an older HP model that died after 10 years of service. Couldn't beat the price for this! Perfect for me!
if you just need a basic printer for occasional use and don't want to break your bank- this is it. It does what its supposed to do - very reliable product

This printer is great. Took a bit to set up but was so easy from my phone. It prints quickly and connects easily to WiFi. The free ink up to three months is such a good deal for my business and will be very efficient for work. It’s very quiet and I enjoy its use. There is no touch screen, despite some reviews mentioning this though.

reviewTitle: I am not able to give full comment on this as yet.
reviewDescription: Although I have owned this printer for a few weeks, I have still not been able to connect it to my internet. I can't even return it because I got rid of the box. So I continue to try and hopefully one day it will connect. It is a nice compact little printer. I just wish I could get it to work.
This thing is fantastic. Setting up the wifi CAN be kinda difficult and confusing so take time to thoroughly read the directions

reviewTitle: Straight outta the box, works like a dream!
reviewDescription: Install is easy. I have the printer setup to my pocket-size cellular telecommunications device and PC. I printed 43 pages plus 2 test pages as soon as the printer was hooked up (not in that order). The printer works as advertised and came with 2 toner cartridges - black and CYM. I use the $10 amazon paper. I have no issues, nor complaints thus far.

reviewTitle: Exactly what I was looking for
reviewDescription: This printer is the perfect size for my home office. It's easy to set up & has Bluetooth capability so you can fax without a landline & print from your phone or tablet. You're able to register your printer & set up an account to get paper & ink delivered to your home for a reasonable price. (Prices varies depending on how much you print/fax). You get so much more for the price. Love It!

reviewTitle: Worked Great for a Couple of Months
reviewDescription: I used to wave the HP banner proudly and loudly.  I've had plenty of HP products that have always worked wonderfully, so when it came time to buy a MFP, I figured this would fit the bill.The product arrived promptly and packaged appropriately.I've always had issues connecting peripherals, such as printers and scanners, via Wi-Fi.  This was no different.  The connection was unsuccessful, even with the computer disconnected from the VPN.My preference is to connect via USB.  The printer, unsurprisingly didn't come with a USB cable, and the USB type B port was taped over indicating that they (HP) wanted us to use Wi-Fi to connect the printer.  I took the tape off and connected the printer to the computer with my own USB-B cable.  The scanner and  printer both worked fine.Before long, the scanner would sometimes no longer be found.  I would restart the printer and/or the computer and most of the time it would reconnect, but then, it eventually would not be found at all.I contacted HP support and was on the phone with them for about an hour and a half while they updated the drivers and installed new scanning software (HP Scan, vs. the pre-packaged HP Smart software that installs with the drivers.  Oddly enough, the HP support rep recommended NOT using the HP Smart software, and to use the HP Scan software when needing to scan.)The scanning software worked fine until today, then even *it* would not find the scanner.This is not the first time I've had an issue with an HP product, but it certainly will be the last.  Not allowing users to use third party ink cartridges, shoving the HP+ ink thing down our throats, and forcing us to create and maintain an HP account just to use a piece of hardware that works intermittently is absolute nonsense.Brother, here I come.

reviewTitle: Hard to connect to, shady ink deal
reviewDescription: I've had this printer for about a year and a half now, and I really hate it. My biggest beef is that it's difficult to print from (hahaha, the only thing I use it for, and its primary function) because it has a hard time... finding itself? Deciding it's ready to print? I have a brand new macbook, so I know my computer isn't the issue. I essentially have to unplug it and start it again if I want to print a new job after disconnecting from and reconnecting to the printer network. I know wifi printers are the "way of the future," but I really miss having a printer with a USB cable that will just... you know... print when you tell it to print. The other part of this review is a warning against the Instant Ink trial. Looks like a good deal, because you get ink delivered to you, and even if you decide to cancel your subscription, you can still use the ink from the free trial, right? Wrong. When you cancel, HP tells you your cartridges are no longer effective in your printer. Like they remotely tell your printer not to accept them or something, so even a brand new, unused one has to be chucked in the trash. What a waste, and what an environmentally irresponsible way to be a miserly-yet-rich mega company. I'm not impressed with any of it. If I could swap this for a junk old printer with a USB cord, I'd do it in a heartbeat.

We bought this on prime day and just opened it. We printed maybe 10 sheets of paper and ran out of ink. When it states 3months of ink. The machine has a scratch on it so I’m going to assume it used. Not impressed

This printer does not work more times than it does. I've been using printers in my home since the 80's and this is the worst I've ever had. It's also the cheapest so there's that.I'm tired of fighting with this p.o.s. and look forward to bashing it against my driveway in a fit of rage next time it doesn't work (which no doubt will be soon).

To begin with, for around a hundred dollars, I expected much more from HP.I had a HP printer previously. It had a paper hopper that held half a ream of paper.This one holds maybe twenty sheets.When printed, they fall on the floor as there is no basket to hold them.My old printer was metal and quite heavy, this is plastic and seems quite fragile.I'm terribly sorry I did not go to a store and look at it before buying it online.I never would have bought it if I could have examined it.

reviewTitle: Printer is okay. Promo for a 6-month instant ink is a hoax.
reviewDescription: Printer itself is okay in quality.  Expected from an economy printer. However, there is no way to claim the instant 6 month ink free supply, unless I will allow a remote control/access to my computer from an HP tech support (who told me that remote access is necessary to claim the promo) which I am never going to allow to happen especially with someone I do not know irregardless of his/her company affiliation.  Claiming a promotion for a product purchased should not require access of a company or its representative to my personal computer.And why did I say it is a hoax? Well, I tried to process the promotional claim myself through the HP Smart app installed on my comp when I installed this new printer.  Towards the end part of the form, a promo /PIN code is required to claim the promo and it says you can redeem the code through the flyer that came with the purchase, a pre-paid card or an email. I have 2 flyers that came with the printer , and two manuals.  Each of these have codes on them. I tried every single one and none works.One more thing, when I called for support, about claiming the promo, I got passed around 4 times. The first two times told me I have to be forwarded to the right guy. The third guy turned out to be the right guy but he became frustrated that I did not allow him a remote access to my personal computer, and so he passed me back to the 2nd guy whom told me again that he cannot do anything about the matter because this printer does not belong to his channel.HP... what is happening in your organization? This experience is far from what can be called a service from a reputable company.

I have a WiFi router that has both 2.4Ghz and 5.0Ghz. This printer will not connect if you have this type of router (doesn’t everyone?) as will only connect to the 2.4Ghz and there is no way to choose between the 2 on the horrible HP app. Waste of time trying to get it hooked up. Do not recommend

Paper does not load very smoothly.I don't print often, and the ink seemed to rapidly dry up (<20 pages, 3 months).It's been a pain trying to figure out the print head alignment after reloading ink cartrige.
If u chose the option to buy ink from them they control your printer to the point it's rendered useless if u go that route. U can allways get ink on your own without thier so called inksale.

takes about 10 minutes to print one page, and don't even think about trying to print double-sided - it requires you to manually flip the pages, and doesn't even print in the right order once you do so

I had one of these and it quit working.  I had a couple of cartridges left so thought I would order another one to use ink as it is expensive as the printer.  When I got new one spent two hours getting it to work.  Turns out you must register online (no choice) and must use ONLY Hp genuine ink again no choice.  Other brands will not work!  So now I have two printers close to same model and turns out my daughter had one too that mysteriously quit.  Turns out if you register and use HP ink works fine.  Also wants to auto ship ink.  Felt really scammed by this whole process.  May just invest in another brand because I hate that they have done this.

I've had this printer for almost 2 years.Does it print? At times, yes. So 2/5 stars for the product doing what it is designed to do about 40% of the time (that's a generous 40%)If you want to spend more time troubleshooting than printing, this is the perfect printer for you. But if you want a printer that prints the majority of the time without problems (an outlandish thing to ask, I know) then avoid this printer.I won't be purchasing this again. Tried to take the affordable route regarding printers and this seems to be one of those things where affordability does not outweigh functionality.Don't make my mistake, avoid the 40% effective rate. If 40% was the standard, well I probably wouldn't be here writing this review.

We've been spending the last 3 hours trying to get this seemingly basic printer to work. We finally got it going and now can't get it to work again. Constant errors. If it's not one thing, it's another. I don't recommend this garbage at all. Considering HP is a well known company with otherwise useful products, this isn't one of them. Probably will end up returning it. We bought this because it was on sale, and now we can see why. Won't be buying another printer like it and will absolutely go to a different company that can have reliable equipment and not some cheap piece of trash with faulty set ups and bad connection. Go ahead and spend the extra money on something else that works. Cheap = worthless.

reviewTitle: Will not recognize new ink cartridge.
reviewDescription: This piece of tech is great at first, but woe is you when the small quantity of included ink runs out.We purchased (not from Anazon) 3 separate packs of specified, brand-named ink as required by manufacturer, hoping one would work. Went through the whole process of set up and test 3 times.The printer software will not recognize the Cartridge(s). 3 different units? That's not an ink refill defect. That's a catastrophic printer/software defect. We had to buy a new one. Not from Amazon...Anyway, 2* since it worked great until the included ink ran out at 15 months post-purchase.P.S. The manufacturer insist you should subscribe to their ink refill auto-delivery. We use our printer very sparingly. If we'd done it, we'd have needed a storage shed.

reviewTitle: INK SELLING SCAM  and Very Cheap Feel Plastic Extremely Difficult to Set Up
reviewDescription: UPDATE; Feb. 4 2024 BE AWARE this printer is all about collecting your information, it will not work if you do not set it up on wifi, so it can collect info and send you and bill you for ink it is a subtle scam but after months of trying to use this with just a USB cable it is impossible, I have wasted so much tie trying to just get it to print without wifi and each time it prints out 20+ pages of the same instructions that do not work, or explain anything, of course, this uses tons of ink and for their wasted page print outs, cannot say how disappointed I am in this piece of junk that is an ink selling scam I am tech-savvy and have installed new printers for years on many computers, this, right out of the box felt lightweight in a cheap manner, i.e. like any of the plastic could break at any time.  I do not see this lasting very long for that reason.  Second, the shady manipulation that goes on to GET you to HAVE to sign up for an INK refill subscription is bad.  I tried to bypass this yet another subscription that I do not need, but the setup made it next to impossible to not sign up, as it would not install until I did that, then things started to move along until they did not have WiFi connection is janky and with the cheap materials I have no doubt this has something to do with it.  No help was available, you have to download an app to install it and then jump through a million fiery hoops to get it to print, and it still is not printing on demand the way I need it to and the way my previous HP did.  Huge disappointment.  I waited too long to install it and now cannot return it, please look at other options this is cheap for a reason.  Full of regrets as I had once trusted HP products.The process of fully setting it up, if it ever happens will go well into the day tomorrow, what a huge waste of time.

purchased for business purposes as a reasonably priced printer that had a 'reputable' name with the expectation of light to medium use but expected it to last more than 10 months.  Had to call support due to errors setting up. Even when it was set up I regularly had flashing lights, periodically lost wifi signal, hp support site never seemed to have ink levels-always had 'couldn't be detected' (though printer was always powered on) or some such nonesense so ink didn't get sent. (total waste of time signing up for that auto refil nonsense) The one time it was sent (because i called which was Not a pleasant experience and took entirely too long) it never arrived so I had to go out and purchase refils anyway.  I have had it turned off for the last 3 months.  Too often, there is a red flashing light which diganostic page does nothing to tell you what the issue is, usually a reboot magically resolves the issue.  Printer will show error if one of the cartridges is empty/low/missing (even if you are trying to print b/w w/o the color printer so you are going to either have one or the other cartridge sitting around or, you will throw away cartridges that are not empty.  Cartridges are akward to place and remove and even when properly 'seated' printer may or may not still give errors.  When it was working, the print quality and clarity were of expected quality.  If you print and there is an issue,  you have to find the print queue window to see what the issue is and then try various finesse moves to resolve so you can print.  If I had used anymore than I did, I probably would have thrown it out earlier from frustration.  I have a set of refills that I don't have the receipt for so when I have the time and patience will probably try one more time to get this thing to work a little longer as for the little i used it, it should have lasted at least 2-3 years.  HP is not the quality it once was (had a laptop that lasted about 1/2 years).  Will not buy another HP printer (or other product) and Cannot recommend this one.

This printer was so hard to get compatible with a Mac. The app you have to download seems like it keeps asking you to long in no matter what settings you click or opens ups a browser that is deemed “unsafe”. The AirPrint wireless print is not intuitive, I had to try several times to sync to the printer network just to print form my laptop since it refused to print while it was on the same network as me. The paper holder back tray also popped of while unboxing so be extremely gentle. We were fed up with our other printer and this one is almost worse to just get an easy set up to print.

reviewTitle: After speaking to six people, no answers.
reviewDescription: I am currently speaking to yet another rep, on hold, because nobody seems to be able to figure out why this printer won't work. The first printer worked for a few months, then wouldn't. It said I needed to re-enroll my instant ink . I had brand new cartridges I hadn't even opened. You have to be enrolled. I tried to enroll. It wouldn't let me. They sent me to tech support. No help whatsoever. They sent me back to instant ink. After speaking to many people they exchanged the printer, just to have the same issue,because I was previously enrolled in instant ink. It won't let me re-enroll or use the printer at all.

reviewTitle: Connectivity Issues - Print via Hotspot Option
reviewDescription: First off this is a major pain to set up (connect). Be aware it has specific requirements for initial set up - 2.4 internet and a desktop/laptop can be hard to find the correct combination. It cannot be set up on 5G. However, it says once it is set up via 2.4 then 5G can be used to print. I cannot confirm this. Nowhere did it say any of this in the description. I was only made aware via paperwork provided in the box. It took me 4 different attempts/locations/combinations of the above to get mine to work...It does not say Hotspots can be used to print and there are no instructions on how to do so. I had to contact HP Support. Even then they tried to tell me I needed Wifi. You do not. You can print via your Hotspot, if you made it through the hair-pulling process of initial setup. The printer has to be in WIFI-DIRECT mode to print via Hotspot. Press Info & Resume buttons at the same time and an icon of a printer with a phone beside it will appear. Good luck!

Overall: got this and people warned me about HP products and this has shown me that they were all right. I've had it a year and a halfPros: it prints most times. Nice having a wireless printer. Somewhat lightweight.Cons:- doesn't print consistently. Sometimes ink doesn't show despite levels being fine. Just had a job end halfway on the last page and can't figure out why- hp smart subscription has turned this into a subscription printer which I didn't want. It only works when you're subscribed. It gives an error so you have no choice but to enroll in the program- the tech feels shoddy. I've been having an unexplained error with the mobile app for the last few days and can't use it from my phone. It was also incredibly difficult to learn how to set it up again in a new apartment with new wifi. Literally pressed buttons for weeks, got very frustrated, had to hope the right combo of buttons printed the instructions and then try reading it through inconsistent ink- support is not good. When I had the wifi challenges, I couldn't get help from anyone. When I set it up the first time, I was googling and guessing for the steps to do it. It wasn't the craziest challenge but more challenging than it should have been- papers often get clumped so two tend to be fed in at a timeI wouldn't recommend this to someone but it'll do for the short term because it can somewhat print. It's just constantly disappointing me.
I like the simplicity of the printer and sets up well. However there was not 3 Mos of ink in the box only had a couple weeks worth of ink. Also I like wireless function.

We needed a new printer for home office use is meeting the need. This HP printer is super easy to set up via our wifi connection.  I was ae to get it connected and operational in less than an hour which is pretty good for us with 4 laptops and 2 phones to connect. The ink is easy to insert and the paper loads in the back. One downside is i have only been able to use the scanning feature while on the internet.  I haven't found an off line way to scan.Overall a good multifunctional home printer for the price.

I was looking for a printer that would be easy to install and lightweight. This printer was extremely easy to set up. The app is very convenient. The quality of the jobs is amazing. It does not jam or give errors. Great printer for a home office for someone that wants to do basic print jobs in scanning.

Very easy to set up and works well with Chromebook. Prints quickly and has pretty good quality.The only negative is it only holds the standard ink cartridges so you go through them much faster than the XL cartridges.It is a good value for the price and has excellent performance and support from HP.I would purchase again.
Im a teacher and was looking for the perfect printer to kepp at home. Let me just say IM IN LOVE i can print from my iphone, ipad, and laptop anywhere in the house with this printer.

I have always liked HP printers. It was very easy to install and use. There was a question on here about it having the ability to use legal paper. It can print legal paper but it does not have the scanning surface to scan or copy legal paper.
I got this to use in my vehicle with an inverter. It’s low enough wattage for my plug-in inverter since I don’t have a built-in

This printer was super easy to set up and figure out it comes with three months of free ink. All you gotta do is pay the shipping and handling on it and is one of the greatest deals. I’ve got from Amazon to date!!!
I love the feature that I can sit across the room and print.its easy to use. They send you ink free for 3 months. Support and the touch buttons are great. Images is very good.
Love this printer. Color is brilliant. Speed is ok.can print from phone or PC no matter what room I am in. Did I say I love this printer? Yes. I LOVE this printer.
Great product!

Reading other reviews it seems people are looking for an industrial super fast printer that can do it all..... This printer is PERFECT for a family home that may need to print things on occasion or scan and email, scan and fax, print and copy... I bought this a few days ago and it's perfect! This was a steal and prints beautifully!!
love this produce
Easy to setup.
Works great
Envío rápido,bien protegido el producto,se conecta bien y puedes imprimir desde tu teléfono estándo en un segundo piso de la casa, exelente

I bought this printer during Amazon Days. The price was great. It's small, lightweight and works so well. Very happy with this printer. I also signed up for the HP Ink and printer paper programs which save a lot of money.
Great price and easy to use. Save me time when I need to print important documents. The features are easy to use. I do the subscription to print 50 sheets monthly.
Great!

I love how the box says "Keep it simple" when this printer was anything but. I needed a color printer for work, and they all seem to have the same issues, so I took a chance on this one. I saw that some reviews said you might not be able to set it up over your workplace network, and that was true in my case. So I set it up at home using the app on my phone, and that part was easy. However, it will not connect to my Chromebook no matter what I do. I've read so many different directions and troubleshooting guides and it will not connect, at home or at work. You can print using a USB cord, but not until after you set it up over a network. So I figured that was my fate with this printer, not a big deal to hook it up when I need to print something. But then it wouldn't print what I needed properly, the top edge was cut off of one thing and another was missing half the image. I assume it's an alignment issue, but for some reason I also can't fix that without being connected to a network, which, again, I can't make happen at work. So I guess I have to take it BACK home for a 3rd time to try to do it there. But I can't haul this thing back and forth every time there's an issue, so back to Amazon it goes.

It does not work easily, one has to reinstall paper to print on the other side, and one can't increase the print size.  I'd have given anything to have tried all aspects of the printer immediately so I could have returned it and gotten a different one. My Canon's print is all blurry. Guess I can't get a decent printer I can afford.

reviewTitle: Does not work with a MacBook Pro Catalina
reviewDescription: My long time printer finally stopped working. I looked for a reasonably priced printer for our home. All searches referred me to HP printers. Which is what I have always had. This one looked perfect. It was more compact, on sale and appeared to be the perfect one.  Once I got it I attempted to set it up and found the software that had to be downloaded would only work on a MacBook pro version 11 and up. Mine is a Catalina version 10.15.7.  Also, it will only print from one computer! My husband and I both need access to a printer.  So, I had to return it to Amazon.  Very Grateful that Amazon makes returns so easy!  Thank you Amazon!!  I will continue searching for a printer.

reviewTitle: Product liteature in advertissing by HP is deceptive.
reviewDescription: Do not buy the HP Deskjet 2755e All-in-One ink jet printer because of its USB connection.  Don’t make my mistake unless you have have wireless connectivity.  If you don’t you cannot run  the setup program (HP doesn’t tell you that until after you open the box) and the Instant-ink program is unavailable if you have only an USB connection (HP doesn’t tell you that either.) In attempting to download the setup program I received a error 20 on both a Windows 10 and 7 computer.  I called the telephone number for 123.HP.com twice and wound up speaking to representatives from possibly India.  The first one took control of my Windows 10 computer.  His program said I was on a public network which is impossible since I am connected to my internet provider by either net to my modem and then by cable.  He also implied I would have to spend $200 to get the printer running.  The next night I spoke to another gentleman who said I would have to spend $100 to get it running.  Obviously I am not going to that amount of money on a $97 printer. I could return it to Amazon, but I’m not going to since I’ve removed all the packing tape and unsealed the ink cartridges.  I don’t want to burden them with something that is not their fault because of HP’s deceptive advertising.  I will try to give it away to someone with wireless connectivity, and if there are no takers I will throw it away.  I’ve ordered a Canon Pixma for my wife’s use. I don’t know what has happened to HP’s design staff. I’ve had a HP-P2055dn Laserjet priter for close to 20 years with no problems, but recently I bought a 17” HP laptop because of its specifications (32M Ram, I TB SSD) and it has the worst keyboard design I’ve encountered in 47 years.  Fortunately, its surface if flat enough that I can rest a useful wireless keyboard atop the laptop keyboard foe desktop use.

Really not the best printer, even for the price. I can only get it to print in color from their stupid app, which is beyond annoying. It feels like it uses a lot more ink than other printers I've had as well. I guess it works for the most part though, but I can't say I'd recommend getting it.

reviewTitle: Tech support told me it has to be no more than 10 ft from modem
reviewDescription: I couldn't get it to print and after being on with tech support, I was told to move it close to modem/router.  I was told in a chat (so I have it in writing) that hp printers shouldn't be more than 10 ft away in order to use wi-fi, which is a big reason I bought this printer.  I don't want a big printer in my living room, I want it by my desk (which is about 20 ft away).  Thinking about returning it because this info isn't mentioned anywhere.

Printer is a wireless setup with manufacturer, Good for what I need but must join the auto ink subscription. You have a trial period then can cancel or pay a subscription fee. We cancelled & found out since not tied in with the manufacture ink program that when my ink cartridges run out the printer will no longer work.

The printer itself seems to be good quality.  I spent 3-4 frustrating hours trying to set it up with the instructions provided and then--after hitting a snag--with the endless  chat bots, and others trying to get help.  Help almost impossible to get.  I had decided to pack it up and return it , but gave it another try --on my own, just trying various things, and finally got it to connect.  Doubt I'll ever need to buy another printer, but if I do it won't be an HP

reviewTitle: HP will nickle and dime you
reviewDescription: Here's my old man review (and I'm only in my 30s) about how HP nickles and dimes you.I've had this printer for 4 months. In that time span, I've probably used the printer 2-3 times a month. I'm sitting here because I'm replacing my ink for the first time and annoyed af. Here's why:This printer has some mischievous behavior. I changed the ink and it prints out a little report to make sure, I guess, that everything is aligned in the device. Wow, great. So now the $30 cartridges I bought are probably down 5% because HP couldn't manufacture a better device. Cool.But this isn't the only time you'll need to do this. When you first buy the printer, it HAS to print out all the set up information because the device doesn't have a functional screen. Now you're down 3-4 pages of paper and 10% of your ink and you haven't even used it yet.Anyway, we've all seen the teardown videos on YouTube where these cartridges have almost no liquid in them. My advice: Stay away from this sketchy company. I can't believe it's 2023 and a company can't make a decent printer. It's like they think it's okay as long as it can print pages adequately. Sure, but that's a pretty low bar, HP.

I was so excited for this printer and the ink setup but unfortunately we had it for right about 6 months and it stopped connecting to the wifi. It has been a headache for the last few weeks trying to fix it. I'm throwing in the towel and buying a different brand.Such a disappointment
Delivery was great. Works great. Ink doesn’t last long.

reviewTitle: iT WAS A LITTLE NICER THAN i EXPECTED
reviewDescription: should be a good printer. came with an Ink offer
Calidad vs precio. Es excelente esta compra. Volveria a comprarla.
Perfect little guy. Works very well better than expected. Would recommend
I like the easy set up and print and copy quality
Muy satisfechos con el producto, lo recomiendo 100%
But changed my mind after I ordered it
Good printer pretty easy to print
Got this by using my points.
Easy set up, colors are vibrate.

I highly recommend this printer! Setting it up, was a breeze, especially the wifi -  It was super easy to connect. The colors are super vibrant and it’s perfect for everything I need, from documents to photos. Plus, I can print directly from my mobile device, which is really convenient. If you’re looking for a reliable, easy to use printer with amazing color quality, this one’s a great choice. It’s made my printing task so much easier!

This is the first printer that has worked with my laptop.  Quick, easy setup.  Prints fast, good quality.  Packed wonderfully.  Want to warn people, rather than following instructions, it may be best to just follow your screen prompts and use the "add a printer" directive.  If you DO try to go to the website the instructions suggest, in your search results, you MAY run into a website that looks like it is HP, but instead is just a scam, trying to scare you into the "fact" that your computer has a virus and they want you to pay $199 to "fix" everything. If you see no choices except to enter into a "chat", get out.  Just don't go there.  If you enter the chat thing, they'll ask for your phone number, call you, then pretend to help you set up and install your printer, and then, when it doesn't work, they'll say it's because you have a virus in your computer that has gotten there through your WiFi.  It will be a long process--in my case, about 45 minutes, and then they will offer to "save you" and fix everything for a one-time fee of $199.  That is when the alarm bells sounded and I realized this was not an employee of HP helping me, but a scam, and  I ended the process.  But, be warned, these people will be INSIDE your computer, doing stuff!  Scary.  Never again.
This is exactly what I needed for my home office. I am very happy with this printer and I love that I can print from anywhere with the app.
Thanks it works great.

Prints quickly and does a really nice job. We use it for in home printing. We're very pleased with it. Does everything it's supposed to do. I would order it again if I needed another personal printer.
I love HP printers, so when my older one broke, I purchased this one.  It prints and scans in black/white or color.  It is super easy to set up and get connected to a network.
It was a little rough to get it paired with my wifi and connection with my computer, but once that was fixed it works fine. No issues.

I bought this as a birthday gift for someone who is not computer savvy. I’ve volunteered to set it up for them and was worried it would be a real headache, but to my wonderful surprise, it was simple to install within about 15 minutes we were printing. It seems to be a great value, although I have not priced what replacement cartridges are, and as we all know, that’s what is the expensive part of home printers.

I need this printer to create payment statements and tax documents from web sites. We pay by check and still do our taxes in paper form. Some organizations do not send monthly statements and some 1099 forms are only on-line. This unit prints well and the app makes all operations easy.
Easy setup. Easy ink install. Small and fits on home desk. Has printed over a 100 pages already with NO jams. best little printer for your home.

This review is for the older model (2755e). Let me start out by saying I have had this printer for a few years now. It was simple to setup once I figured out the hp app. I’ve never really had a paper jam or anything too inconvenient happen. It’s small and fits great in my work space and it has been durable so far. I don’t do any heavy duty printing but overall have been satisfied when I’ve needed to print the random document here and there. I’ve had no problems with the instant ink subscription and have liked that I don’t have to go buy cartridges. That being said I have recently needed to print more pages than usual. Nothing crazy, maybe ten sheets at a time, and I have never been more frustrated in my life with a printer. I just spent the last hour trying to print a six page document and I have gotten two pages to print correctly. This printer disconnects from the wifi after each page and I have to restart it to be able to continue printing. When it does print it takes a long time even though they advertise 5 pages within a minute. This is not something new. It’s never been extremely fast, but there’s no way I can get more than one page in a minute if I’m lucky. Two of the pages I’m trying to print can not print the last half inch of the document and just cuts off. I have tried numerous fixes for this including recreating the pdf to print and nothing is working. This is not the first time I have had to print this document and was able to get it to print fully in the past. I’m at my wits end with this printer and am going to be replacing it. I don’t recommend it if you need to print more than one thing at a time.Update: I bought a USB-B to USB-C cord to connect to my iPad/Mac for printing. Since doing this I’ve had zero problems. The idea of the printer is to be able to wirelessly print, but after getting the cord I no longer feel I need to replace the printer at this time.

reviewTitle: Nice Printer, Especially for the price
reviewDescription: I purchased this printer as a replacement for my HP 8028, which was out of ink. I had been trying to use off brand ink fillers but HP must have done an update because it no longer works.
