Replacing the ink for that printer would have cost me $85 versus $60.00 for this printer which included ink. It looks like the printer itself isn't how HP makes money but rather by forcing you to buy their ink. So, it's cheaper to buy a new printer than it was to fill the ink with new cartridges branded HP. Anyway, it's a pretty nice printer. It is smaller than my 8028 and a nice neutral color. I have done several pages of printing and the print quality is very good. In terms of connecting it via bluetooth, I had various levels of success. With some of my computers connecting was quite simple and fast. With others it took several attempts. There seems to be no rhyme or reason as to why it was easy on some computers and hard on others. The only thing I would change about this printer is its capacity for holding paper. It doesn't hold very much at one time.  For me this is not a big problem because I don't do much printing anymore, it seems like so much can be done electronically nowadays. But, if you are doing large batches of printing this might not be the right printer for you. You might want something with a larger capacity of holding paper so that you don't have to constantly fill it. Overall, I think this is a great printer for my needs and we'll see how much ink costs when it comes to that time. HP also tries to get you to subscribe on a monthly basis to ink replacement and they promise better pricing for your cartridges but they don't give you any pricing so I am going to wait until I actually need ink and then check pricing for the cartridges. Maybe by then I won't need to buy a new printer I can just buy new cartridges. We will see.

UPDATE: when I was FINALLY able to actually speak to human (after navigating the firewall of automated computer and telephonic systems), support was extremely helpful (shoutout Elmer). Support on their app is basically FaceTime so they can actually see what the issues are and help you solve them/set the product up—which again was insanely difficult. With that said, it’s been awhile since I used an inkjet printer-they are much slower than laser, the ink will smear until it’s dried, and the picture quality isn’t nearly as sharp-which is fine for me as I’m using it mainly for craft projects but don’t expect to be able to print big batch jobs efficiently. Also, the scanner doesn’t have an automatic feed, so you can only do a page at a time. But I’m now pretty happy with the purchase and you manage you expectations and CALL support to help you set it up, you probably will be too for the price. I was also able (eventually) to set it up on a usb as opposed to WiFi (they push their monthly services pretty hard which need WiFi) but it obviously doesn’t come with a usb printer cord.FIRST OF ALL, I DID NOT SEE ANYWHERE IN THIS POST THAT THE PRODUCT IS WIFI ONLY-you cannot wire it to connect (it doesn’t even come with that wire). So that was the first GIANT disappointment bc I bought it for work where WiFi printers are not allowed bc we work with sensitive information.But beyond that, EVERYTHING in the reviews (that I ignored) is true…setup is ATROCIOUS. I can usually figure stuff out but this was a NIGHTMARE that has so far been unsuccessful. Also, “support” is a joke. Literally the woman I bought ink cartridges from at target today was WAY more helpful than the bot I “chatted” with for help today. THE PAPER INSTRUCTIONS IN THE BOX LEAVE OUT CRUCIAL INFORMATION—MUST READ INSTRUCTIONS ON THE WEBSITE. And LOL at getting to speak to an actual human so that BASIC questions could be answered as opposed to being told they need to run remote diagnostics that will take at least 30 minutes because they literally don’t try to find out from you what the issue is. But they DO ask for your phone number and email 16 times.Rating a 2 bc I’m still holding out hope I can getting this junk to function….Will update tomorrow if I have any luck. YOU DEFINITELY GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR.

reviewTitle: A great printer but take your time setting it up
reviewDescription: I really like this printed now that I have it set up to use with my laptop, iPad and iPhone, but it was a process getting to that point. As I recall etting it up on WiFi and with my devices like my iPad took a while. And I feel that the online ink system they want to sell you isn’t geared towards someone who only occasionally uses a printer, like me. I think it is too expensive a service if you aren’t running a small business or otherwise using it a lot.But you still are required to use their sample cartridge first, as near as I could find. Then when they were empty I was able to use new cartridges as needed. I have only used HP brand so far as they aren’t too expensive, and sometimes generic ones can be not worth the savings.

The printer itself is fine. In hindsight, I wish I would've ordered something with an automatic feeder for scanning. I really dislike having to scan one page at a time. I have had the printer less than a month. It prints fine. But..... I already need more ink. And even though I get free ink for 3 months, I feel like I shouldn't have run out of ink already! I have literally only printed maybe 50 pages. After this 3 months is over, I'm switching to another brand. The ink isn't cheap for HP. And other brands are more affordable. Will give this printer to my college kid.

First of all this was a replacement for an All-in-one that I've had for about 13 years. I don't print all that often and the printer filled that need. I would have trouble printing wireless then I would sort it out, then after a while it would fail to print. But wasn't so much of a problem that I would just use the USB cable and I could print. But last week it just failed to print. (I suspect that either it just gave out or they sent an update the disabled the printing. Since it's been awhile since I've updated the firmware I suspect the printer finally died.After spending a few hours looking at all the HP printers and reading the reviews I still went ahead and purchased this printer for a couple of reasons. 1. I have an HP computer and it seemlessly connects without to much hassle and 2. the price of the printer. This is because I need a printer but don't use all that much.Hooking up and getting the printer set up was fairly easy. I downloaded the app to the computer and started there then went and downloaded the app to the phone. So started on the computer and then kinda worked both the phone and computer at the same time. But it set up fairly easy and quickly. That said for me was easy as I can mess up an easy task on the computer. Not the best at tech.During the set up was asked If I wanted to sign up for instant ink which I refused, because the plans charge you for printing, yes they charge you per page on paper that you've already paid for. So for 10 pages a month it's $0.99 /$1.25CAD, and it goes up from there with 50 pages $3.99/$5.49CAD, 100 pages (they recommend) $5.99/$7.49CAD, 300 pages $11.99/$13.99CAD and finally 700 pages $24.99?$28.99CAD. These are all pages per month. WITHOUT ENROLLING IN THE INSTANT INK OR HP+ PROGRAM YOU GET THE ONE YEAR WARRANTY. With the HP+ then it's 2 years. and some other features. One is that you get 24/7 built in printer security, but I suspect that they monitor your printer, because they need to know how low your ink is so they can send you replacement ink and how many pages your printing. But as I said you can opt out of this while your setting up the printer. That said I declined all the offers, and the setup went smoothlyPrinting speed compared to my old printer is faster, but then again in the tech world 13 years makes a big difference in speed and quality. Noise wise again it's quite compared to the old printer. Quality was good and this fit's my needs as I'm not using for business or printing a lot.The ink that comes with the printer according to some of the reviews is just enough for printing test pages and I believe they do this on purpose, I did buy the black in cartridge with the printer, should have bought the color as well. (My bad) but then I can either buy at Amazon or Walmart. I had 1 page and 1 copy to make and the ink full filled both tasks.This is what HP says about the ink cartridges: "As a reminder, your printer is intended to work only with cartridges that have a new or reused HP chip or circuitry, and it uses dynamic security measures to block cartridges using a non-HP chip or circuitry. Periodic firmware updates will maintain the effectiveness of these measures and block cartridges that previously worked. A reused HP chip or circuitry enables the use of reused, remanufactured, and refilled cartridges. For more information, go to www.hp.com/learn/ds ". Part of the security is that they can update the printer and cartridges that used to work will not work in the future. Will wait and see what happens and update the stars.Finally if and when they decide to disable my cartridges and I get more that a year out of the printer the price I paid will not have hurt, and they will look to another company's printers that do not have the restrictions.Tech support I rated 3 stars, but will update if I need to contact and the outcome. The rest will be on how the performance turns out when I need to print more pages and with replacement cartridges.

Set up was lame, I don't want to download anyone's stupid ap- I just want to print my things and go about my life. It kept saying it couldnt finish set up and the ap couldnt keep up with how quickly I was moving through the set up process. Two turn-it-off-and-back-ons and it works fine. And No, I don't need 50% overpriced ink delivered to my house on a monthly schedule- I hate that they push this but appreciate that I don't HAVE to set this up. I'm fine purchasing ink on Amazon or wherever.I purchased this to print some things for small children so it will do and it was on sale. Also, replacement ink was around $34, says it lasts 3 months.The first 2 print jobs were very VERY slow, however after that all other jobs have been fairly quick printed. Color is fair, not the best color print quality ever but for kids crafts and such this is perfect!

I wanted a home printer, nothing expensive. This fit the bill. It was easy to connect to internet and start using. You get 3 months of ink free.  I also got paper for another 1.99.I’ll probably cancel the ink refill after the freebie expires. I don’t print that much. Other people have said the printer stops working after they cancel the free months of ink. They want you to buy the ink from them.

reviewTitle: It Makes Quality Copies But It BLOWS Through Ink!
reviewDescription: My son needed to print out materials for his Criminology class and it took the entire supplied ink cartridges as well as most of another that we purchased from the store. The quality is good but I can see the replacement ink becoming expensive if he has too much to print in the future. The printer certainly comes in very handy for him and his school work. We are grateful for something that prints well and that was ultimately not very expensive!

The printer was really easy to set up, took no time at all.  I have had no problems with it.  I was worried that I would have trouble connecting to the WiFi, being it is kinda far from the router.  I have had no problems connecting and the print quality is great.  The ink goes fast but I think that is with all printers.

I bought this so i could print things for school It’s been great. But Its not the fastest. Its cheap for a printer so i just bad to buy this. The color is decent. Its not big so it fits comfortably in my room. Comes with three free months of ink which can be handy. Its as portable as a normal printer is. Its really easy since it easily connects to my phone and uses airprint
Very nice printer, easy set up, nice print jobs.  Just what I need as a retiree for small jobs.

This printer appears rather flimsy & I had a bit of trouble with setup, but I contacted support on the amazon site and everything was made simple.  I've used it once for 20 pages and it works well  For the price, I'd say it was a bargain - so far, so good.

reviewTitle: Good for foundation freezer paper quilting!
reviewDescription: It is so nice to print patterns onto freezer paper for foundation paper piecing. Helps make quilting difficult patterns exact.

Bought this during Prime Days for a family member to use with their laptop. Easy to set up, easy to use for someone who was not computer savvy, could not be more satisfied with this product! It was very inexpensive, yet does everything it promises. A truly good purchase.
This printer is perfect for those who don't need two sided  or auto feed copying. High print quality, compact and lightweight, this printer is perfect for retirees.

reviewTitle: I was looking for an inexpensive printer
reviewDescription: I purchased this for a friend that needed a printer. Well worth the price and works great!

reviewTitle: That it was easy to set ups
reviewDescription: I like that it was easy to work Thank you and again Thank you ❤️❤️ Love it
Have had no problems.  Prints and copies good which is what I mainly use it for.

I almost didn’t buy this product as some of the reviews got me nervous but let me say it’s pretty easy to setup. Printing speed is a bit slow but it’s worth the wait. I tested printing a photo and it was perfect the color was vibrant but obviously it uses up a lot of ink. Very light weight easy to move around, I was able to download the app on my laptop and phone and that makes it easier to use. Overall I would recommend.

We went from a very old model to this one trying to save some money on the cartridges and not only the old one prints better but the setting interface is so much friendlier and capable. I'm talking about a printer that has been close to 10 years in use.
The printer worked for 3 months right up until it needed new ink. Now nothing works. It prints half a page. The SmartApp is not user friendly.
Very bad printer, keep disconnected from wifi after just 1sheet printed., to reset have to disconnected from the outlet, the on-off button doesn't work.
Can not figure out how to scan multiple pages at once. Also ink cartridges are expensive and you go through so many of them
Scanner sucks and connections horrible only good for printing got to have a compatible wifi for Bluetooth to work can't be to high
Rollers started sticking the paper wrong directions and do not know how to fix but for a new printer shouldn’t have that problem

This is the worst printer I have ever had. Holds such a small amount of paper and is very difficult to load. Replacing the ink cartridges is equally awkward. It constantly goes off line and I have to shut it down and restart the printer and PC.

Got the printer hooked up works like it should but no thanks to HP. Out of the box there is instructions which are vague. says go to 123.hp.com for the right drivers to install. Immediately a virtual assistant pops up asking for your name phone number and model number. said they could help with easy step by step from a technician. I figured why not. Guy calls me within 5 minutes. does a few things and a fatal error notification pops up. said my computer is corrupt can't install the drivers. Tried selling me several internet security packages from $200-$500 depending on what you wanted. Told him no. then tried selling me a $90 fee to fix the issue to install the drivers. I hung up. found the right drivers on HP.support.com and it walked me right through the install and it works good. buyer beware of the BS support at 123.hp.com

Instant Ink is ridiculous. If you are paying more thinking instant ink makes it worth it- it isn’t unless you print out a lot. Make sure to cancel your subscription as well. Also I’ve had a hard time with the printer itself with WiFi connection problems.
I hate to say anything bad but I have to buy instant ink for it to work properly.

This is by far the worst printer I have ever "rented." I say "rented" because you won't own the printer. HP will shut off your ability to use the printer if you don't pay for their subscription service. I already had a bad feeling about this printer on the first day. I work in IT from home and had an easy enough time setting the printer up. I installed the ink that came with the printer, printed a couple of test pages, and left it alone. The next day while working, I needed to print a document for work. I go to select print, and nothing happens. Then I get a notification that the printer is out of ink. Well, fine. I assumed the first ink that came with it only had enough for a couple of prints, so I replaced the ink. Page prints. OK. A couple of weeks later, I need to print something else. I go to print, and nothing happens. I check my settings, and the printer is offline. I see all the indicator lights are on, so I assume the printer has gone to sleep, so I press the power button once. Nothing. I start pressing other buttons, trying to wake it. Nothing. Finally, I hold down the power button, and still, nothing happens. The printer does not power cycle. Finally, I unplug the printer, wait about 30 seconds, and plug it back in. Then it finally powers up and allows a print. Fast forward a couple more weeks, and I need to make a print. (As you can tell by now, I do not have the need to print a lot.) So, I try to print, and nothing. I am about to get back into settings and get a notification pop-up that tells me that payment for my subscription plan has failed and that I will not be allowed to print until I change the payment method. OK, I understand why the subscription payment failed, and it was because I was issued a new card after the old one showed up with a fraudulent charge and I had the card replaced and simply forgot to update the information on the HP subscription. So... card was updated, and I was allowed to print. The thing that really started making me angry at that point was that I had used this ink cartridge maybe three times total on three one-page prints. The ink was full. So, here I was, trying to print on a printer I paid for in full, along with HP's stupid printer cartridges, and yet, they had control of the printer and decided when I could and could not use it. Fast forward again. I go to make a print, and the printed document comes out all faded. I print another copy, and it still looks faded and blank in spots. I remove the ink cartridge, shake it, and replace it. Still, another faded print. Finally, I replace the ink cartridge (which should still be full at this point), and then, you guessed it, I got my print. On to the next print. I go to make a print, and it shows the paper is empty. I see there are a few sheets left in the carriage. I stick in about a 1/4" stack of paper. The printer shows empty. I tap the paper stack down to make sure it is meeting the rollers. Still empty. I take out half of the paper stack and still nothing. I remove about half of that, and THEN it finally registers the paper. Apparently, the printer only works when it is loaded with about 15 sheets of paper at a time. Literally every single time I have tried to use this horrible thing, I have to spend 15-20 minutes troubleshooting. The latest thing it does now is to go offline every day. It won't reconnect with a power cycle or reboot. You have to go back in and set up the WiFi settings each time. I only need to make a print every now and then, and each time has been like building a printer from scratch. It would be faster to drive to Walgreens, make the prints, and drive back home. I will NEVER purchase another HP product after this. This entire experience has been a complete insult as a customer.

Summary:- tried, unsuccessfully, to set the printer up to print from my son’s iPhone and his laptop- printer set-up app will not allow connecting to the university wifi as it is a public network (according to the HP agent)- the set up app does not give an option to complete the set up with an Ethernet cable (cable NOT provided) even though the printer does have an Ethernet port - the manual specifically discourages the use of the Ethernet port as it will restrict the use of some features. Not to mention that obviously the use of an Ethernet cable only allows connecting to a computer and not a smart phone- HP recommends on their website to use the chat option for support as it is faster. Customer support via chat is terrible in response time and support provided- in the end, 40 min wasted on the chat - problem not resolved - stuck with a printer I cannot return as it is past the return deadline - ordered an Ethernet cable and praying it will at least let my son print from his laptopDetails:I purchased this printer earlier this summer for my son to take to his college dorm room. He moved in yesterday and proceeded to set it up to print from his iPhone and his laptop using wifi. He is on campus in the dorms so the wifi is the one provided by the university to the students. The printer would not let us set it up saying this wifi network was not supported by the printer/hp app, to try another network or contact HP support. The printer does have an Ethernet port (cable NOT provided) but the setup app only offered the option to set up by wifi, no option to set up using an Ethernet cable. The printer manual  also specifically discourages the use of an Ethernet cable and warns it will not allow access to all the printer features. They even mention that they cover the Ethernet port on the printer with a sticker to deter people from using it. And obviously you cannot connect an Ethernet cable to a smart phone. The printer does NOT come with an Ethernet cable so we could not test it. I contacted HP support via their website chat using the link provided in the error message. I had to wait 20 min before being connected to an agent. But the frustrating part was the delay in response from the agent between each single question/answer. The agent asked 2 basic questions in 2 posts - first post was to provide info to identify myself and the printer - second post was to confirm my problem statement. I answered each question immediately and had to wait at least 5 min after each answer to get his feedback. I know it was at least that long as each post on the chat is marked with the time it was sent. After 15 min of wait (in addition to the initial 20 min to be connected to an agent), he answered that the university wifi was a public network and therefore would not work. He advised to try using the hotspot from my son’s iPhone. I answered that my son’s phone carrier/plan does not allow for hotspot so that couldn’t work. I once again waited and waited for an answer and gave up. I cannot return the printer as it is past the return deadline. I ordered an Ethernet cable and hope that will work with the laptop even though the setup does not offer that option and the manual specifically says that connecting via Ethernet is not as good as it does not allow access to all the features. As for printing from the iPhone I guess that is not possible. Could not be more disappointed by the terrible customer support and lack of information in the manual!

Not worth it.(Not one for reviews but...) Quick overview:• Hypothesis: HP Printer is only able to be “installed” on (1) device, Customers are unable to adjust wi-fi passwords/or providers, and potential un-successful client services offerings and spam risk.o HP “Customer Support” OR “Home Support” is located within various regions. Unless you are looking to spend your time on hold with the representatives who are disguised as Sales Spam Artists (potentially hacking into your computer software system), or navigating your way through the “self-service” systems, Individuals and owners alike waste over 2+ hours on “hold” only to lead to further unresolved issues and even worse data breaches of contracts and information systems.o The Websites/Apps, Directions, and Instructions provided within the company lead to dissatisfied customer experiences.o Unless you’re trying to look for a “quick fix”, it might work in the beginning but long term – the value of the worth, from my perspective, I haven’t been able to witness.***If curious, notes below:Previously having formerly invested in other brand name printers, I was unaware of my expectations… especially from a well-respected brand of HP.After purchasing the “HP DeskJet 2755 All-in-One Printer” or  “HP DeskJet 2755e Wireless Color All-in-One Printer with Bonus 6 Months Instant Ink with HP+” on 04/22 from Amazon; was incredibly excited and pleasantly surprised with the seamless installation.Once registering the device, customers are informed of the partnership with HP Instant Ink, which works closely together with HP Development Company, L.P. to schedule automated “ink” delivery. Packages are presented with various price ranges to the customer - boiling down to a per ink cartridge and anticipated number allotment of the number of pages being published by the owner, every month.For the first 1-2 months, hadn’t experienced anything alarming. However, had unexpected technical challenges which shortly developed upon updating the Wi-Fi password.– Out of security purposes, it is recommended in general to update passwords and login information ~ about every 90ish days. -When attempting to re-connecting to the Wi-Fi, customers immediately might experience unanswered questions; “bot-chats” that provide additional links to articles within the website that do not directly answer the question originally situation; and when finally getting in touch with “HP Support” (via phone call) are then confronted with irrelevant questions - unrelated to the product malfunctions - and then are continued to be ridiculed with various recommendations of “security systems” packages. Whether this is purchased or not, they have “control” or “access” to the computer. Unfortunately, the computer was unable to be revived due to the unexpended circumstance which led to a Product Technician (of a well-named company) reviewing the computer, and communicating “I have never seen anything like this before.”With the original computer being hacked and shut down, a re-installation within a brand-new year-to-date computer, the attempt was made with HP Development Company, L.P (multiple.) No surprise, but once again was unable to connect to the Wi-Fi. (Within consideration for the company and due diligence of the Wi-Fi Provider, multiple other devices were able to reconnect within a blink, and multiple attempts to re-install the HP Development Company, L.P. “HP DeskJet 2755 All-in-One Printer” or  “HP DeskJet 2755e Wireless Color All-in-One Printer with Bonus 6 Months Instant Ink with HP+”.)Buying items from Amazon is much more convenient, however, there is something really to be said of this product not being able to be returned, especially with the false advertisement and guarantees.From a company perspective, can’t help but be concerned about the ethics and values within the HP business. Highly would recommend considering alternative replacements for the Product, Engineering, and Human Resources departments to be able to hold the brand standards and values we have all longed for when purchasing a product, especially one so accredited as such.Additionally, if the machine is unable to correspond with basic security policies and password updates - the potential buyer and customer need to be made aware of this within the original description before moving forward with payment and further “challenges”.Best of luck.

reviewTitle: Hardly could call this a printer
reviewDescription: Let me start off by saying I’ve literally never considered writing a review for a product in my entire life. This “printer” (if you can even call it that - which is a stretch in my opinion) is quite literally the worst product I’ve ever had the unfortunate experience of using.Let’s start off with what works.1. The scanning.Ok moving on, let’s look at what doesn’t work.1. This is completely unusable unless you sign up for an HP account. Not sure why I need an account with HP (who will no doubt lose and or sell all my information). Whatever Product Manager at HP decided that this was a smart business decision, I hope suffers from some terrible inconveniences for eternity so that they can understand a tiny piece of the frustration they have unleashed on the world.2. This thing hardly prints. Sure, day 1 you take it out of the box, install new ink cartiridges, sign up for a useless and silly HP account and print some papers. Amazing! Day 2 this thing stops working. First my color ink no longer works… ok despite all diagnostics saying my brand new 1 day old ink cartridge is full, I replace it, and amazing it prints again. $20 a page what a great device.One week later I want to print another single page, and wow what do you know my FULL AND HARDLY USED black ink cartridge no longer works. Replaced and wow amazing the printer can finally print another single page.I’ve owned this printer for 2+ years and managed to print maybe 10 pages on this device. 10 pages that required 3-4 ink cartridge replacements.2. The app the HP makes you use to setup/maintenance this printer is hot flaming garbage. WHY DOES A PRINTER NEED AN APP, SOMEONE PLEASE EXPLAIN TO ME THE LOGIC BEHIND THIS. CAN WE NOT JUST BUILD A PRINTER THAT PRINTS?!?3. None of the maintenance tools on this printer work even a little. The app consistently breaks while attempting to clean the printhead or do any type of diagnostic. Although, I’m not at all surprised that HP would build an app to intentionally not work so they can sell you more ink cartridges.Let’s call this for what it is, a barely functioning piece of garbage that is built to 1. Collect your information ( forcing you to sign up for an account and use an app just to interact with it) 2. Sell you more inkI’m not sure if HP hired the Juicero team to build this “printer” for them, but there is one thing this printer has done for me - I will never purchase another HP product for the rest of my life. Even if I am given a mountain of free printers, paper and ink from HP I will immediately toss it into the dumpster where it belongs.I’d not recommend anyone to ever purchase this product nor anything else from HP until they build an actual printer that works and stop forcing customers to sign up for a ridiculous account that, let’s be honest, not a single person in this universe wants.0/10 would not buy again nor would use again. The experience with this product is so bad I simply cannot trust this company to build anything of use ever again. Buy at your own peril.

reviewTitle: Poor quality at first, soon became unusable
reviewDescription: Up until today, I had printed maybe 4 pages on this thing. I don't print a lot. I bought it in December. It lives in its own little dust-free cupboard, and I pull it out when I need to print. Today I have spent about an hour trying to troubleshoot and update it. First it printed a shabby-looking page from my email. I was really unimpressed with the print quality when I first booted it up, but I figured I don't need much. I should have known better than to buy HP again. Etc. But today, it is just churning out smeary mess after smeary mess. I'm using brand new Instant Ink cartridges in a printer that has printed fewer than a dozen pages and is less than a year old.So I tried to just print it again, maybe up the quality. It quit talking to my phone. Then when I tried to print with my phone or computer, it just said the printer was "busy". I used the HORRENDOUS admin software to install an update. It logged me out while I was waiting, then the printer turned off and wouldn't turn back on. Is it safe to unplug it? I don't know! It was updating the firmware. SO SLOPPY! I unplugged it and plugged it back in, and found that all of my print clients still said it was busy, so it's clearly something that the printer is communicating. For no reason, 15 minutes later, one of my pages spits out. Still looks like blurry garbage.EVERY SINGLE ASPECT of my experience as an HP customer here has been AWFUL. The printer is of poor quality and produces poor results. The fact that they make you chuck your ink in the trash when you subscribe to instant ink is ridiculous. The software is ATROCIOUS. The printer is non-functional without a screen of some kind. The little LED indicators that are there are not sufficient. You have to open an app or some piece of software that launches a browser or frame with the management software served by the printer loaded in it. Doesn't work if the printer isn't working, or if you have network trouble, or if you're a normal human being and have no idea how to figure any of this out. They could have made a printer that worked well without a screen, but this is not it.I previously worked in IT, I have managed fleets of HP printers. I'm pretty familiar with how their JetDirect-derived environments work. I am flabbergasted that all of this is in this state in 2023. I can't believe how bad the UX is at every step. The only piece of this experience that looks like it gets any attention at all is the HP Smart app (that's a terrible name! Don't invite the comparison to "smart" when most people are opening this app because your product is being "dumb"! I digress), and obviously that's because this is the portal to recurring revenue.The PRODUCT IN FRONT OF ME needs to also be functional and good or I won't want to use your subscription service.I will NEVER, EVER make the mistake of purchasing a product of ANY KIND from HP again. I am done. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me like a million more times, and what is even wrong with me? But I've had enough. Bad, bad product from an apathetic company with terrible support who doesn't understand the first thing about UX or customer success.

Are you wanting a no hassle, easy to use printer? Then keep looking! I have had this thing for two months or so and regret this purchase every time I try to use it.* Doesn't turn on/come out of sleep mode? CHECK - which means I basically have to unplug the power cord and wait for it to start back up every time I want to use it* Can't edit printing capabilities? YOU BETCHA! - now granted, this is probably my fault. I saw (what I thought was) a decent printer that wasn't going to break the bank and was like 'sure! Let's go for it'. You know why it doesn't break the bank? I can't edit diddlysquat in the printer settings. It took me 11 tries (yes, 11. I kept the page each time to try to figure out why it wasn't working) and AN ENTIRE ink cartridge to figure out how to print the photo collage the way I wanted it. In the end, I had to create a custom paper size (which is why I had to keep testing it to see how it printed) all because I couldn't just manually adjust my margin sizes or or print at 90% of the original size. If you need to print anything besides basic stuff PLEASE pay a little more for a different printer that gives you these adjustable features. They'll save you hours of finagling and a massive headache* STILL don't have my printed photo collage? Unfortunately yes - Now that I finally have my custom paper setting and have replaced the ink, I am working on fighting the printer to feed the glossy photo paper. I honestly don't know if this is the printer's fault or user error, but after everything I've gone through with this today, I just don't have the patience or energy to try to figure it out. I have been working on this project for 4 hours now and still don't have the single page finished product I am trying to print out.*Small footprint? I guess - yes, this printer has a smaller footprint than most, but it's kind of negated by the fact that the paper feed at the back still needs to lean out at an angle. Sure, it's not a huge deal, but I got this smaller printer to sit on top of a storage dresser thing because my desk is teeny tiny and because of this, I'm constantly having to pull it away from the wall and hold it while it prints so that the paper can feed through...that's when I get the paper far enough down the shoot because I seriously can't figure that part out. It seems to change every time I need to print something. Again, my fault or faulty machinery? Who knows, but do you really want to have to fight the printer over something so simple every single time?Overall this isn't a printer that I would buy again and I would strongly encourage anyone looking at this to just spend a little more and go with something else that won't be so problematic. Are all of these things the printer's fault or is some of it due to user error? I don't know. But I do know that I have set up and used multiple (6+) printers in my house in my life and have NEVER had this many issues with one.I would return this and buy a better one (from a different company because HP has been going downhill for a few years now and this was the final straw) but unfortunately for me, I moved right after I got this and it was too late to return after I gave it a fair chance to not be a pain in my tush. Sucks for me, but I guess I'll be buying another printer now and throwing this one into some dark corner until I want to fight with it again

UPDATE:I had to edit my review. I got this a year or two ago I rarely use it but when I need it I want it to work. I wouldn't recommend this printer to anyone. I power it off once I'm done using it and every time I turn it back on the printer is offline and won't work. I'm a technical person and had a work around. I would have to uninstall it and then reinstall it using my computer but now that doesn't even work. It has issues finding the network and staying on it, it doesn't remember the network or any details like it should. Now when I try to reinstall it, it sends a password to my computer, I put it in and it says it's wrong. I don't bother with the HP app that never worked properly.It also started having issues pulling paper down into it to print on, I would have to hand feed the paper into it and I barely ever use it!So, now that I can't reinstall it I have to spend money on a new printer that works.If you're not technically savvy I wouldn't recommend this printer EVER and even if you are I still don't recommend it, hopefully I have saved someone from this headache! BUYER BEWAREI bought this because the price was good and I just needed a basic printer to use every once in a rare while with my windows 10 computer. When it's working it works fine but it was a little tricky to set up and buggy so if I could do it all over I doubt I would purchase this printer again. One day we lost power a few times and after that the printer showed as being offline and nothing would fix it. I'll describe how I set it up and also how I fixed it and made it show back online again.Original Review:To set it up you have to plug it in and power it on, then find the ink cartridge area and place them inside. Once that is done you need to google hp smart app and download that. I will tell you I had a hard time downloading the app for some reason but after much clicking got it to download. Once you get the app open it and click the + to add a new printer, from this point the wizard should take over and find your hp deskjet 2700. Just follow the instructions and that should get the printer up and going.After the power outage the printer showed as offline and wouldn't print anything for me anymore. The only fix that worked for me was to uninstall hp smart and the printer from my computer. Restart the computer and download hp smart all over again then follow the instructions to set up the printer like I did when I first got it. It is working again now but I have a funny feeling I may have to do this again at some point, hope this helps someone.UPDATE: I have changed my stars to just 1. I bought this last December, it is now 6/21/2022 and I have had to reinstall this printer 4 times so far. I don't know why it will suddenly show up as "offline" and not work, could be due to a power outage happening then when power comes back on it glitches but I don't know for sure. All I do know is that my old printer never did this, I would not recommend this printer for this reason. If you don't mind it suddenly not working and having to reinstall it all over again I would say go for it, if you don't want the hassle keep looking,  it's a headache especially when you really need to use it and you can't.

reviewTitle: HP+ Ink will not work if you are disconnected from internet this printer is the worst
reviewDescription: Was hoping the HP Deskjet all in one printer 2755E would be lighter and easier to use then an old large EPSON printer. And the HP+ ink delivery sounded time saving and convenient, **But what they fail to mention is that the HP+ Instant ink WILL NOT WORK if you are not connected to the internet and signed in. That means if your WiFi is down you can't print or make a copy or even scan an item.Printer worked for 2 weeks, then stopped. It just sounded like it was printing but only blank paper would come out. We sign up for the HP+ and order ink, thinking maybe the cartridges that came with it were low of defective, but when they arrive we still can't connect or print.Ran all trouble shooters, would not reconnect to the printer. Tried the original WiFi connection buttons, Says connected then in less then 3 seconds it cant find the printer. Even removed it completely and factory reset it.HOURS were spent by our own tech support doing everything possible to fix the issue with every port, driver, hardware, updates, tried from multiple devices, kept saying printers unavailable or status unknown.Then just says offline, then back to unknown status.HP SMART Troubleshoot says everything is fine but cant print test page because it doesn't know where the printer went. Other diagnostics say it doesn't exist. HP Virtual assistant Suggests everything I already tried. Waited 57 to chat with a person, no one came.Called today was on hold for over 1 hr 45 min(not including time speaking to a person) which I was transferred to 5 different people, Each saying i needed to speak to a different department, The oe woman had us on hold so music was playing but you could also hear everything she was saying because she was not on mute. Then wait and wait, Was hung up on. Got called back 9 min later to say that I needed to be transferred again to somewhere else, which is what each person is telling me, on hold for over 20 min again, to be told i need to talk to a dif dept AGAIN, tranfered again, on hold for 9 min then same person picks up and say ok I am going to transfer you to this department WHICH WAS THE SAME THING HE SAID 9  MIN AGO, on hold again forever someone picks up and says hello then hangs up.Even the HP doctor program cant fix or find it. Manually connect it to USB directly, Wont let me access settings to reconnect to internet. Factory reset, Hardwired Ethernet to printer to laptop and still is saying it cant find the printer. They say it must be defective.Then realize cant even use NEW HP+ INSTA INK bought to make copies of the papers needed because the ink ONLY WORKS IF YOU ARE CONNECTED TO THE INTERNET. Never have I ever had so much trouble with one printer, HP phone support took 2 and half hrs to be transferred 5 times and then hung up on twice.Gave up, cancelled the HP+ subscription online.Asked amazon to call, got the call immediately. Customer service rep Subash was the only pleasant part of this printer and let us be able to return its defectiveness and was very helpful and nice and explained everything on returning the item.WILL NEVER BUY AN HP PRINTER AGAIN.

reviewTitle: Don't waste your money - App required, ads, and basic jobs take forever
reviewDescription: For an eighty-dollar printer, it does the basic things, but barely.Setup: The instruction manual is useless - it just tells you how to unpackage it and to visit the website for most everything else, which means you'll have no idea what the icons on the printer mean without an internet search. The printer setup was super annoying. First, you are required to download the mobile app to connect to the printer - there is no way around this. I tried to connect via computer WiFi and Bluetooth, but both wouldn't find the printer. The only way to get the printer on your network is to get the app that endlessly prompts you to sign up for HP+ subscription program. After declining and declining, you can finally complete the setup. The program sounds like a scam - you are required to keep the printer on and connected to the internet at all times, you must opt into sending printer user data, you must agree to only ever using HP ink, and you need a credit card on file so that you can be charged monthly after the 6 months trial - a deal-breaker for me.Printing: After the printer is connected and fully set up, you will find that there is no paper tray. You have to manually load a small stack of sheets (10-15 at most) to the back of the printer. You'll also need to manually open the paper tray and pull out the extension otherwise it won't print, and without the extension, paper will fall to the floor. A minor annoyance if you don't print often like me. However, this thing is somewhat loud and slow - but still is on par with other budget printers, so not a deal breaker. But, the print quality is only for documents - do not expect to be able to print pictures or posters with any sort of quality AT ALL.Ink: After printing only 4 documents, I'm starting to see a dip in ink levels, which is crazy and makes me think this printer is just a way to get more ink subscriptions. It is convenient to only need two cartridges (My Canon Pixma took 6), but it comes at a cost.Scanning: To use the scan function, you have to create an account in the HP Smart desktop/mobile app - there's no getting around this. Luckily, you can create an account just with an email.  I scan a lot of documents, so it was vital to be able to use the scanner and IT IS THE WORST. Both the quality of the scan and the amount of time it takes is just ridiculous. The alignment is also off. It took over 5 minutes to scan one color photo at 1200 dpi, and about 1 minute at 600 dpi, but the quality dropped dramatically at 300 dpi - which would've been good to know before purchasing since this is what I do most. Documents scan around 20-25 seconds for 300 dpi, which is abhorrent, too. I could use my phone's camera, but I need to quickly and easily scan docs to PDF to my computer - so it's kind of a deal-breaker for me.

I cannot emphasize this enough but do NOT buy this printer. I bought it because it was a decent price, and had a copy and scan feature and now I know why it was so cheap.So I setup up the printer and it took all of 10 minutes. For the first month I was happy with it. Everything worked fine, I was able to print and scan things with relative ease. Well.. after about a month everything stopped working. I'm unable to scan or print anything using the hp smart app. I get in contact with tech support and I had 3 different calls. The first one told me I had to setup a 2.4ghz access point, even though it was working fine before on my 5ghz access point. So I setup a 2.4ghz access point and I'm still not able to get the printer to connect to my router. The next two tech support agents inform me that I need to switch out my printer cartridges because they are setup cartridges. Sure enough they do say they are setup cartridges on the cartridge themselves however there should be plenty of ink left in them because I've hardly use the printer to justify ingthem out. The ink levels say they are just fine on the interface too. But no, because they are setup cartridges and I haven't enrolled in instant ink they programmed the printer to brick itself. So I can't scan any items or print anything until I get new cartridges, supposedly.. I've yet to replace the cartridges. The website says that you can continue to use the setup cartridges until the ink runs out. That is I guess not true. So now until I enroll in instant ink or go out and buy new cartridges I won't be able to use the printer AND I can't enroll in instant ink because they programmed the printer to essentially brick itself until I switch the cartridges. This is so much more complicated than it needs to be. After this printer I will never give HP my money again. Please, for your own mental health and happiness don't put yourself through this. It's not worth it. I should be able to just use my printer normally without this whole rigmarole.

reviewTitle: Great printer when it wants to print
reviewDescription: I'm sure this is a great printer when i wants to print. I have never seen a printer that has so many errors. The very first time I tried printing, it had an error.. not sure what I did to clear the error.. but then it printed the same document 5 times... Second time I am trying to print to it... you guess it.. it has an error. Nothing on the screen tells you the error and the HP Smart app on the computer tells me it is ready to go!Spend a little more money and get a better printer.

I returned this printer.  I do not need an expensive high quality printer. I do want a printer that is easy to use and prints fairly decent.  I didn't find this printer to be 'easy' to set up but wasn't horrible.  It did become a nightmare to print anything after the set up.  I have a mac book, and an iphone.  Everytime I tried to print from any device I had to power the printer down and restart it.  When it does print its fairly slow, but prints a decent copy.

reviewTitle: HP SMART App does not work!!!!!
reviewDescription: Whie the printer is nice and makes nice copies, I am so sorry I bought this and now only after my return window has closed, I have had nothing but problem with the APP. All was working fine until about a week ago when the APP froze. Then it disappeared all together . When I try to open all it does is spin. I have tried every fix recommended and nothing. I cannot even uninstall it.  i need to be able to scan and now I cannot. I cannot see the page that monitor my in levels, etc. The APP is awful and in searching I find I am not the only one to encounter this. I cannot spend more money to repair this. I am now stuck with a half working printer.

Overall:Printer quality: 4Instant Ink add-on: -3This is a quality printer for light home/office use. Quality is good.Big complaint: the “Instant Ink” package. Right now I believe it’s a 3 month subscription; when I got my printer it was a 6 month subscription. Sounds great: they send you ink and paper based on how often you use your printer/how many pages get reported to them electronically for a discount. Sounds good right? However, I just discovered that you can’t use any of those cartridges unless you have an active Instant Ink account. I canceled mine a couple of months ago as I wasn’t using my printer and didn’t want the monthly expense, as it had been over a year since I got my printer and no way I would remember all the details. Then today I had to print urgent tax documents and my printer wouldn’t work. After lots of customer service time, I was told that I could only use my stockpile of Instant Ink cartridges in my home office if I renewed my subscription; otherwise, I would have to purchase individual black and color HP cartridges from other retailers. I think it’s very deceptive and designed to the have the “free trial subscription” with enough lead time for people to forget that even if they are not printing, they will still charge you a monthly fee to use the cartridges that you’ve already purchased from them.

I hate this printer. It constantly needs to be turned off and back on. When it prints, it works just fine. But even doing simple tasks like scanning often require having to turn it off and on. Also, if you navigate away from the screen being printed (or if printing from your phone, if your screen goes on lock) it will print a half page and stop printing the rest of the document. So you have to sit with the item being printed up on the screen until it is entirely done printing.

reviewTitle: Buyer beware!  This printer ONLY sets up and works wirelessly on a 2G internet speed.
reviewDescription: If you have 5G internet speed, you are out of luck.  You can only use the printer with a USB cable, without the wireless function and without the 3 month ink supply offer because you cannot set it up per the enclosed instructions. You can only get the ink offer if you set it up wirelessly which you cannot do if you don't have a 2G (old) connection.  I opened the ink cartridges before discovering this unfortunate fact so could no longer return the printer. Total waste of money!

reviewTitle: Does the job.... if it's feeling like it.
reviewDescription: I try my hardest not to leave negative reviews but wow, we've hit the straw that breaks the camels back point with this thing. I love the printer in theory, and when it's working it does a perfectly serviceable job for a budget-friendly machine. I also enjoy the concept of the HP instant ink that works with it, again very cool in theory. However...Right out of the gate I've had issues with it disconnecting from the internet. I've had several tech savvy friends (and not to toot my own horn but I know my way around plenty of tech) try and help me troubleshoot why it might be doing this but we've all come up empty. I decided to ignore it, it was a budget option after all, and all I had to do to make it reconnect was get up and unplug it, wait a few seconds, plug it back in, and wait a few more seconds before returning to my computer. Annoying, but fine, so long as it did what it was supposed to do. Though I am incredibly confused why there APPEARS to be a "power button" but it does nothing. As a matter of fact I can't get any of the buttons on it to do anything, except when the paper has run out and I hit the orange button to let it know I have indeed fed it more paper. Are they... are they just there to make it look better? Buttons that don't seem to serve any purpose? Really not sure on that one.But what really does it for me is that as of writing this I've had the printer just shy of seven months. During such times I've printed hmm maybe 200 pages if we're including test pages. I bought this because I returned to college and it was necessary to have something to print off the long lab reports I had to work through. But I think we would qualify as very very light use. If I wasn't printing a lab report no one else was using it, or my mom might have printed a coupon now and again. Seven months.... and it no longer powers on. I've tried plugging it into various sockets to get it to light up for about a second and then nothing. Could it be the power cord? Probably. But that doesn't change the fact seven months of light use should NOT kill a power cord, let alone a printer. Absolute paperweight quality. Guess I'll just drive to staples and pay to print there.

reviewTitle: The printer is fine. Do not subscribe to instant ink
reviewDescription: I joined instant Ink because it was free for two months. Cancelled at the end and all the ink they sent (even unopened) would no longer work in my printer. You are a prisoner. What a waste. The minimum was going to be five dollars a month plus tax. I hate subscriptions. I am disgusted and will not buy HP again.  My last HP printer which worked like a charm, became unusable because there is no updated driver to support it. I used to swear by HP. Bye bye bye.

I have set it up. It printed from my phone. I tried to print from my MAC but MAC, which has found every printer from the past, can't seem to find this one.It's a sleek & pretty clean design, but even when I tried to print from my phone the next day, it became too much of a 'project', as it wasn't working.I will try again in a few days when I am more patient, and maybe I'll change this review.

reviewTitle: Needs to be installed on W10 or earlier
reviewDescription: A HP website says that this printer in W11 compatible.I tried to get it working when I installed the software on a W11 device using HP Smart.  It could not connect to the internet.I then used the HP Smart app to install the 2755 on a W10 device.  I noticed this time it showed that it was downloading a driver.  It did not do that on W11.  Anyway, it now appears to be working as it should except I can't figure out how to get the "Information Light" to go off.  I tap it, it prints some pages but stays on on.  I tap it again and it reprints the same pages and continues to stay on.The print quality on this is not as good as the 2655.  I only replaced the 2655 because it stopped connecting to the internet.  Now, I think that is because I did a clean install of W11 on the device the printer was installed on and the clean install removed the W10 driver that was on the device from before I upgraded it to W11.  It remained there during the upgrade to W11 but was wiped off when I did the clean install of W11..Amazon has agreed to let me return the 2755 so I may try and install the 2655 on my W10 device and see if it works.  If I can get the 2655 working I may return the 2755 because the print quality on the 2655 is better though I rarely print anything.  I used the 2655 mostly for scanning documents.  The build quality on the 2655 also appears to be better.Installing the ink and loading the paper was no problem.  If you have a W10 or earlier device you can install the software driverr for the 2755 on then it is a usable AIO if you don't print much.I am using the HP Instant Ink program which I like.  During the installation process HP Smart tried to push me into the HP+ program.  I declined.I can't recommend the 2755.  It is cheap and outdated.P.S.  After installing the 2755 on the W10 device I was able to get HP Smart to recognize the 2755 on my W11 devices and smartphone with a green saying all was GTG.  I have not tested printing from them.I also have not yet tested the scanning or copying features.

Seems like a great printer but...If you have 5 GHZ wifi, you cannot use this printer wirelessly. Others do, so if you need that, type in the more information box and ask specifically if it is 5GHZ compatible. Even when using 5GHZ printers in Amazon's search bar, it brought up printers that were not compatible.

reviewTitle: Does what it advertises, no more, no less.
reviewDescription: My first review was screened, so now I am deducting a star for deceptive practices. As a work from home professional, I need a printer and scanner to do basic work, and I do not generally need to print more than 20 pages per month. Similar to many other commenters, I ran into technical difficulties setting up the printer on my M1 Mac and iPhone 13 Pro Max. I ultimately had to hard wire the printer into my desktop using a third-party USB cable, which was not included in the box. What IS included in the box are the ads for an ink subscription service, and instructions for setup which only direct you to download the HP Smart App.The HP Smart App has multiple flaws, and the troubleshooting feature is circular and insane. The main problem is that, even after troubleshooting the wifi connection issue, you cannot manually download the drivers needed to recognize the printer. This is pretty basic and you should not need the app to do this. My computer is updated to macOS Monterey and could not detect the drivers. Again, I eventually had to hard wire the printer in. To this day, the HP Smart App on my phone still cannot find the printer on my network, thereby defeating the point of having a wireless printer.The most annoying thing, however, is that, even after getting through setup, the scanner does not use the feed tray, forcing you to scan each individual page of a document manually. There is no scan button on the printer, so you have to run back and forth between the printer and your computer to switch out and then scan each page. Again, this defeats the purpose of a wireless printer. The device gets two stars because it is affordable, compact and does print and scan (I have not tried the fax feature yet).
It prints a sheet about every 1/2 hour. Easy to install but unless you have the patience of a saint I would not recommend it. The print quality is ok 4 stars but it's so slooooow!

Updating my review: I’ve had to reinstall my printer multiple times now because if I don’t use it for a while then it disconnects from the internet and takes multiple tries to set it up again. This is extremely inconvenient when I need to quickly print something. I would not buy this printer again.***This printer does the basics: prints, scans, copies, and even sends mobile faxes (included for the first 2 years after purchase). The copy/scan quality is pretty good. The unit is also fairly compact and lightweight. My only complaints so far are: 1) You have to scan manually by placing documents on the glass or by using their app with a mobile device. This is pretty annoying if you've got multiple page documents that you want to scan. 2) The setup isn't as user friendly as I'd like. The printer took a while to connect to my wifi, and then took a while to be recognized on the HP app even after it was connected. The steps themselves are easy, but the printer doesn't necessarily work automatically.Overall I give it 4 stars because it's cheap, gets the basics done, and comes with some perks (like the 6 months of free ink and deep discounted products after that period ends), but I'll definitely opt for a printer with better functionality for my needs in the future.

The copy feature worked well, but that's as far as I got. After spending over an hour on the phone with hp tech support, there were no answers except "we've been having technical issues connecting with android devices. You'll need a windows device to complete the setup." I could not get a solid answer as to whether or not I'd ever be able to connect using my mobile device. I don't have a windows device, so all I've got is a really expensive paperweight right now. Very disappointing.

reviewTitle: Not happy.  Doesn't wake up on it's own.
reviewDescription: I ordered this printer to print away from home.  I've owned dozens of printers over the years for both our business and home use and have never experienced the frustration I have had with this printer.  First of all, I just want to print whatever I want to print.  I don't want automatic refills, I don't want to be connected to HP servers, I just want to print period.  After saying no enough times to the software installation options, I was finally able to get a decent color print out on plain white paper.  After numerous attempts, I finally got a few copies printed on glossy photo paper, but it involved multiple attempts to get the paper installed just right while holding my breath and standing on one foot.  When I try to print after a quiet interval, even though my laptop shows the HP printer is ready to print, the job gets stuck in the queue with a error message.  I have to clear queue and then manually turn the machine on and off again in order to wake it up enough to work again.  I'm using Windows 10 on the same laptop that works just fine with my printers at home.  I'd ready to toss this frustrating HP out a 3rd story window into a dumpster.

My printer has completely quit working after only 1 year.  The wifi connects, but nothing on the printer works anymore.  Eventually I ended up with a person on the phone (not easy to do at all), and he told me its done for.  This really bums me out.
When it works it works. Then unexpectedly at the most inopportune times it suddenly stops working, all buttons flash, no one to help, work day ruined. Spend the money.

I bought it under the assumption that it could scan. It will not scan at all, saying that it is not a feature that is included. (False advertising) It does however print and copy well so I am giving it 2 stars. Bought it primarily to scan, so pretty disappointed.

reviewTitle: Doesn’t work with chrome books- waste of money
reviewDescription: Can’t print from my chrome book. I have to print from my phone- very disappointed. The printer for one page at a time is ok for hard copies.

reviewTitle: Don’t Order it!! You can’t print anything without any subscription!!
reviewDescription: I ordered it from Amazon nd with a bundle.  And extra cartilage, that aren’t a never will be compatible and will never work without a microchip from Instant ink.  You need to have a subscription plan.  Don’t believe them. When they tell you your printer will work cause it won’t!!!!!!!!!!!  I cancelled my plan that day I called when it didn’t work.  I had ink but cause I didn’t update my payment plan I can’t print!! When I had plenty of ink!!  Shame on Amazon that did tell me if I brought this it wouldn’t work without out and shame onHP that they won’t print with the subscription.  I called nd stayed on the phone for two hours.  Nd they to made it clear that I can’t print without a plan that I had to pay every month. No one told me when I purchased it, weren’t you can have print without having a plan, but at the end of the day you have to have a subscription so don’t buy this printer cause I just wasted money. !  If I don’t pay every mini can’t print!!! Shame on Amazon for not letting us know nd HP for doing this!!!!! DONT BUY THIS PRINTER!!!!!!!

reviewTitle: Fails to work after several prints.
reviewDescription: Purchase this if you want to waste time and money.All the sudden after one month you try to print and “printer is busy” yet is online in the app, and your device from which you plan to print, and there’s simply no explanation. Even trouble shooting doesn’t have a print queue to see what the hold up is, why some pages will print, others won’t…Then suddenly it will turn on and print ink filled “test” pages that wipe out 25% of your expensive ink without your permission.And then, 5 pages of the same page of your 25 document you tried to print.There is zero logic for this - HP is a conspiracy to make you go insane. There is no reason the product should be this inconsistent and fail to work normally.Terrible quality, low speed, ineffective use. Do not buy.

As an IT professional I've had the unfortunate opportunity to use and deal with alot of printes from all different manufacturers. This has to be the worst, most unreliable, unnecessary, despicable printer to have ever been made. I've had this horrible thing a year and every single time I've needed to print something its disappointed me or simply not worked. Its also a nightmare to setup. I dont want an ink service. I dont want an app. I dont want a printer that broadcasts its own bs SSID. I just want to assign an IP and press print. No the printer doesn't need to reach out to the internet.... constantly. I hate this printer so much I will never again buy or endorse anyone else purchasing a HP printer even a "simple" one. Run far away from this printer and consider yourself lucky for doing so. What absolute unnecessary hell this thing is.

reviewTitle: Will not connect over and over but claims it’s connected
reviewDescription: This is by far the most finicky piece of technology I have ever owned. I rarely write poor reviews but the frustration this printer causes compelled me to come back 8 months later and write this. 2/10 items will be able to be printed. 8/10 times the printer will lose connection to the WiFi but when you run a wireless network test it’ll pass and give an excellent signal strength rating. I’ve troubleshot this so many times I’d be better off using my time to DRIVE TO WORK AND MAKE $100 to replace it. Such a time consuming process and a  waste of desk space. Actually it’s currently occupying my kitchen table because the desk one room from the brand new WiFi router wasn’t close enough for it. Do not waste your time. I swear the Reddit pages troubleshooting it will deter you. I wish I could dig my old hp printer out of the landfill and bring it back because it was far more reliable even with a broken scanner. I would give it 0 stars if I could.

I don't need to print a lot, just a few documents here and there and some forms that need a signature, so I went for a cheap printer and got the HP DeskJet 2755e. My first experience trying to print something was the most frustrating experience I have had with a piece of technology. First, The printer didn't recognize the HP ink cartridges that came in the printer's box as authentic HP ink (so it won't be eligible for the instant ink program). The first document I tried to print was a 30-page word document with mostly text and some pictures. After two pages, the printer experienced an error and cancelled the print job. After two more failed attempts, I converted the document to a PDF and tried again and that printed about 10 pages before the next error occurred. Printing directly through the HP Smart app seemed to work better. I'm the end, it took me 10 attempts at printing, 4 hours (including installation time), and half of the ink from the included cartridges to just get my first document printed.As far as I can tell, the pros are: 1. Price 2. Print quality is good enough for printing documents at home.Cons: have to manually flip pages to print double-sided, frequently experiences errors when printing, has trouble staying connected to the internet when none of my other devices do, and seems to go through ink rather quickly though the instant ink program is not a bad deal.Bottom line: the cheap price is not worth all the headaches that will come with this bare bones basic printer.

Stress free!!!?? Haha please.. from all my purchases on technology this one has been the worse.  I've 5G internet bcz all my computers are up to day and i had job to print that got delayed and has been so hard to connect this crap to any decent network until the point that I'm still waiting to be connected. I wish i could have my money back but packing and sending back this monster is not something that I'm the mood for so... yes very disappointed of this brand on printers until the point that no ethernet cable is included just in case.Bad bad.. purchase if you don't have 2.8 internet speed. WON'T BUY IT AGAIN for sure!!

reviewTitle: Ink doesn't last past the alignment phase
reviewDescription: So today I finally set up my printer because tomorrow I have to go to court and fight my increase in property taxes. I was able to print the test/alignment page and that's it. I'm out of ink! But guess what! You can subscribe to an ink plan! You run out, they will send you more for a monthly fee! How great is that!  - I'll pass. I should of known a $50 printer isn't worth it. My previous printer lasted about 15 years. Yes I bought ink, 4 different cartridges. But they lasted months at a time regardless of the use. Very little use, probably a year, but 1 print job!!!! Rip off. Shame on you guys

reviewTitle: Worst printer we have ever had and the monthly subscription is beyond awful
reviewDescription: The connectivity is a major issue. This printer will constantly disconnect. When you want it to work  you will spend a huge amount of time going through the reconnection issues. Finally you get the thing connected... and it spits out half pages and has a bunch of now useless wasted paper - and OH JOY! That counts as pages in your monthly subscription allotment btw.We are a very tech savvy household and the set up for this thing was an absolute pain in the rear.When you do finally get it to work the quality is ok. It is very temperamental about what paper though. So don't use anything thicker than the most basic paper or it chews it up. Forget the idea of labels or any special paper - it just smudges them.I have had this printer for about 2 years and have NEVER received an additional cartridge set from the subscription. The print is now completely faint and useless and they still say I have plenty of ink. We have another B&W printer, but the idea was to have a color printer for when we needed the odd color print for work and kids school. Half the time we have ended up going to pay for printing at Office Depot instead!I plan to throw this away.The monthly subscription is a complete rip off. I have paid for numerous "free" cartridges by now.I will never buy another HP.

reviewTitle: Great target for a baseball bat
reviewDescription: Everytime I use this printer something doesn’t work. I hate it so much. So much rage enters my body when I realize I need to print something quickly. I know It won’t be quick. I know the 5 pieces of paper I loaded In there will ultimately jam. I know the WiFi will just disconnect. I know that trying to print something will lead to the most inconceivable, unwarranted temper tantrum. But I cant help it. The one reason I, a MILLENIAL, bought this thing was to have ease of printing from the comfort of my own home. But there is no ease. Just anger. I will go full office space on this printer and feel no regret.

It is impossible for me to set up this printer.  I have tried for hours and it will not connect to my wi-fi.  HP support is absolutely no help at all.  Setting up a printer is always super easy but I have no idea why this one just will not work.  I have an older HP, about 15 years old and works just great, no idea what the issue is with this one.  I had gotten for my son for school but he's never been able to use it.  I thought it was just user error but I have spent hours on this and cannot set it up.  I'm so frustrated!
Wanted this mainly for copying, not as main printer.  Makes good copies from documents altho sometimes other media isn't the best.

Purchased as we needed a printer and don’t really print a lot around our house typically.For the most part this thing is great, spitting out whatever we need but occasionally (normally with color intense prints) it tends to jam. We’ve solved this by having those types of images printed via OfficeMax at this point as it isn’t really worth buying a more expensive model.The HP+ app is pretty sweet and have to say that it does work pretty flawlessly. The fact that you can enable “remote” printing is a nice feature and the app on your phone will track your location compared to the printer and spit out your product when you’re “within range” which is a pretty nice feature.The ink that came with the printer did go quick and you do have to subscribe to a monthly plan in order to get the full features of this thing. We got the cheap one and we never looked back on this.

Es muy buen artículo y compacto, el único problema es que los cartuchos de tinta salen muy caros y los que trajo se terminaron de una vez, osea se les fue la tinta en breve!Espero y puedan ayudarme con un pedido que haré y me hagan un envío gratis si les es posible 😁Dios les bendiga!

reviewTitle: Setup wasn't a breeze and the ink is the real cost
reviewDescription: The printer setup didn't go perfectly. It dropped the network and you have to sign up for an account to complete it. After it started working it printed fine. Quality was good and the speed was very good. As with all these inkjet printers, the ink cartridges becomes the real cost. These aren't bad in comparison.I'd recommend at a sale price, but be prepared for some hiccups with the setup.
It gets the job done but it’s hard to figure out what it wants sometimes and can be tricky to connect to
Difficult to connect wireless
This is a very nice printer the only problem  is it does  not print front to back on the same paper but it’s a good choice
This printer is decent for the money. Was a little confusing using at first but I’ve got it figured out.
It fit in the spot perfectly

I do graphic design and have several home printers for various purposes. The HP DeskJet 2755e is a decent value for a bare bones, all-in-one unit. It doesn't take up much desk space has somewhat attractive styling. There's no paper tray so it feeds from the back. It was rather a pain to set up via Windows 10, though I could have installed the HP app on mobile and done it that way. Still, it took longer than I liked to get everything running smoothly. Once all that was out of the way, however, it has been solid.I would say the 2755e is ideal for someone budget-minded who is looking for the utility of an all-in-one, wants to option to print in color, but doesn't need super high quality, and may only use it occasionally. It does everything I need it to but does not shine in any one area. Print times aren't super speedy and print and scan quality are just okay. The LED readout is a joke. Since this will be only getting occasional use, I didn't go with an HP Instant Ink plan, but that may be a good option if you plan to print in larger quantities.This printer was purchased based on price. I could obviously get something better if I paid more, but it is on par with what I expected, perhaps even a little better. I can't yet speak to durability or the long-term cost of ownership.~ Kort
Like way to use
We love it.

reviewTitle: Great price and good quality print
reviewDescription: Easy to get going. But HP should stop the heavy pressure on buying more ink. I get it, you want more sales, but it got irritating. As for the printer, it was easy to install the software. Took 3 attempts to get it to print the first print. Not sure why. Maybe it was still going through the set up. As for the copy, it was immediate and good quality. Good bargain, but be ready for more email pressuring you to join the auto ink buy club they push. Give it a rest HP. When I need ink, I'll order it.
Prints well
Only problem I have is the paper doesn`t load
Perfect
I am wishing for 2-side copying, but other than that, the copies are clear and look quite good.

reviewTitle: The right price for light printing
reviewDescription: Should have read more carefully but does not print on both sides automatically. Unless you reinsert the paper, a waste of paper,

reviewTitle: Only printed a few times and already says I’m low on ink
reviewDescription: Low on ink? Not possible considering I’ve only used it a few times. Other than that it work well… so far
Works great, no issues so far.

I've only had this printer for maybe 3 weeks. It always leaves streaks in the images I print. Most of the black ink does fine, but now it's spitting out blank sheets when it should have print on it. Says 3 months' worth of ink. That is laughable if it is truly out already. Also, I had to buy a cable from the printer to the pc because it would lose connection IN THE MIDDLE OF PRINTING! Only half a sheet would print.  DO NOT RECOMEND.

reviewTitle: Printer was clearly a return and did not come with in as advertised
reviewDescription: It seems like this printer will work fine, once I go out and buy ink for it. Despite the fact that the box says it comes with ink and the description did as well, there is no ink included. The box had clearly been opened previously, and presumably had been returned by someone else.

reviewTitle: Printer was easy to setup. Thats about the end of the positive.
reviewDescription: Otherwise, this printer is just good enough to use, and just bad enough to hate it every time you try and use it. This printer is very finicky and does not always print the document or will print out a blank page. I regret not splurging for a higher quality printer. Also the printer showed up with 1/2 empty ink cartridges. I would have returned it but the return window was too small to realize these issues.

In todays techy world HP lacks how to actually connect wirelessly.  The company bought this and is going to keep it but we had to buy cables to plug it in since it only connects to 2.4Gz wireless connection.
