Our tech department along with HP tried everything to get it to connect wirelessly and no go...  Even the Best Buys guys said that this was a common HP issue.  Very sad to see HP doing so horrible in this wireless world!

reviewTitle: Cheaply made and difficult to setup and use
reviewDescription: I've had two other brands of printers which were easy to setup and use. This printer is cheaply made and was designed in a strange way. The cartridges that came with the printer was almost empty . I think the printer was used/previously owned. I feel I should receive a discount.

reviewTitle: this won't connect to my wireless network
reviewDescription: My old printer died and I needed a replacement quickly, so I ordered this model. I received it same-day and was quite happy... until I tried to set it up.  It won't recognize my wireless network.  I tried several times and got the same response, so I need to return it and  hopefully find a replacement that isn't so antiquated. Make sure you don't have a high-speed internet resource if you want to use this printer.

reviewTitle: Needs to restart with every use
reviewDescription: This printer was ok. It did the job. The major problem is that it goes on energy saving mode and nothing I do can get it to turn on. I have to unplug it and plug it back in just print something. Im not sure if i am doing something wrong but so far this has been my experience with this printer which is super frustrating. Set up was easy, scans and prints fine just the powering down problem.

Compre esta impresora hp pero no me siento cómodo con el funcionamiento es muy lenta cuando imprime algo tiene un retraso como de 20 a 30 segundo para imprimir y en el escaneo es peor super lenta aparte de que esta impresora de cartuchos la primera tinta que trae se termina muy rápido y los cartuchos cuestan lo mismo que me costo la impresora incluso los cartuchos podrían ser mas caro que la misma impresora

I have had this for 5 months (home use) printed aprox 50 pages and it's already run out of ink. Maybe that all they want to let you print. Personally I think that sucks! 🤔  what do you think? Not very easy to use had to down load 2 different apps just to get it to work. I would not buy this again!  Prints very slow, like 1980's slow ! 🐌

reviewTitle: After a year... (Edit: A year an a few months)
reviewDescription: So I got this just about a year ago...and so far its been working fine for a few months... until now!Now they ask if you want to do a ink and paper subscription which is actually a nice cheap deal if you print a lot, I have opted in it but i did cancel my paper subscription however... I don't print a lot so I may just cancel entirely an just buy ink myself. The down side of the subscription is that the printer needs to be online at all times to keep track of the ink/paper levels and what sucks is that you cannot use the ink once the subscription is cancelled/finished (which kinda makes sense since subscribing is really cheap and they don't want people taking advantage of it) But like I said I don't really print a lot (and I mostly just print in black) which is where my problem lies... for a month the printer's ink on paper has been smearing lately and not printing clearly so i've been getting poor quality prints and its annoying that my prints are now just getting poor when my previous old printer never had this problem... (my previous printer can only make manual copies an can no longer print from a computer since it only accepts windows 7 which is why I bought this one)I dunno, maybe the ink either sucks or the printer is dirty inside... ???So update... originally I gave this printer 3 stars... now its down to 2... the wireless connectivity is crap!Lost connection about a few months ago, tried all suggestions an it just won't connect.  I'll probably just uninstall the whole thing and restart the process

reviewTitle: May Not Keep It.. Ongoing Hassle - Updated
reviewDescription: Edit on Apr 16 2023.... Well, I kept it anyway as it prints nicely and the instaInk has been a good deal.  I have had it set up at home and not moved it.  I have printed 200 page documents without difficulty once I learned the way to reinsert the paper for printing on the second side. I suggest printing a two-sided project only about 10 pages at a time.  If you screw it up... less is wasted.On occation it seems to go to sleep and not wake up. Shows up as "offline".  What has worked for me, after trying many other rabbit hole solutions, is to unplug it for 5 minutes, then just plug it in again.  No other changes. But that, too, seems to not work for everyone.  And I don't know yet if it will always work for me. I have concluded that one or more of the following are the problem with it going to "offline" status:  a brief power interruption, an update on the computer you are using it with, a blip in the router... or just a crappy design by some software engineers.  Search the on-line reviews here using "offline" as the search word...  I have also concluded that there is no place in HP,  or on-line, where effective help for this issue can be found.Initial review-----This would likely be great IF you only use it at home on a good wifi network and with just one computer. I bought this for travel while traveling in our motorhome.  Certainly not portable but the best I could find for a reasonable cost. It set up with only minor difficulty at home and once on the home wifi network it worked just fine from multiple laptops. .  It prints beautifully. You have to load its HP Smart app to use the features.  I think I would not use the auto-ink supply option as it complicates things a lot.  On the road.. I rate it a one star for the difficulty I encountered getting it "re-setup" to change to the RV Park's network, and getting it set up to "print direct" was just as bad.  One can't be both on a remote wifi network and print direct... one or the other it seems. Not too handy for printing things you are researching online.  Instructions are not clear and the Smart App is no help either.  I finally resorted to using an old USB printer cord which I got to work, once I learned the wifi had to be shut off on the input panel.  One would think you could just shift the USB cord and have it work on another laptop (wife's).  No.... that took even longer. And.... if you cannot connect it to a wifi network, the HP Smart app will not let it print as it wants to track your ink supply if you have signed up for the free ink trial period. The cartridges that come with the printer will get you started but may not last as long as some you purchase.  I have had computers since before they had hard drives.  The early desk jets were great. This one is beyond my willingness to fool with.  Of course, it could all be due to operator error, but this operator no longer has the patience to tolerate things that are not somewhat intuitive or at least well explained in documentation one doesn't have to search out online,  including obscure PIN settings and info provided only when the printer itself prints it out.  Still looking for a simple one for travel. This is not it.

reviewTitle: HP DeskJet 2755e Wireless Color Inkjet-Printer - A Mixed Bag of Pros and Cons for Home Office Setups
reviewDescription: My journey with the HP DeskJet 2755e Wireless Color Inkjet-Printer has been an enlightening experience, to say the least. As someone who works from home, a reliable printer is an essential part of my day-to-day activities. While I found several noteworthy features in this model, I can’t overlook some significant drawbacks that have affected my overall satisfaction. This review aims to provide a balanced account of my experiences, helping you make a well-informed decision.🖨️ Easy Installation and User-Friendly Interface: An Idyllic StartFirst impressions are everything, and the HP DeskJet 2755e scored well in this regard. The setup was incredibly straightforward, involving a few quick steps guided by an intuitive mobile application. Within minutes, I was ready to print my first page. The printer interface is equally user-friendly, a godsend for those who might not be too tech-savvy.📱 Mobile Printing: Modern Convenience but Room for ImprovementThe mobile printing feature caught my eye, given how much I rely on cloud services and smartphone apps. While it’s great to have the option to print from your mobile device, I’ve found the function a bit finicky. I’ve often had to restart the app to get it to recognize the printer, which has been a mild annoyance.🖋️ Print Quality: Color Reproduction and Clarity Are On PointWhen it comes to print quality, I have to tip my hat to HP. The color reproduction is vibrant, and text comes out crisp and clear. This feature has been incredibly helpful when printing out color-coded documents or high-resolution photos. However, like any inkjet printer, it does struggle with handling bulk black-and-white text documents at times.🔒 HP+ Subscription: A Double-Edged SwordOne of the things I find controversial about the HP DeskJet 2755e is the HP+ subscription for Instant Ink. On the one hand, it’s convenient not to have to worry about running out of ink. On the other hand, I have reservations about being tied to a subscription model to fully utilize a product I’ve already purchased.⏳ Speed and Efficiency: Where It Lags BehindWhile many of the printer’s features are above par, its speed is notably lacking, especially when compared to some other models in the same price range. A high-quality color print can take up to a minute, which is not ideal when you have multiple pages to print. This is particularly cumbersome when I’m in a rush to print important documents.💡 Wireless Connectivity: A Hit and Miss ScenarioWhile wireless printing is convenient, I found myself wrestling with connectivity issues more often than I would like. The printer has a tendency to lose its Wi-Fi connection, requiring a restart to resolve the problem. Given the competitive market for wireless printers, this is an area where HP could certainly improve.👪 Family-Friendly Features: All Ages Can Use ItOne of the things that can’t be ignored is its family-friendly appeal. With easy-to-use features, even my kids have had an easy time navigating basic functionalities like scanning and copying. This is a plus for families looking to use it for various purposes.💰 Cost-Effectiveness: Could Be BetterIn terms of cost-effectiveness, the printer is a bit of a mixed bag. The initial cost of the machine is reasonable, but the ink cartridges are on the pricier side, especially if you opt-out of the HP+ subscription. It’s crucial to consider the long-term costs involved in maintaining the printer.🛠️ Durability and Build Quality: Middle of the RoadThe build quality is robust but not exceptional. It’s made mostly out of plastic, which is standard for most printers in this range but doesn’t exude a premium feel. However, it has been able to withstand the daily wear and tear typical for a home office setup.🤔 Overall Impressions and Final ThoughtsIn summary, the HP DeskJet 2755e is a printer that does many things well but has distinct areas that need improvement. It offers excellent print quality, family-friendly features, and a convenient setup process. However, its shortcomings in speed, cost-effectiveness, and reliability cannot be ignored. Therefore, I’m giving it a 3-star rating.If you are looking for a basic home office printer that can handle a variety of tasks but are willing to overlook some quirks and are open to a subscription-based ink service, then the HP DeskJet 2755e could be an option worth considering. Thank you for taking the time to read this detailed review; I hope it assists you in making a more informed purchase decision.

This printer is cute but if you are older or not ad tech savvy this is kind of difícil to set up. I'm young and some what tech savvy and still can't get this printer connected. It keeps saying no connections and I have to keep turning it of and on and wasting paper ans ink printing the wifi instructions because that is the only way. The app works if you connected to your wifi first then loging in and connecting to the printer still don't fully connect. Then I've had the printer less than a month and barely printed 20 pages and I'm already out of ink then I go and connect it to get that instead ink 3 months free of cartridge and it kept telling me since I cannot connect the printer it won't sent it. So I tried connecting the printer on my phone will having the app loaded on my computer and it still won't connected I've just had alot of trouble with this printer and I'm going to exchange it for a diferent brand

I have owned and used many HP printers & copiers over the years, but I must say that this one continues to be very temperamental.  It took 3 days of constant working with it just to get the Wi-Fi to link.  This was super frustrating especially since the manufacturer made it clear in the instructions NOT to use a USB cord to connect it.  5 weeks after purchase and it still prints 'when it wants to'.  It constantly falls "offline".  I waited before offering a review hoping that it would get better, but it hasn't.  Each time that I have to use it now, I find myself saying a quick prayer in the hopes that it will work today.  (This is where I normally would say LOL, but it is not funny.  It is frustrating.)  Several times I considered returning it to Amazon, but because of its low cost and the hassle that I would have to go through, it was not worth returning it.  I keep it for now and most likely, will purchase a better printer soon.  I would recommend this printer for grandparents; definitely not for students, businesses, or anyone having deadlines to meet.  Otherwise prefer yourself for much frustration.

reviewTitle: Don”t expect to use it out of the box
reviewDescription: I have an HP Envy 4520, which has been a great printer. In fact, all of my printers have been HP and I have been very happy with them. Recently I put both the color xl and black xl cartridges in my Envy. I have been having trouble with printing and the HP messages say one cartridge has a problem, but not which one. I was ready to purchase 2 new cartridges and found out that the cost to replace them had gone up quite a bit in price. It was less expensive to purchase a new printer with 3 months of free ink than to purchase the replacement cartridges. I purchased the DeskJet 2755e  And received it on Friday, January 5, 2024.The picture above showing what is in the box shows the printer, the power cord, and 2 ink cartridges. There are no cartridges in the box. Since I needed to have a document ready on Monday and another on Tuesday I went out and purchased 2 cartridges only to find out when I got home that in order to start printing you need a setup cartridge which I assume will come with the first free ink. You can not purchase this cartridge on  the market and once you get it and use it you are to keep it in case you need it again.I cannot tell you how the printer prints. That will need to wait until HP sends to setup cartridge. Hope it comes soon.Additional comments:The set up cartridges were in the box after all. They must have popped out of the box when I finally got the printer to come out.Having to pay a ridiculous amount for new cartridges or get a new printer for about half the price brought sadness.  (And there was the loss of 2 nearly full XL ink cartridges from the old printer.)My old printer is more user friendly and on first glance may provides better printing. I like to duplex whenever possible but if it is available on the new one it doesn’t show the option on the control panel. (More paper please.) I had purchased new ink cartridges for the new printer, not realizing that you need to use the setup cartridges before the new printer will print. I received differing information from HP on if I could use the new cartridges and was finally informed that I could not. This printer is set up to try 3 months of free ink through the HP Subscription Ink Program. You can choose later if you don’t want that service.I have had HP printers for over 30 years. They have been very reliable, they can last forever with home use—including 2 kids using them for school and entertainment involving printing, a parent in grad school sharing the printer, a parent constantly printing patterns and recipes, personal business, and grandchildren using them. My most recent old one is about 5 or 6 years old and probably has years of performance in it. Unfortunately, when companies make it difficult to use older equipment, we end up with planned obsolecense. This may be the way of tech companies now, but it is not ecological for our world and it doesn’t allow for passing equipment to those who have none so that they also have information access. I hope we can do better in the future.

reviewTitle: Wireless only. Unable to connect a Pavilion laptop.
reviewDescription: Forces you to disconnect your phone service provider and use wifi on your phone while in your own home, and doesn't connect even then. Recommended to use with cell phone instead of computer laptop, but says best for home. No bluetooth. Difficult to impossible to setup. I'd litterally pay 500 hundred dollars more for the same printer with a bluetooth option. Modern major printer manufacturers don't allow bluetooth printing, but pocket printers do. That's RATHER confusing. After waiting a week of frustration I was able to find the "do not connect USB " labeled port hidden under a piece of warning tape in the back, and connect it to my USB. It was a gamble, but I just was like screw it, if my laptop blows up, I'll destroy this printer before returning the pieces. Which would not at all return my personal damage to right. However, when the Amazon printer to USB cord came, it worked wonderfully and the hp123 setup online guide was easy. Now I'm printing but only online through HP monitored websites. Americans don't like that, and I don't think anyone else does either. The product instructions from HP were weak and useless, but the online setup was worse, until connecting a cable to the "do not connect" port.

My printer, about 5 years old, died, so I needed a new one. A trip to my favorite computer store turned up the fact that they sold only commercial-type printers and the 4-digit price included installation.Well, that seemed like overkill for someone who only prints maybe 15 pages a year, but they are important pages, mainly tax documents. So I fell back on Amazon. I ordered this printer. It was reasonably priced and had one feature I wanted that my old printer didn't have: WIFI communication. It appeared at my door promptly.Two hours of struggle and I was unable to get my computer to recognize it. So, I called HP's customer support. It took some effort to get connected to a human but the agent helped me set it up. The process was far too complicated, taking a third hour for a process I'd been doing in minutes on previous printers, but I then had the ability to print from my smartphone as well as my computer, and no longer needed a data cable. This printer can also scan, but I haven't even tried to access this feature after having such a hard time getting it to just print.There's also an extra step to get to the HP print menu rather than just taking the default from software on my computer, so on the whole I would rather have a dedicated printer working only with my desktop computer if that would allow automatic printing where you just select what pages you want.I thought I was all set, but the next time I needed to print 2 pages, it didn't work. I could see the print queue on the Windows menu but it said "printer offline" and there was no obvious way to bring it online. Another call to customer service and a half hour with their expert and I could print again. A month later I needed to print again and...you guessed it, printer offline. I gave up. I went to Amazon's website and attempted to return the recalcitrant device but the time allowed for returns had expired. This printer is not recommended unless you have a PhD in computer science. I want my money back.Loading the ink cartridges is also not as easy as it should be. The print head was hidden all the way on one side and I had to push a button on the printer to center it so the ink could be loaded. There's an automatic ink resupply option but it has already sent me another ink reservoir after I've printed exactly 4 pages. HP used to be the top name in printers, but maybe no longer?

I love HP products. The printer arrived on time. It's the perfect size for my space. I already have a large Brothet printer for large jobs... I just needed something small for smaller jobs. It looks great, and works great right out of the box. Set up was easy. With that said, I gave 3 stars because I would have bought a different model if this one wasn't offering free ink for 3 months. This is very misleading. They want you to set up automatic subscription for replacement ink. Also, the 1 free ink that came with it only made 20 copies... so disappointed. If it wasn't already set up, I'd send it back.

I gave this product an overall 3 stars because the print quality is not what I thought it would be coming from an HP.Downloading the app and following the prompts were pretty self explanatory. I opted out of the ink subscription so there were no issues there that many people stated they couldn’t opt out of. I also did NOT  need to provide any card information to create an account so again, not sure what that was about.I found that the color prints come out clearer than when you choose black and white. Black and white prints are not very bold,  and the print is somewhat choppy.When it comes to making copies via the scanner it’s easy to use but you need to make sure you are aligning your document right, because it cut off some sections and the print was very light.Overall, I think if you are using this printer as a here and there type of deal, I would continue with the purchase, however, if this is for a work station or printing off papers for school work often, I’d invest a few extra dollars and/or do your research for a different printer.

Edit: I've had this printer for a little over a year now. It still works OK. Now my computer will say my printer is offline or unavailable even though it's on and connected to the wi-fi. If I leave it, it will eventually just randomly print the thing, so weird. It's fine for most things but frustrating if I actually need/want something immediately. Not sure if this is a computer or printer issue but annoying still.Original:It prints so it's fine. I don't like it as much as my old one so I'm a little bitter. But the old did randomly die so maybe it's not that great. The paper tray is smaller so I have to reload more often. The screen/button area isn't super user friendly or intuitive.You have to set-up through the app or a computer. They recommend the app, I hate having to download an app for set-up but it does work much better. Set-up was fine, pretty straightforward. If you have any issues/problems with the printer you solve them through the app or a computer it seems. The printer itself isn't much help. My printer randomly was having issues connecting to the wi-fi. I had to re-download the app after trying on a computer to fix it. I tried for like an hour and was about to return it (2 days left to return) when I tried one last thing - restarting my router. It worked. It's frustrating but I guess now I know. None of my other devices had issues so it's weird.The print quality is fine, I've only done paper though. Double sided printing is annoying. You print the first side then turn the paper and put it back in so it can print the second side. Instructions pop up on my screen whenever I choose this option. However, if you already have more paper in the tray it'll automatically print on a second sheet. So you have to take all the paper out before printing double sided.I keep getting errors when I print, it'll flash E 2 or something. Everything prints fine so I don't understand why it's giving me an error message.I signed up for Instant Ink since it was free. Everyone recommends keeping it. It is super convenient to not have to think about ordering it. It just gets sent to your house automatically. You'll have to remember to cancel if you don't want to pay for it since you have to put payment info to get started. Starts at $1 a month, next tier is $4/month.Overall, it's fine. It's relatively affordable and gets the job done. My old printer worked so much better and had better features for a similar price. Of course the new model is a lot more expensive so I opted for this one.

This has been CONCISELY what I was looking for.Like you, Dear Reader, I window shopped so many and chose this one because of the reviews.I had to trouble-shoot a few things setting it up, yet once I corrected my user error mistakes, this printer has been WONDERFUL.I use it about once every two weeks for letters, and random stuff.So that's my use frequency, and the wireless has been no fuss and I'm so darn impressed when I turn it on, it works, and in a few seconds I have the printed page in my hands.I was SO. WORRIED. about tech glitches and such.But really it was setting it up, and then off to the races.From a novice, just wanting to print occasional things, this is the printer you're looking for.Respect!

My HP DeskJet 2755e wireless printer was easy to setup and it really performs. What I like the most about it is that it doesn't go to sleep. Now I can print from any of 3 locations and not have to run and turn on the printer. The print quality is excellent and the other features (scan and copy) work just as well. Overall, it works great!

Let me start off saying that I am 40 years old and have to hand my phone to my kids to help with anything technology related. BUT this printer set up to my computer was easy! I didn’t have my kids help me once. Easy as cuttin pie.I use this to print home made stickers. ALSO works great!!! I love this printer
The app isnt very good. Idk what it's functionality is meant for other than to sell you ink.The printer is great and fits in my limited space.Great printer and copier.
I love it.
I didn’t use the printer due to the fact that my old computer software doesn’t talk the printer’s language.  I’m sure it works well.
This a must. I had my old HP printer for almost 8-9 years and it was time for a little upgrade. I am thankful for the price it was at. I am loving the way it does  everything I need to be done.
This printer have been working great so far and was easy to install. Did not require any install of HP software etc. and Wifi connected easily - pretty much plug and play.

The printer worked fine but I replaced the cartridges with new ones I bought on Amazon and it appears they were bogus.  Not knowing this I tried everything to fix it and ultimately I bought a new computer and only after I placed the ones I had bought and the orange light showed up again, did I read the manual and realized what had happened.  Fortunately we can use a second computer and I will buy new cartridges for it from HP.
Nice printer

My Canon printer finally went caput after 10 years. As an herbalist and small business owner, I make my own custom products for different people - which means I need to make custom labels for each product (or groups of products). This is also the reason I needed a top-load printer - for convenience. I thought this would be a simple transition. I WAS WRONG!! It's like this printer does not read the label formatting - Yes I use basic Avery Labels, mostly 1x4 and 2x4 size. I have wasted so many labels because it won't print in the label lines - not just a little off - I mean the label line is running down the middle, wasting 2 labels at a time. And sometimes it won't print the label at all - it just runs through the printer and comes out blank. I have even updated my system as well as the driver. I have only been using for less than a month. It is wasting my time and my money. I have just purchased another printer (canon) because I can not rely on this one. It's going in the trash!!!

reviewTitle: I made the mistake of buying TWO of these junkers
reviewDescription: I don't require much in the way of printer capability.  I only occasionally print music sheets and pages from my online repair manuals.  This printer has the memory capability of a turtle.  It is SO SLOW to load print data from the que that you think it's dead.  So you do what...that's right try it again.  When it kicks in, all 4 copies print.  If you restart...here comes another test page wasting ink again.  I've probably used more ink printing unwanted test pages than the actual pages I needed.  Everything this printer does is glacier slow.  I made the mistake of buying the second one a few months later for my granddaughter who started college.  She got almost nothing printed before her new printer ran out of ink.  Don't even get me started on HPs "automatic ink refill".  Luckily, I didn't fall for that scam.I'm ashamed that I gave one of these POS to my granddaughter and will never buy another HP product.  There are too many better-quality printers out there to consider another HP purchase.

reviewTitle: A complete and total nightmare to set up
reviewDescription: You are REQUIRED to install 3 pieces of HP bloatware just to get this thing up and running. HP Smart would not for the life of itself accept my wifi password. Despite it being the same password I use for every sing other device. After fighting with that for an hour I finally got the printer "installed" on my pc. Turns out it only installed scanner drivers. In order to install printer drivers I had to download yet another software for the actually useful drivers HP Easy Start. Then my printer actually showed up in software as an option to print from. But alas I still could not print so I had to install you guessed it another piece of software HP print and scan doctor. Which wanted to update the firmware of the printer. Which normally wouldn't be a problem but the button to tell it yes and the button to tell it no both DID ABSOLUTELY NOTHING.The back up HPs website suggests to use to to plug in with a USB cable, which I would love to do, except for the fact that they DIDNT INCLUDE ONE IN THE BOX AND THE END THAT GOES TO THE PRINTER IS NOT A STANDARD USB CABLE. So I can't just use a different cable.And if we're talking about cables. They did include a power cable. But you better hold onto your socks because I still had to buy an after market power cable. Why? Because the included one is insulting short. No matter where I put the printer it wouldn't reach an outlet unless I had it on the floor basically infront of my desk.If I could go back in time and buy any other printer I would. But I bought this one and I've already sunk an extra $10 into this $80 nightmarish piece of junk to quit now. Still haven't printed what I need to print and I've had this printer for 4 days now.Do yourself a favor and don't buy this printer.

This product is awful.  It goes off line or asleep and you are out of business.  A trip to your nearest print store to get a simple copy of a document is the only solution.  I purchased the printer over 60 days ago, so can't return to Amazon.  With a busy schedule, I dont have time to chat with tech support for an hour and a half to print a document which should take a minute, so I made due with no printer.  I have called hp 3 times ... they walk you through a million steps to get it back, including deleting and reloading the printer on your computer.  It works!  It's a miracle !!  Two days later, it's "off line" and/or "asleep".  I asked for a refund ... they can't give me one on a product purchased over 30 days ago.  They offered to send me another printer, suggesting that there may be a problem with this particular printer.  I initially agreed to this option ... even though lots of people have this problem (it's not this printer ... it's poor quality).  Catch though.... they want COLLATERAL!!!  So I get to send them money for a replacement printer that will probably do the same thing as this printer.  HP ...... shame on you!  I'm done.  Next laptop will not be an hp.  My next printer will obviously NOT be an hp.  BOTTOM LINE:  DON'T BUY THIS PRINTER.  IT'S THE WORST.

reviewTitle: This is not an "ALL IN ONE" printer, you cannot scan
reviewDescription: I specifically chose this printer because it was supposed to scan.  After unpacking and setting up, I couldn't find the scan button.  OK so how do you scan with no scan button?  All I can do is copy or print.  So I contacted technical support and asked them for instructions on how to scan since it says in the description and on the box that you can scan.  The moron I ended up with on the chat kept telling me to put the document face down on the glass and select scan.  I told him THERE IS NO SCAN BUTTON.  We went around and around about this for almost 20 minutes and I never got an answer.  Then he finally says oh sorry there isn't a scan button on your model. YA THINK?!??  And still didn't give me directions on how to scan.  So.  Sending this piece of garbage back before I stroke out from my blood pressure skyrocketing after the most infuriating support call I've ever been on.  If you're looking for a printer that also scans, looks elsewhere.

reviewTitle: The Biggest Waste of My Time
reviewDescription: I purchased this printer so I could print what I needed to without using the other printer in the home that is not mine. The other printer is located in my friend's office in her bedroom. I can't print at night or on the 4 days a week she is home. So far I have spent countless hours trying to get it to print on Wifi. The other printer comes up on my phone and Chromebook and I push print and it prints. I have not installed anything to help with that. The new printer worked one day before it decided it wouldn't print using wifi. I spent hours trying to get HP support to help but they weren't helpful. Somehow the printer set up its wifi address, instead of the wifi in the home but unfortunately, I don't have a passcode for that. So I purchased a cable. It prints one page at a time. I have to stand next to it and manually push a button to get it to print more than one page. Today I realized it will not print landscape. I have used the same downloaded file to print on 3 different computers by only pushing print. It prints just like that. This one doesn't, it cuts off the page. I did at least get someone in support to try and help. They blamed my Chromebook. NO NO NO if it was my Chromebooks fault. I would be having problems using the other printers and I don't. Just this one. I will be returning this item.

reviewTitle: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY BUYING THIS PRINTER
reviewDescription: I definitely do not recommend this printer to anyone. It was rated very well so we thought it was a great printer and ordered three- for myself, my father-in-law, and my sister-in-law. For starters it was very hard to get it connected to the computer and wifi. I bought my own cable hoping to just connect to the printer to my laptop USB and print, but it wouldn't work. I called the company and they said it has to first be connected to Wi-Fi to work. After spending many hours connecting it to Wi-Fi it finally worked, but only for a few hours. I tried printing something the next day but again it stated that it wasn't connected to the Wi-Fi. I called up the company again and spent another few hours  until one of their technicians was finally able to get it to stay connected to the Wi-Fi. The second problem with the printer is that the ink runs out really quickly. It printed about 40 pages and then all the ink was used up. I guess I'll be keeping it until the free ink subscription is over but after that I'll definitely be buying a new printer that doesn't require a new ink cartridge so often. My father-in-laws printer also hasn't been working well. It worked fine for the first 2 months but after that, the printer kept having problems with connecting to the internet. The printer does not connect to the computer or phone anymore so it's impossible to print anything. my father-in-law spent many hours with the company trying to fix the problem but they were unable to resolve the issue and my father-in-law decided to fix his old printer rather than try to get this one to work. My sister-in-law has also been having connectivity issues with this printer.Bottom line: Even though this printer is rated well, if you're looking for a printer that doesn't require a lot of time to set up and will stay connected to the Wi-Fi, definitely DO NOT buy this printer

This printer is useless and HP is no help. They hound you to buy their “instant ink” which is a ripoff because the cartridges hold so little ink that they run out then it takes forever to get another one, AND after I went and bought a cartridge they hounded me about that so i discontinued instant ink and now the printer wont work at all. It will only print reports that say there is a problem and i cant print until it is resolved but the printer says its ready, the app says its ready and still it will only print that report. And forget trying to get help because they just put you through an endless loop and it’s impossible to get a human to help. I’m totally frustrated and disgusted and I'm just going to throw it away.  Save your money this is an awful printer.

I don’t know why I bought another HP printer again!? I guess I figured the last one was over 10 years old and certainly they have figured out all of the problems of the previous model so I gave them another chance. I can’t tell you how many times I cussed the last model in multiple different houses. I’ve lived in with multiple different set ups at different proximity from my central router. These printers constantly have an issue with shutting off power so that you cannot print to them. That is so annoying because my primary use is air printing. It defeats the purpose of remote printing if I have to go restart the printer every time and then wait for my printing to complete while standing next to it. I learned that in the settings of these printers, it is a default setting for them to power off for power, saving after two hours; this cannot be configured differently. You will always have to go power off and back on the printer to be able to print from it remotely.ALSO, that “Instant Ink” subscription is a total scam!! First they estimated my monthly fee to be $1.99/month and I was fine with that, suddenly they start upping the charge to a higher plan and next thing ya know, I’m paying $5/month whether I print or not!Want to hear the kicker?!? When you cancel the instant ink subscription, their printer is smart enough to know you don’t have the plan, so it disables those cartridges so they no longer work!! I have to go purchase new cartridges even though I have full ones in my printer!

I was severely dissapointed with this item. We had an HP printer that we got 9 years ago and it worked great until recently. This seemed like a good option,  but a few things I noticed that were inconvenient. No feeder tray, so to make copies of more than 1 page you would have to manually put it on the flatbed for each page. Also, it ran out of paper quickly (the paper tray didn't hold much paper). My biggest issue was that it ran out of ink after less than a week. As I used HP Instant ink (which we had used previously for the last printer we had, and loved the program), we didn't have additional ink to replace with as it hadn't arrived yet. I would only use the printer if you had less than 10 pages a month to print, otherwise it's not worth it.

reviewTitle: After a week is reliable and quick
reviewDescription: I had two HP Deskjet 2600s for several year. Wore one out. Replaced with an HP3755 because it used the same ink as the remaining 2600 (ValueToner 67XL). However, the 3755 is total junk: slow printing, fails about 20% of the time. So, returned that and got this 2755e. Planned to use only with a USB connection, the remaining Deskjet 2600 is on the network. The 2755e so far is wonderful; as quick and reliable as our older 2600s. Only reason I did not order it first was it takes a different ink cartridge, and reportedly ONLY functions correctly with genuine HP (overpriced) cartridges. Our two Deskjet 2600s worked flawlessly with ValueToner 65XL cartridges. I may try them in the 2755e (ValueToner 67XL) , but probably not worth the aggravation.......UPDATE Apr 2023:I hate that my HP Deskjet 2755e directions say it will not function correctly with after-market ink cartridges. The 2600 I used to have for several years recently broke. It worked fine for about 5 years with after-market ValueToner cartridges. I have not tried after-market cartridges with the new 2755e, but I may try eventually and will update my review if I do and it's successful.UPDATE about 3 months later: After about 3 months of working okay, my printer fails printing about every 5th document saying the there is a problem with the HP color ink. I then take it out of the printer and reinstall and re-align. Works then for another 5 documents or so. The level indicates about 75% full, same as the black ink cartridge. The HP black ink has not caused any problems.I just ordered the ValueToner cartridge that worked perfectly in my previous HP 2600 printer that lasted about 5 years with ValueToner cartridges. I am not sure if it's the HP 67XL ink cartridge that is defective or this newish HP2755e printer. I'll update after I've tested the ValueToner cartridge.

The printer is very difficult to set up unless you plan to do everything, printing...scanning...etc, from your phone. Printer is not recognized by any of my computers despite being wireless. I have to take 3 separate actions just to scan a receipt. I have to scan from my phone (if that even works) & then email the scan to myself & then grab it again on my phone to print. Crazy. Just a poor, poor design in what I can only assume is HP's attempt at grabbing a "younger & tech savvy" audience.And don't get me started on the Smart Ink deal. What a rip-off. They offer 2 months free but don't tell you that if you ever change your mind, HP can literally shut-down your printing through their cartridges. I'm not even sure how they've got that technology when the damn thing can't even print to my computer but boy, talk about Big Brother watching. Shut down the printer I would ostensibly be using in the privacy of my home because I'm not buying my ink from you anymore? At the rate that I print (very little), the cheaper option would have been to pay the .99cents a month rather than buy the ink from Office Depot (assuming that I went through the purchased ink in under 2.5 years which I might not do) but the mere fact that HP has taken such an intimidating and bullying stance via their precious ink cartridges made me decide that I'd much rather give my money to an office supply store. All of that, again, is assuming I can get the printer to work every time. Not the situation at the moment. Very frustrating. If you under 30 & plan to only use your phone, I guess you'll be okay but if you expect this printer to function in any normal capacity - keep looking. I'll be replacing this one as soon as I can. Very disppointed in this product & with HP in general for their authoritarian stance & intrusion because I was foolish enough to fall for thier bait & switch deal on ink cartridges.

Single handedly the most frustrating item I’ve ever owned.  I have worked in an office setting for 20 years, I am only 38 years old so I know how to use printers and equipment. I set up the office networking system and server at my work.  I’m not dumb. But this printer NEVER works.  Troubleshooting does nothing, instructions are worthless, the app doesn’t even give an option to print.  The word “print” is greyed out on the app even tho I am connected to the printer and can see ink levels and WiFi etc  The only thing it ever prints are test pages that waste a massive amount of ink. since you can literally only print maybe 3 pages of paper before it says it is out of ink.  I’ve MAYBE printed 5 pages total, ever! and I’ve changed the ink 2x. Not counting the ink that came with the machine.  So one cartridge of ink will print 1.5 pages. not an exaggeration. This machine is a waste of your money and time.  Buy this ONLY if you want to make yourself think about throwing it through a window or beating it with a hammer while screaming obscenities.  Pure waste of money.

I bought this for home use.  I have lost connectivity at least twice but managed to get reconnected by unplugging and plugging this p.o.s .  This time I am not able to reconnect this printer.  I have tried everything - the reference guide, the useless hp app and holding and getting hung up on by customer support.  I follow the instructions and then get this message " Unable to connect.  check the ip address and then try again".  Well, Ive done this maybe 30 times! It is frustrating to say the least and I will just go to walmart tomorrow and get something else - will not use or recommend hp printers.Update:  I decided to give this printer one last try before getting rid of it.  I deleted it from the hp app and then deleted the app from my phone.  After a day or two i noticed the printer was connected to wi-fi .... I then tried to print something and it worked!! a few hours later all the lights were flashing on it and it wasn't connected to wi fi again.. so i turned it off and on and that seemed to work.  We'll see how it goes.

Cannot get this printer to work. I've done all of the trouble shooting available online and it still will not print. Says it's successfully connected to wifi but the printer is blocking any and everything that is trying to be printed. Probably has something to do with them sending me a used one that was missing the power cord, "included ink," and users setup manual. I bought my own power cord and ink thinking I would still get some use out of this and it has been a nightmare. I'm not sure if whoever had it before broke it or messed up the firmware but this has been a complete waste of time and money and I cannot return it because my over zealous partner threw out it's box right after opening it before we realized all of the problems it had.Would not recommend.

reviewTitle: A very frustrating printer with several defects
reviewDescription: I purchased the HP DeskJet 2700 with high hopes for a reliable and efficient printer, but unfortunately, it has been nothing short of a complete disappointment. This printer has turned what should have been simple tasks into a nightmare of errors and frustration.First and foremost, the print quality is horrendous. No matter how many times I've tried adjusting the settings, the output always appears faded and blurry. It's as if the printer is running out of ink even though I just replaced the cartridges. I've wasted countless pages trying to get a decent printout, but it's simply impossible with this device.Beyond the abysmal print quality, the printer's connectivity is an absolute disaster. More often than not, it refuses to connect to my computer, causing me to waste valuable time troubleshooting the issue. Even when it does connect, it's unreliable at best. Print jobs get stuck in the queue, and I've had to resort to canceling and restarting the print process multiple times just to get a single page out. It's infuriating!But wait, there's more. The wireless mobile printing option is just slightly better than the wired connection, which is a low bar to begin with. While it occasionally works, I still encounter numerous connectivity issues, making it more of a headache than a convenience. It's truly baffling how a supposedly modern printer could struggle so much with a basic function like mobile printing.All in all, the HP DeskJet 2700 has been an expensive and aggravating mistake. I deeply regret my purchase and would strongly advise anyone considering this printer to look elsewhere. It's an absolute waste of money, time, and nerves. Save yourself the frustration and find a more reliable printer from a different brand. I certainly won't be purchasing another HP printer after this terrible experience.

First, my husband and I both have worked in the IT field for years so this review is coming from people that have technical knowledge and have supported printers and other devices for years.  Just about anyone in IT will cringe when you say the word "printer", they are the bane of most IT departments and as such, I have hated many printers over the years but none as much as this one.WHEN it prints, the quality is good enough. The problem is getting it to print.  The thing can't pull paper through unless there is only one or two pieces in the feeder.  It is a constant battle of trying to get the paper to load through so something can print and hoping it pulls through fast enough that you get your whole page printed.We have yet to be able to get the thing to scan.  Rather than give you a simple "Scan" button, you must open the HPSmart software and scan through there, which is fine if it worked.  Once you login to the software and hit "scan" it asks you to log in and thus begins an endless loop of trying to scan.  I finally get so aggravated that I scan with the mobile app (which is the one thing that works as it should).We have had this thing just over a year and have hated every minute of it.  I don't know why we didn't return it immediately and save ourselves the aggravation but for whatever reason we didn't.  Now that we have replaced it with a different brand of printer that actually works as a printer and scans when we need it to, we are taking this thing out back and going "Office Space" on it.  Seriously, we hate this thing.  Save yourself the trouble and buy something else.

After months and months debating, I did and then held back on setting up, knowing printing pages were piling up like a cartoon inbox rate!Within attempting set-up first 30 minutes I KNEW the scam as I had not and still have not fully been able to set-up from my tablet nor laptop which all thing's needing to print are stored. Either a driver was missing or the app on laptop would never stop buffering finishing set-up as it used ancient internet explorer instead of Edge or Brave or Chrome etc.I installed the HP SMART AND HP PLUG IN AND THIS AND THAT AND THEN THAT AGAIN and LITERALLY ALL color ink gone printing repeatedly over and over the same info already known or given! Then, ironically as soon as color ink (and yes I had checked print black and white) was gone it took my ONLY successful phone print of 13 pages to eat up that black ink which was full!The reason for wireless is no wires and quick access then done NOT to each and every single time have to reconnect, or set-up again or go from this to that and that again as my nose itches and all limbs are holding up the foil for signal.This was a major purchase for me and now the return window is closed AND I have clouds pixel overpopulated of things needing basic print and still can't.I hate purchasing any technology these days because I swear we've truly set it back instead of advanced as calls still roam and drop, internet constantly freezes or stalls and printing companies don't even know or remember what tools they're supposed to provide etc. I may be 50 but I'm also the Gen X Texas Instrument desktop data entry to play Atari Pac board turning Nintendo Game party VIP typed on typewriter 96wpm and+that on keyboard while fidgeting on computer's doing my own repairs keeping pager and cell clean for years AND this technology takes more time now than it ever did before.Don't purchase trust me

reviewTitle: Worst printer ever. Such a scam
reviewDescription: We bought this printer as I am in nursing school and would use it weekly to print some PowerPoint slides. We did not print a ton. First off this printer has never printed in color. Second, you have to set up a subscription with HP to get ink sent to you based on how much you print they will automatically send you ink (you are charged) plus whatever subscription you choose, if you go over the allotted page limit they start charging you per page. Such BS. I wish I would have discovered this sooner so I could return. But since we don’t print a ton, I am just realizing what a scam it all is. So not only do you buy the printer, then you buy your ream of paper, pay for ink and then they shut down printing capabilities if you have gone over your page limit or need to replace the ink. I have more ink, since we did not use all that was sent to us and I can’t even use it without setting up an hp instant ink account where they will charge and send me more ink (that I don’t need) and keep track of all the pages I am printing so they can charge me per page if I go over the allotted amount. Do not buy this. I’m so frustrated. I hate being scammed like this and feel totally taken advantage of.

I purchased this printer in April 2022 and I'm writing this review in March 2024. Yes, it's been that much of a frustration over the last couple of years that I came back to write this review. I bought this printer solely for printing return labels whenever I make purchases and need to return something. I'm not exaggerating when I say that I've used this print less than 20 times in nearly 2-years. It's terrible. The toner levels were showing that they were full but it was printing like it wasn't. One evening I spent literally 3-hours troubleshooting this. I went through all the prompts step by step -- and even reached out to HP for support (they were useless) and it's still not acting right. I went to Target and bought brand new toner and when I replaced them (even though the toner was showing as full with the previous cartridges) it began printing normal. Whatever... I chalked it up as being a fluke... even though that first toner I had in there was ALSO new. Well, it printed normal for maybe 5 more times and now here I am again facing the same exact issue. I'm so frustrated with HP and the quality of this printer. DO NOT BUY IT. I saw a couple reviews on here that had similar experiences as I did so I'd say it's not a fluke. It's junk. Waste of money.

I tried setting up from desktop WiFi and I literally got a headache doing so. I'm a retired IT Tech and it should NOT have been this difficult.  I had to go into my bag of tricks from my years of experience to get this thing running via ethernet cable on my desktop. Then my laptop was able to connect via WiFi. Luckily my desktop is near my router to connect directly. Others may not be as lucky.
So i received this printer and it just shows error code E0 which means cartridge low or not there well i tried everything and no luck! Frustrating, new in box and no ink? Upsetting.

reviewTitle: Just don't buy any HP printer
reviewDescription: I bought the 2700e printer because it has a scanner. Unfortunately, HP doesn't allow you to use the scanner unless you download their software (which then eliminates you being able to buy any other printer ink except HP). This irritated me, but I needed the scanner so I went ahead and started to download their software. A hard ethernet connection won't work. They demand you unplug your ethernet cable and connect to wifi to download their software. Frustrating, but I did this as well. While attempting the download yet again, they disconnected my wifi connection and made me sign in again. I tell you, at this point I felt like a hacker was trying to get my wifi password. Long story short, I wasn't able to download their software despite several attempts. Fortunately, I was able to connect the printer by just going through my regular computer system, but will never be able to use the scanner because there is no scanner button or option on the printer itself. You have to open the HP software to use the scanner. I ended up buying a "plug-in & use" Epson scanner. If Epson printers are as easy as this scanner, that's what I'm buying next. HP is awful.
Great printer, easy setup , not to happy with HP trying to control how you use and maintain your purchase, wanting you to agree with their terms/ inwhich I've yet to do
Its ok. It does what i need it to but wont print anything that needs photo detail. Thats to be expected. The price isnt a deal though. Its what youd pay anywhere else
We dangle 50+ devices off our 5GHz WiFi. This printer can’t do 5GHz and we can’t accommodate using an alternative 2.4 GHz WiFi.Otherwise liked the printer even with $4.99/month ink fee.

reviewTitle: Product did not work with network.
reviewDescription: Printer did not recognize our wireless network!

reviewTitle: Very frequently goes offline, has difficulty connecting to HP laptop
reviewDescription: Great quality of printouts, very happy with everything except the fact that it frequently goes offline, HP laptop troubleshooting sometimes fixes the problem, sometimes it helps to restart my laptop, sometimes it helps to restart the printer, sometimes I have to unplug the printer and retry again. It is infuriating. It will work fine for a few days and then revert again to problems. This has been going on for over a year.
Will only print on certain sites.

Received my printer a while back. I must have misjudged the size, it was too big for the table, and I couldn't return it because it was so heavy and bulky for me to repack in 2 boxes, carry to car then to UPS etc. Didn't have anyone to help. INK RECEIVED WITH NEW PRINTER - PRINTED 2 PICTURES AND 11 ONE SIDED PAGES BEFOR RUNNING OUT.

reviewTitle: Do not purchase this printer and MOST DEFINITELY DO NOT DO THE SUBSCRIPTION INK if you do!
reviewDescription: HP company is very difficult to do business with. This is a cheesy printer and a cheesy company.  I am now stuck with this junkie printer as I didn’t experience horrible customer service until the ending of the ink subscription trial period.  This company LIES! I was told one thing by TWO associates.  Then I was charged over $30 when it was only supposed to be $3.99 AND I was charged OVER $30 BEFORE MY SIX MONTHS TRIAL EXPIRED!!  I figured no big deal, I’ll call the company to get it resolved.After being on the phone with HP ink for over an hour and going all the way to talking to management their policy only allows them to refund $15!!  With that I told them to cancel the subscription and let them know they lost my business!I would also like to add during the trial period of NEVER RUN OUT OF INK… I ran out of ink TWICE. One time I had to wait THREE weeks for the shipment to arrive. The SECOND time was much better, ONE WEEK.I did place a phone call the second time and told them I don’t have 3 weeks to wait like last time.( I never called about the first time running out of ink. )Customer service was okay on this call, not great.  HP was able to resolve this issue by getting the ink to my door 2 weeks sooner.  I did tell them they need to stop advertising… NEVER RUN OUT OF INK…it’s NOT TRUE… another lie from this company.Please know this printer BARELY holds paper and jams A LOT!!  It doesn’t always communicate with an Apple iPad or Apple lap top.  Printer likes to print a lot of error codes… hard resets worked great as nothing suggested on the printout did.  It would freeze a lot too. This printer was bought to print school assignments and essays. I have one kid who’s a junior in high school.  This printer is NOT adequate for his school work load from a Catholic School.Anyways, I am sad to even write this.  Trust me, don’t do business with this company and don’t buy this brand.

We (old boomers) updated our computers and bought this new "wireless" printer...appx $88 with tax.  Looked great and worked well...for about 6 weeks.We were not using it for anything extraordinary, just a couple pages every day ors..a recipe, etc.Last week we started getting PRINTER OFF LINE messages.  Huh?  How can it be off line.  But, okay, we researched a bit...YEAH, ALL THE FIXES WERE:  reboot printer, computer and modem.  We did, it didn't!Company would exchange, but I had enough and they said yes to a refund...BUT, apparently they charge us for shipping etc, so only about 1/2 of the cost is to be refunded.I did not like the buttons and lights...very hard to see and use.  Having a small screen would have been better.Also, there is NO way to connect by USB cords..if the wireless part does not work, tough nouggies!!I know most of the ratings were in the five star area, but we are adamant regarding a one rating here!I will edit when the process clears and the dust settles.

reviewTitle: Prepare to give HP the personal info of everyone in your family!
reviewDescription: Never mind the $1,000+ you've spent on HP products as a loyal consumer, HP wants that additional $10 to sell the personal data of your entire family (kids and grandma too!) to their third party advertisers.Installing a printer used to be a straightforward process. Instead of simply inserting a CD or downloading software, HP FORCES your to install their app on your smartphone, even if you'll never print from your phone!  Getting the printer installed and connected to WiFi wasn't hard - but in order to continue installation, you have to completed a couple more steps.Why, if the printer is connected, do we have to complete additional steps before printing? What other steps could there possibly be?Well, first of all to continue installation you MUST create an account that you're never going to use or sign in to again.HP thinks that being a loyal customer and buying their printer isn't enough - they want more from you. A lot more. After creating a useless account, you MUST sign up for HP's ink subscription program.  You literally cannot click "Continue Installation" until you've done this. Then, you MUST check a box that says you "agree to not purchase ink from any company but HP".  Then, in order to continue installation you MUST input your personal cell #, email address, and physical home address. As everyone knows, any functional printer needs to know your cell and where you live in order to get that ink running. At this point, I was surprised they didn't ask for my social security # and bank accounts.After providing HP everything about your life, you then MUST check a box that says you ALLOW HP TO SHARE ALL PERSONAL INFORMATION WITH THIRD PARTY ADVERTISERS.  If you don't check this box, you can't continue installation.And when you think it couldn't get any worse, if you have multiple devices in your home wanting to print, too bad!  Only registered HP accounts are allowed to print from your printer.  This means if a family member wants to print something, they also have to go through these installation steps inputting THEIR personal information, cell phone, address, and allowing HP to share all their personal data.

reviewTitle: You don't own your printer with HP Instant Ink
reviewDescription: I pay for it every month, and haven't printed my limit ever unless you're counting the printer info pages...It hasn't worked for over 6 months.If anyone wants to file a class-action for making timely prints impossible at times, please find a way to reach out to me.- It's online I promise you that. the printer is connected to the wireless network. ( The wireless connection works. )- Other devices on the same wireless network are able to use the internet. ( The internet works. )- The printer wasts paper by very clearly printing Printer information Pages. ( The printer physically functions properly. )The printer info page clearly states:The printer might not be connected to HP Instant Ink anymore.Except for this page the printer cannot ptint with HP instant ink cartrides until the connection has been re-established.My problem with this is: the printer has only ever connected to HP Instant Ink a few times, even though the printer reliably connects to the wifi network every time.

I'm not sure where to begin.I think originally the most annoying thing was the fact that HP HOUNDS you to use the HP Instant Ink. It's clear HP just sells crappy printers in hopes that the consumer gets signed up for a recurring charge. All about that ARR! But seriously, it was constant that they emailed me. And they even ship replacement cartridges when you don't need them, but as soon as you try and use this new cartridge it wont print because you don't have an active subscription. How wasteful.Beyond that, the user interface with the app is horrendous. I don't think the app or the printer works well with any OS. I was able to get the printer set up the first time pretty quickly but after that it all went to crap.It constantly loses connection and has to be reset. And what's super great, when you reset the printer it MUST print a test page. This test page consumes a ton of ink. Very nice plan... Sell a crappy printer that can't connect and requires constant reboots, make each reboot include a test page that consumes massive amounts of ink, continually charge customer for using ink.I then tried to use non HP ink cartridges, which from a technical standpoint is completely fine. But HP emails you constantly that the cartridges arent HP Instant Ink approved.From the moment I installed the "non-approved" cartridges Ive had even MORE issues. The device just won't connect at all. Sometimes the printer will just start blinking every light and every digit in the seven segment display and has to be unplugged. All the while, the app says everything is fine.I'm beyond frustrated that I bought this printer. I won't be buying from HP ever again.

reviewTitle: Wireless unreliability bricks the printer - Do Not Purchase
reviewDescription: Well, this worked great until it didn't. Out of the box, it set up easily, printed reliably and the ink subscription seemed like it was going to work out great. Then I tried to move this to another location and connect to different wireless network. This printer does NOT like to be moved. In fact, despite it's simple pairing instructions, it becomes pretty much UNdiscoverable when you take it off its original network. I tried everything from powering down, restarting routers, setting up via mobile and desktop, setting up manually via WPS.... nope. It's super frustrating and I'm essentially bricked right now since this model makes it so difficult to print via USB port. In fact, there is actually a sticker that they put over the port in the back of the printer that says "NO" on it! Like, what?! Just spring for a casing without the port if you really don't want people to use it. I passed my return window on this unfortunately, but at least I can save you money by suggesting that you DO NOT BUY. We had actually purchased another one for our daughter's dorm room but that one is well within the window and going right back to Amazon now! Good luck!

reviewTitle: Only buy if you like TORTURE
reviewDescription: -Nightmare to set up-Inconsistent connection to network-Useless for photo printingI'm not a tech noob. I have patience. I build my own computers, I set up my own NAS. I know SQL, I used to program in BASIC . I've torn down laptops, tablets, cellphones, smartwatches and fixed them. I know some stuff, been around the block. This was PAINFUL.I bought this because my awesome Canon printer that lasted 15 years finally gave up the ghost. I was looking for something to print a document here and again and a few photos of family. No big whoop. This was cheap-ish and looked cute. Big mistake.Setting this up was as fun and easy as applying for a home loan. It took HOURS for my computer to be able to see the printer on my wifi network. It would see it, then it would go away. Restart printer and computer. Then it's back. Then it's gone. Now I need to start over and add it again. Then it's there but in unknown status. I wanted to print some not so nice words by the time it was finally running. I had to add it through the HP Smart app on my phone first then add it as a network printer on the PC. It refused to recognize it otherwise.So to the printing - it prints documents fine. Nothing great, nothing awful. Photos on the other hand - no. Well, if you like having an ugly 1/2" border on one side while the rest are 1/8" then this is perfect for you. I, like most other humans on the earth think this looks odd. I don't own 4x5.5" or 5x6.5" or 8x9.5" frames. They don't make them. I checked online for a solution, surely I missed a setting or needed a driver update. No, that's how it's designed. The bottom border (right side border on landscape) will always be 4x larger than the others. Great job HP.It's too late for me to return it so I'm going to use this until the ink runs dry then it's going to be lovingly disassembled with a baseball bat and turned into e-waste. I hate this printer and I strongly dislike HP now.Two big thumbs down.

reviewTitle: HP has started to take advantage of their customers
reviewDescription: I am so sad that HP has become a company that is trying to scam their customers.  I have been buying HP products for 35+ years and had confidence that they were at least honorable and customer oriented.  I purchased this printer and had an offer for their Instant Ink prescription program.  I decided to give it a try but after a few months decided it wasn't working for me.  I was using print cartridges from the program.  After I unsubscribed within a week my printer would not work.  There were flashing icons on the printer led but I could find nothing in the manual or online that matched the error icons.  I am very busy and knew that calling their customer service would likely take a long time so more than a month later, without the use of the printer that whole time I called.  Sure enough it took three tries and an hour and a half of my time.  What I discovered is that my printer would not work because I was using the Instant Ink cartridges!  And there is no way to make them work after I had unsubscribed, even though technically I paid for them.  The customer service rep tried to tell me that I didn't pay for the cartridge because it was a subscription program.  That's when I realized it is a scam program.  The only way to get the printer to work again was to buy cartridges that are non-instant ink cartridges.I am so disappointed that HP has turned to scamming customers and will never buy another HP product.  By the way I also posted a review about this on Trustpilot and HP claimed 3 times that I wasn't a legitimate customer.  Amazing that instead of addressing the issue they just worked hard to take down my review.

Don’t let the good reviews fool you. I’ve had this printer for a year. It printed successfully and easily ONE TIME, and that was at first use. Ever since it has been non-stop issues. I’ve spent more time trying to fix this printer than I have actually printing things. I urge you to look up how many people have had connectivity/network issues with this model.My printer will not stay connected to wifi, it won’t allow me to connect to wifi, no matter how many times I unplug, plug back in, run diagnostics, move it closer to my router, change the ink cartridges, use the Wi-Fi Direct feature, use the printers pin to connect to advanced settings. Nothing. Works.Customer service is almost useless, they have a manual for each printer to solve basic issues and if your printer can’t be fixed with their solution then you’re out of luck! Not to mention the only feasible way to contact them is through Facebook messenger, and there they rarely respond or will take hours-days to reply back, and when they do reply they’re advice doesn’t help.We actually thought we had solved this issue after finding that our HP Ink cartridges/subscription was making our printer complete unusable. It took me weeks to figure out a solution, none of that solution came from HP.  But, it worked one time after cancelling the subscription and switching to normal HP cartridges, and is now, still refusing to connect to wifi.It may be an affordable printer option, but I guarantee you will waste money by buying this technologically flawed hunk of junk. Heavy heavy do not recommend, considering throwing it out the window at present.

reviewTitle: It will make you crazy and frustrated
reviewDescription: I hate it.  I bought it because I am staying at a hotel for a month and need to print and scan documents on a regular basis.  If you are on any type of shared network, hotel, university, library, starbucks, etc.  you can not use it.  To use for the first time you have to be on a private network.  I was able to finally get around this by using my hotspot on my phone but it is not 100 percent stable so it took a few tries.  As you try to navigate the set up you are blasted by the annoying pop up windows that you are forced to read, and reply to, before they will go away; there is no x out feature.  Everyone of them is simply to collect data from the customer.  I bought a usb cable to get around the wifi issues but there is no way to use it for the first time connected only by the usb cord...so you know they are doing this to collect every piece of data they cab obtain.  Also, it uses a ton of ink and they have the firmware set up to detect whether is is their print cartridge so you are forced to buy HP cartridges.  It is one annoying thing after another.....and I am tech savy.  You will have to set up multiple accounts; they are not integrated so one for the app, one for the drivers, one for using the app, another for another simple thing.  They have chat support but they are obviously located in India and the chat disconnected 3 times and I had to start the process all over again.  Based on all of these problems I am returning it.  I have spent hours.  There are so many restrictions and traps to set it up and use that it will take hours to get it to print.  I started to test the scan...and they want me to set up yet another account with a new password, verification, etc.  I am returning it.
I don’t print very often, but when I do, it’s takes at least 10 minutes to get it reconnected to WiFi. Very frustrating.

Overall I think it’s an ok all in one. It is affordable and can get the job done with a little bit more work. It’s prints more slowly compared to my other printers.I do not like that I cannot use the feeder to scan when I have multiple pages. I have to scan each page individually using the flat bed. This could be a pain for larger jobs.I also had a hard time installing this printer. The manual did not include instructions on how to download the software. At least I knew I can find most downloads on HP.com I had to try to install everything multiple times since the download stopped responding a few times or an error occurred.The small screen is not really user friendly. After using it for a while I am beginning to understand it a little bit more. I might just be use to using a much bigger screen.
This is not a great printer. It was time consuming trying to figure out how to add it to the computer.

reviewTitle: Takes forever unless you want to print from your phone
reviewDescription: So it only took three hours to get my printer to print for my computer. I don’t want to print from my phone. I had to go on the HP website that took five or six tries to get it to download the drivers to my computer. I’m not computer illiterate so it shouldn’t be that hard

I spent about an hour carefully setting everything up, step by step, through each stage.  I finally reached the end and opted to print a test page....Nothing.  Stuck endlessly in a queue.  All I could find were convoluted directions to do all sorts of incomprehensible things.  So, I have a printer that cannot print, owned by a person who lacks the technical expertise to solve the riddle.Edit to update:  Don't ask me what I did....On Day Two, I pressed random buttons, both on the printer and on my computer--some of it was as I tried to follow the page-long technical instructions--and, suddenly, (well, after about 45 minutes) the printer printed! I hope I never have to try to get this thing working again, because I seriously have no clue what finally succeeded.

Machine looks good, says easy to set up for wifi, BS, 2 hours. Still can't get it to work. does not except email pass words..... UPDATE  after several more hours, only uses 4G, and they want a C card for 3 months of ink to finish setting printer up..
"The ink did not last 3 months; it lasted about a month."
Beware, once you select a subscription, you are locked in to only using HP ink.

reviewTitle: Cannot get printer connected or change wifi / NO INK!
reviewDescription: Getting really frustrated with this printer. Installed the driver and still cannot connect. Cannot figure out how to change the wifi network. So basically cannot even use the printer.AND IT ADVERTISES 3 MONTHS OF INK AND IT CAME WITH MAYBE 1 DAYS WORTH
But prints about as fast as a caterpillar carrying buckets up a hill! Painfully slow!

reviewTitle: The set up was quite uncomplicated and easy to do.
reviewDescription: My ink ran out in less than two weeks and I'm yet to receive any of the additional two months included with the purchase. I'm not getting items scanned and your tech support has not materialized. I am not a happy customer.

Works great with the app but if i am printing thru my iphone it doesnt print. Also i dont know how to scan the only option i see on the app is taking a picture from my phone (which i can do without the printer). Once i figure it out i can update my review.
The scanner discolors the images, is low quality, and is virtually unusable.

So I don't know if it's just a bad receiver or what, but set up was kind of lengthy because it was just taking forever to send and receive signals from my laptop. Once it was done, it began to print the test pages. The text looks decent, but the shapes/images look a bit grainy in my opinion. After doing the copying, I thought they looked even more so. Also, it looks like it's already using up quite a bit of ink which is pretty ridiculous.Decided to do scans of the pages it printed to share here, and boy was that a pain. It wouldn't connect to the scanner for some reason and I kept getting an error. I looked on the Smart App for my phone and, funnily enough, was able to start the scan through there. After that, I was able to scan from my laptop.Overall, it works after you work through everything. I've only bought this to print notes for school so I won't be super dependent on it. If you only need it for text, this might be good and can save you so money. If you need to print a lot or need to print diagrams or anything, it would be better for you to invest in a better product.

reviewTitle: Paper is loaded from the back, vertically!!
reviewDescription: The Amazon  picture makes it look like this printer loads from the front. It doesn't. The paper loads vertically in the back, which is annoying if you have the printer on a bookshelf and need to pull the whole thing out so that you can access the back. Other than that, it works fine for quick prints...
Setup was annoying at first but it seems like an okay printer.
I bought the new version, it wasn’t hard to set up. It’s a slow printer and the ink cartridges have already run out after only a few uses. Considering the price, it works fine and gets the job done.
