This printer was okay but once it starts messing up it really messes up bad I would not recommend it it does not last long put your money into something more expensive that way actually last you a while because this did not last long messing up it really messes up bad I would not recommend it it does not last long put your money into something more expensive that way actually last you a while because this did not last long
Works great; but sometimes has connection problems with the wifi.
This is a nice little all in one for the price. My only complaint is that the black toner cartridge was already empty. So, if you get one, make sure to order some ink cartridges.

I am a very patient tolerant positive person. I work in the IT industry. I've set up at least a dozen printers over the past 20-30 years.  This printer has brought me nothing but utter frustration.Wireless set up and use is clumsy.  I gave up and am using it with a cable.I did not expect a lot for $85, but printing is so light that I barely see whats on the page.Today, I set print quality to "best". The printer goes through the motions of printing, when it extracts the document, its a blank sheet of paper!I bought it a couple weeks ago, and I am getting rid of it because I am so tired of wasting my time trying to make it work.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviewDescription: EDIT - June 2023****I had a free trial for HP Instant Ink, which I guess expired awhile ago. I was auto-enrolled into the $0.99/month tier without me knowing. Today when I needed to print, my billing information was out of date. As such, HP bricked my printer. I literally could not print or force print anything until I went to my account and updated my stupid plan.Absolutely ridiculous that being behind a few bucks for their stupid plan renders the printer useless. 0/10, would not recommend any printer from HP.Long and short of it - the printer works. However, there are a few downsides.The set up was really frustrating. We downloaded the app and it kept failing. We have amazing internet/WiFi and were close to the router. We also tried installing it locally connected to our computer, which also didn't work.After a half dozen attempts, the app finally worked and the printer was set up. HP of course tries to get you to sign up for their printer services which may or may not be great, depending on your needs.The other issue we were having with this printer was it completely resetting any time we unplugged it to move it.We had to move our office around a little bit and you have to obviously unplug it to do so. After plugging it back in, it was no longer discoverable in the app or on our computers. And because there is no smart screen or interface on the printer itself, we had to re-do the entire set up process.We also recently changed internet providers, and consequently internet hardware (modem/router). Again, because all the set up is done on the app we pretty much had to re-set up the printer from square one.My recommendation - if you need a cheap printer to print once a month or less and moving it around isn't an issue, great.Otherwise, spend a few more bucks and get something more reliable.

These wireless smart printers truly are a cancer. It's not even really wireless, you still have to have it plugged into the wall for power, why not just add another cable to hook it up to my PC and avoid the hassle of all the bugs that go with it being wireless?First I got an error that said my wifi password was wrong, when it wasn't, rebooting seemed to fix that. That wasn't the advice online though, the advice online was to go into all kinds of obscure settings to troubleshoot the issue, glad I skipped that and tried just rebooting first. The setup was then extremely slow, took about an hour waiting for the buggy software to set everything up. Then they tried to sign me up automatically for recurring ink shipments. Kinda dumb I have to sign up for an account at all, it's just a piece of hardware, you used to be able to plug these things in and they would just work, and there would just be drivers associated with it that you would only have to deal with in the event of problems, instead of requiring you to sign up for an account so they can continue to advertise to you.Now that the printer is all setup, 75% of the time it fails to actually print, for unknown reasons (possibly wireless related issues) and I have to restart the thing repeatedly. This thing is a massive downgrade from a normal printer from 30 years ago that just worked when you PLUGGED IT IN.

This printer is nothing but problems, don't get it. You have to have a credit card on file to even print anything, regardless if you need ink or not. Also, keeping this printer connected to the internet requires nothing short than laying the cables on the ocean floor yourself. I'm literally ripping it out of the wall today and throwing it down the stairs, then drop kicking it to the dumpster. And it's basically brand new. Complete waste of money and when you *NEED* to print or scan and there's literally no "click to" in a single user interface; I have an engineering degree and I've been reading outdated HP manuals for 45 minutes.Dumbest printer ever.Save yourself the headache. Don't get an HP period.

I rarely have to use a printer but when I’ve needed to use this there’s some issue more often than not… It says it’s not connected to the internet even tho it is, the ink cartridge isn’t set right and it can’t print my document but for some reason can print the test page over and over. If the ink isn’t set right then how is it that it can print the test page and waste my ink? It’s always something. Printing should be quick and simple but this printer has been a complete pain to deal with. Haven’t even had it a year. It doesn’t mean they’re all this way, but I’ve never had an issue with a printer as much as this one.

reviewTitle: Printer is Fine, Instant Ink is a scam
reviewDescription: I've had this printer for awhile. It's fine. Print quality for black and white document printing meets the current standard, color printing of photos and images could be better but seems about the same as others in this price range.Here's the problem. This comes with 6 months of Instant Ink. After 6 months, you're automatically charged monthly whether you use your printer or not. But if you decide to to stop the subscription, the printer stops working. Somehow or the other, HP has coded those little devils so they stop working when you stop paying. Meaning you could have several extras lying around, that you paid for btw, but can't use them because the day they push the button, those cartridges won't work, at all, period.Here's the email from HP: "Your HP InstantInk subscription was canceled on March 22, 2024 and we noticed you still have HP Instant Ink subscription cartridges installed in your HP DeskJet 2755e All-in-One Printer.HP Instant Ink subscription cartridges only work with an active subscription. To continue printing please replace the HP Instant Ink subscription cartridges with cartridges compatible with your printer."So I can buy new ink or reinstate my monthly plan? Sounds like blackmail to me.Looks like I've got a new doorstop.

This printer comes with an InstantInk option. I thought this would make my life easier, boy was I wrong! I enrolled for HP InstantInk thinking it would save me time going to the store for more ink and make it easier to recycle. After having the service for 6 months without printing, I didn't see the benefit of continuing to pay for the service based on my limited use, so I cancelled it. 6 weeks later I tried to print something and the printer lit up like a Christmas tree. Whoops! After an hour of resets, reinstalls of the printer and trying to find what caused the issue, I connected to the printer's web-based hub. Get this! Despite the fact that my cartridges are full and I hadn't printed in months, HP disabled my print cartridges unless I reenrolled in HP InstantInk. Having an urgent need to print and basically having this equipment held hostage, I acquiesced and selected the lowest cost program. This is where I learned the true reality of HP InstantInk. HP InstantInk keeps track of your print usage, for each page you print, you are deducted a use. Misaligned? Dirty print head? Ran out of ink in the print? All of these are counted against you during your printing cycle. I paid $2 to print at home, using my own printer, paper, and electricity, only to have unusable sheets. Since I selected the lowest cost plan, each set of additional 10 pages was $1. Or $0.10 per page. This is the cost of going to Staples or FedEx office and having them print for you. That's right, you are paying the same rate as a print shop to print from home. Stay away from this product and stay away from this company!!!

Possibly one of the worst purchases I’ve ever made. I bought this a little over a month ago and I am almost out of ink. Due to me not wanting to be apart of HP ink subscription, they have locked my printer and I can not print, copy, anything. I have done a bunch of research (now) and I’m learning that this has happened to everyone who does not consent to their subscription program. It is a complete scam. So saddened by this because I’m slightly past my return window. I now have a printer that I can’t use at all. Complete waste of money. :( Don’t buy this. Or any HP unless you want to be locked into their subscription.

Customer service is bad, hard to get in contact with actual people to walk through issues, you have to download and sign up for an account for every individual who wants to print something on the device. It should not be this hard. Our family should not have to sign up and download the app in order to print from each of their mobile devices, tablets or computers. This feels like a grasp to have more customers and their data in their database. Having a printer that you pay for, should do the job you bought it for. There was a time you could search for a local printer on the network and send your job to that printer for print. Easy.

I spent way more time fighting the ‘easy set up’ than I could have imagined. It still doesn’t communicate with my computer. I was able to get it to work with my phone and transfer documents to it via Google drive. I finally started printing and it kept having errors. It would print 4 pages and then just stop. Error out and cancel. So I had to ‘reprint’ from where it left off. Once I finally got it to go, the full color quality was awful. I got a good 4 or 5 full color pages done and then it was low on ink. My goal was to print 20 full color pages and it just wasn’t up to the task.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviewDescription: It’s mediocre. I will say this, be careful with virtual assistants. One popped up and had me call to “help me” they wanted to log into my chrome laptop, only to tell me there were some issues with my connections and they wanted to charge an additional fee to resolve it. Whatever that meant…  but sounded fishy, so I instantly told them I’m all set and figured it out myself. I have the printer connected to my desktop with the app. My laptop, did not need the app as it uses the wifi once connected. For some reason it will say there’s no paper (when there is) from my phone. So it still won’t print from my phone. Kinda wish I went to Best Buy instead, but I guess it does the job. Somewhat
Helpful but a headache sometimes I have a love hate relationship with this printer scanner !Takes 67 or 67xl ink tri color and black and white cartridges

This printer will not stay connected to the internet. I purchased TWO of these printers thinking the first one had a default so I gave the other to my grandmother and hers will not stay connected to her internet (we live in 2 different cities, 2 different internet companies) and it takes 10min to a hour to reconnect just to print! So I gave it 3 stars

I purchased this printer because I've long appreciated HP's support for the Linux operating system. I've configured this for one Chromebook laptop , and two Android phones These setups went easy. I also configured this for a Lenovo laptop running Ubuntu 22.04. This is why I chose HP; they support Linux better than just about any other brand.Setup was a very fussy affair. The setup on the Android was trivial. Setup on the Chromebook took more effort than it should have. The setup on the Linux box was a ROYAL P.I.T.A. This install was fussy spelled with capital pain in the ass. I worked one evening for about 2 hours trying to get it to work. In the printer settings I could see that the printer was available. It was also available in the print's list of printers. However, when I started a print job it would just park in the print queue. I tried multiple reboots and tried the drivers that are on the HP web site. This didn't go well. I then installed the drivers using apt-get. This went better and far faster. This appeared to install successfully, but the print jobs in the queue would not print. Out of frustration I shut it down and went to bed. The next morning I started the computer and all the queued jobs printed without any action on my part. I've no idea why it worked this morning.Alignment was also a pain. It took me 3-4 attempts to get the alignment to complete. it would print the test page but would not scan it. I couldn't find the expected prompts. This train couldn't stay on the tracks.I've owned a few HP printers over the years for they've been my favorite. This one was the fussiest. We're going in the wrong direction; things should be becoming easier.Print quality is fair to average. I find the printing to be a little fuzzy. I would not use this to print a resume. Print speed is low average, and I had a couple paper jams already.

After having this several months I decided to scan a few items. no go. The "I" (information) light went on and nothing I did fixed it and everything I tried caused it to print out a lengthy description of what was happening to printer, none of it helpful. There is a "scan Dr" app available but only for windows. So get what you pay for I guess.
2 sided printing is cumbersome

reviewTitle: easy to use but the ink runs fast
reviewDescription: I bought this printer for my store. Everything is fine with this printer but the only drawback is that the ink runs faster than I thought. So, keep the ink for backup.

reviewTitle: Decent- Works better if you leave plugged in at all times
reviewDescription: 3/25/23 Update-1) If you don’t leave it plugged in at all times you get notifications that the company cannot connect with your printer to monitor how much you print.  It is also a pain to reset/reconnect every time.  I don’t have space to leave it plugged in, so this is irritating.2) Don’t sign up for free ink if you don’t print very much!  The app wouldn’t let me cancel (should be an easy cancel).  I had to call the company, they couldn’t find my email (but I still got emails from them) and it took 20 minutes just for them to find my account & cancel.  This is after spending 10 min on the app.If I could find a NON-HP affordable printer I would, you cannot use refillable inks because their ink cartridges are chipped.  My last HP stopped working after using non-HP ink.Still a decent printer and easy to use once set up.  All the other stuff is a hassle though.First purchase 2022- It took a tiny bit longer to set up than I expected but it still was only about 20 min or so.  Compared to my last printer (that was 8 yrs old!) the ease of printing from my phone is amazing!  I have not tried to print from my computer yet, so I can’t give my experience with that.I don’t keep my printer plugged in due to lack of space at home, so I get emails from HP reminding me they can’t track how much ink I have used, and honestly that fine with me.  I think that may be required to utilize their automatic ink shipping services, but not sure.So far I am happy with it.  It was a bit surprising how light it is (and how flimsy it feels).
I'm not a big fan of this printer because their are too many steps to print and you have to download an app.

reviewTitle: Take a trank before starting your install!
reviewDescription: Warning! Don't be fooled by the 'Setup Guide'! It's ONLY for unpacking the printer, even though steps 3 and 4 tell you to download HP Smart and follow the instructions to connect the printer.There's a Warning about "If connecting the printer to Wi-Fi..." The setup guide doesn't mention that you can  ONLY setup (install) the printer using Wi-Fi! Then you can switch to USB.I don't remember how I did it, but I FINALLY got it to stop asking me to sign up for "Instant Ink"! (It comes with enough ink to print the test page only!) I still don't know why I had to "Log In" to use the printer.All I wanted was a scanner. (My C4400 wouldn't install on Windows 10.) So now, PhotoPad won't scan because TWAIN not supported. So I have to use "HP Smart" program to scan my photos.  This program should be named "HP Smart or NOT". It may do a lot, but it seems like the project leader one day just decided it was "good enough", and shipped it! For instance, if you scan say, 10 photos, and exit the program, it closes without letting you know that you forgot to Save your scans. But on the other hand, if you scan 6 photos then Save, then scan 4 more and Save again, you'll have 16 files! And Edge Detect! Usually gets the edges, but not the corners. Well, 1 corner. Sometimes a miracle will happen and it'll get all 4 corners! If its portrait oriented!On the positive side, it will print. Assuming you bought a new cartridge pack.
HP printerSo far it’s all been set up ready to use but I haven’t used it yet so I really can’t tell you what it’s like easy set up and I’m pretty sure it will work fine if not I will redo my review
never was able to print from the laptop. Spent hours on this.
HP design beautiful white and set up was easy to follow instructions. Would buy again.
It is easy to install and works perfectly. It is a bargain for the price
Good quality printer.  Light and easy to carry.  Also, easy to set up.
Easy to set up. I’m not great with electronics but this was easy to follow!
Easy to use. Good value. I love the HP Instant Ink subscription.
Works great. Good for a printer to just have at home.
Simple and easy to use . Small but does it all

reviewTitle: Good value for the operations it does!!
reviewDescription: Love the compactness and small footprint in my home office.

reviewTitle: BOYCOTT HP. TRUE SCAMMERS. 👎🏻 ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE DO NOT BUY 👎🏻
reviewDescription: UPDATEI had already giving this printer a 1-star rating. I'd like to give it, and HP a MINUS TEN.HP is essentially a scamming company.They state: Get 6 mo of free ink.After enrolling in this scam-subscription, I have in all of these months only received in total two set of cartridges. I called in and asked, of you subscribe to 50 printed pages, it's not months.But, I said, I want to always have a set of new cartridges on the shelf, just in case.Oh, don't worry, your cartridges are full.Well, what if I tomorrow have to print 240 pages for an important case. Then, would I have to wait for HP to collect the data and send out a new set, go pick them up at the post-office so I can print? Too late.Okay, if that's the case, please cancel the subscription. But: Will the printer still work?Yes it will.This morning, in dire need to print, sure enough, the printer is just blinking. Spent 30 min to try to print. My guess is, as these cartridges are from the previous subscription, Instaink, they stopped working when I ended the subscription, even though they are full. (Just replaced.)NO ONE ELSE WOULD GET AWAY WITH THESE SCAMS EXCEPT THESE BIG CORPORATIONS WITH BIG LAWYERS. THESE KINDS OF CRIMINAL BUSINESS PRACTICES HURT MARKETS, GOOD BUSINESS, GENERATING HIGH VALUE FOR THE CUSTOMER IN A MODERN ECONOMY MORE THAN ANYTHING ELSE. WHY ARE CONSUMER PROTECTION LAWS SO INCREDIBLY POOR IN THIS COUNTRY? IF IT'S BELIEVED STRONG CONSUMERS WOULD HURT THE ECONOMY, YOU NEED TO REED UP ON MARKET DESIGNS IE SCHILLER. THIS IS CORRUPT AND CRIMINAL.BOYCOTT HP!OLD REVIEWI deeply, deeply regret getting this printer.The set-up, the wi-fi connection is absolutely awful. You'll end up spending more time trouble-shooting, re-installing etc than getting into your car and going ie to the library to have something printed and drive back.The printer turns off our wi-fi.It can't find the printer.It's 'unavailable'.We are pretty good with tech in this house, it's simply an awfully poorly performing printer.Totally wasted money, I've spent 3x the cost of this printer in time trying to make it work, time and time and time again.I'm now taking time out of my date to write this review, simply to help someone else NOT fall into the trap of buying this printer.And support? A joke.I will probably throw it in the garbage, having printed a total of perhaps 20 pages. Total waste, especially for nature.👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻

reviewTitle: Must buy subscription or printer won't work!
reviewDescription: So first thing first, I bought this printer because I'm homeschooling my oldest kids this year, I have had it for about six months now. It is a decent printer at first because you get the 3 months of free ink with your purchase. But after your three months runs out you have to pay to pretty much use the printer or it doesn't work. If you cancel you plan like I did you can print literally 10 pages per month for free. So no you can't just buy this printer and buy ink somewhere else, it's set up to where you can only buy their ink. So basically your paying a subscription even after you purchase the printer, even if you only want to print a few pages a month they make you subscribe or the printer doesn't work, it forces you to make a payment just to print something. So your buying the printer, paper and ink and paying a subscription just to use the printer and it is highway robbery if you ask me. So my takeaway is to buy a printer you can just buy and use anytime you want without worrying about if you remembered to have enough money to pay for you subscription. If you don't pay, you can't print. My sister has a brother printer and she buys her paper and ink and that's it, she doesn't have to worry about paying an additional subscription fee every month just to print and it should be that way. I don't and would not recommend this printer to anyone who is reading this review. I literally got ticked off I went to print my kids homework last week and had forgotten to pay my subscription fee $13.99 per month so I couldn't print, so I went online to cancel my plan because my printer just kept blinking at me that it had a message and it literally won't stop blinking until you update your payment method and even if you cancel your payment method it doesn't actually cancel for two weeks so you can't get your free 10 pages until then. It's absolutely ridiculous and a complete scam. My takeaway: buy a non subscription printer so you can print when you want whether your enrolled or not. Like if I want to buy my paper and ink somewhere else I should be able to do that but I can't with this printer unless subscribed.  SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM SCAM

reviewTitle: HP Support is a Special Circle of Hell
reviewDescription: Super disappointed in this printer which worked fine for about four months then mysteriously started flashing all the lights, which prompted a call to HP support. That's when the fun began.The first rep managed to get the printer working again, but there were still minor issues with connecting to Instant Ink. The tech and I were disconnected after two hours, prompting yet another contact with someone who undid all of the work of the first and we were disconnected again before resolution.The third contact worked with me for about three more hours, (new day, because you need an entire evening if you're calling HP) determining the scanner on my printer was defective and the whole thing should be replaced. (The scanner wasn't even the problem, initially!)The pre-paid shipping label for return went to my spam folder (my fault for not checking) but two weeks passed and I contacted HP again only to be shuffled along to three more different people.Meanwhile, since I had been on hold for 45 minutes with intermittent repetitive questions (name, case number, email, phone number, etc) again and again, I noticed that the address on the pre-paid label was wrong, so I knew I was going to need to fix THAT, provided I could get passed back to the right representative. This call's hold time was already long but I didn't want to ruin yet another perfectly good evening, so I just stayed on the phone.Fortunately, Frank from HP Instant Ink helped me pause my ink subscription and even got me in touch with someone at the warranty center who could help. Adding up all the time, it looks like 7-8 hours of tech support went into this machine, and that's not even counting the time it will take to get this to the closest FedEx dropoff pont which is 20 miles from here.Takeaway? I'm on my second HP computer and my third HP printer, so I like the company overall. But the next time I buy a product from them I'll test every feature before the return window expires through Amazon which would have been a far simpler process.Also, I initially liked the ink subscription, especially when I printed more often in the past. Now I am not so sure, especially when it is one more thing that can go wrong, and one more area of HP that you must contact if there's a problem. And that's the main problem with HP's support--they have so many support factions that it is nearly impossible to talk to the person who can help you on the first try.So sit back, pour yourself a cold one, and try not to be cruel to the underpaid worker on the other end of the phone. Something is wrong with the way this company communicates with its consumers, even loyal and patient ones like me, and there is something also wrong with the way problems are communicated between factions of HP Support, given how much hold time a consumer must endure just to reach the actual help that is needed.Good luck, and hope you get a good one!

reviewTitle: DON'T WALK - RUN AWAY FROM THIS PRINTER
reviewDescription: Choose a Brother printer, or literally anything else.I have had this printer for three years and only have successfully printed 30 pages from this in it's entire lifespan. Not only does HP require you pay MONTHLY FEES for you to print from a printer you already own,  but it WILL CHARGE EXTRA FOR USING YOUR PRINTER if you print over the amount of pages you have set up on your subscription service.ATTACHED IMAGES:1. The charge for printing over the amount you designated (making you pay to use a printer you already bought is insane)2. Printer saying it is connected but yet is entirely unable to print no matter how many restarts, ethernet chords, etc. (meaning the HP app you need to download to manage your subscription service as well as print from this printer is faulty and only serves for you to setup a payment plan - who cares if the program works if HP is able to get your money, right?)This printer is a dystopian nightmare and literally the worst case of a company abusing its customers through negligence.1. Printer does not work as advertised despite excessive troubleshooting (i have to troubleshoot each time I print)2. It makes you pay extra to use the printer at all (after buying it)3. It does not care if you are connected to the internet. It does not care if you have an ethernet connection. It does not care if you are God. It will not print unless you pay a monthly fee and sacrifice your first born. And even then - there are 30/70 odds it will print (odds not being in your favor).Do not get this printer. Get any other brand. I don't care what brand - but never get an HP.

What a ripoff.  The printer was impossible to set up and required phone support multiple times to do so.  I do not use a printer very often so it sat for a while before I used it again.  HP wants you to sign up for a monthly subscription service for ink.  I might print ten pages per year.  No need for me to pay for a monthly ink refill.  When I went to use the printer again, it only prints out blank pages.  I was forced to call support again.  I was then informed that the ink cartridges that came with the printer had dried out and the ones they sent with the free month of the subscription service won't work unless you are subscribed.  They literally monitor their ink cartridges digitally.  I had two fresh ink cartridges still in the package but they said they won't work unless I sign up for the monthly service.  Then they told me I need to talk with them for 45 minutes on the phone to get it to work again.  My other electronics do not work this way.  You simply turn them on and they work.  I'm done with home printers.  I will just go to the copy shop from now on or get someone else to print out things.  No time at all for this crap.  Not even worth one star.  I literally printed out two pages before it bit the dust.  Amazon won't refund and I refuse to spend an hour on the phone to get it to work to print out one page.  I give up!

reviewTitle: Won't print, no USB option, barely any ink included. Needs a recall.
reviewDescription: Wow, HP really disgraced themselves with this one. Do NOT buy it.I'm a post production sound engineer who's worked at small studios. When you work for a small studio, YOU are the I.T. guy. I had to manage 2-4 workstations, which included networks, printer and audio interface setup, internet, file sharing, etc. So I know how to set up a printer...This printer would NOT print via wifi, and THERE IS NO USB OPTION! It has a USB port, but it doesn't function by design, as stated in the manual, which says not to plug in USB as it will defeat the wifi. Tell me where on the product page it says "no USB" or "wifi only". In fact on the "interface" line of the specs it says  "USB 2.0".I even contacted my internet provider (spectrum) to make sure that my router was 2.4 compatible, and I had to change the appropriate setting, and the tech support person said that they showed the printer hooked up to my 2.4 ghz wifi network.It still wouldn't print. Not even the test page. I ran the diagnostic function of the "HP Smart" app, which is lacking to say the least, and it came up as having no problems. The panel showed that it had a solid connection with wifi. Still wouldn't print. It would print a little, as shown in the photos. The full page diagnostic prints came from the machine's firmware or something, they were not sent by the computer, as far as I can tell, and it happens as part of setting up the software and drivers. It was not something I sent to the printer.Also, after not even 3 pages of color printing, the color ink indicator went down by an alarmingly significant amount. I believe they do this to get you to subscribe to their ink subscription scam. So the ink cartridges that come in the box might only be good for about 20 pages, if I had to guess...I wound up returning it for a refund. HP should recall this product.

reviewTitle: It's 2024 and the leading brand of printer is this one?
reviewDescription: So, I have owned several HP printers over the last decade, and the quality has decreased drastically. Mostly because of the forced software they are pushing to even use it.I purchased this a few months ago and I'm lucky it even connects to the internet. It prints, but when it's in the right mood to do so. No one knows. And it never scans. I had to use a separate app (HP easy scan) because through HP smart won't scan anything, it says "it can't".You can't even directly print from your browser unless you upload the document to HP smart first - how can they make it so complicated?Frequent connection errors. Now it's not even scanning through HP easy scan because "HP DeskJet 2700 series is currently unavailable. Please check if it is turned on and connected, or try again later." (spoiler: it's turned on and connected). I don't know why I bought another HP, probably because I was used to the layout and operations, but I regretted it as soon as I was in the process of setting it up.I do NOT recommend HP printers to anyone. Seriously. With all the advanced technology in 2024 they can't produce a printer that isn't garbage?I'd go through the warranty, but their support seems even worse to reach than their printer on my connection and I am not prepared for the stress. And I still need to scan documents right now, so I have to go to an Office Depot.

We ordered our HP DeskJet 2755e printer on 7/3/2022 and have had nothing but problems with this printer almost from day one. We received the Instant Ink package with the printer and I thought it was kind of nice of HP to start us off on our printer journey with "free" ink. Boy, was I wrong about it being free. When I checked into it the day after we received our printer, I found that HP would send us ink cartridges depending on our use of the printer (number of pages printed) for a nominal fee of $1.06 (which they would charge us monthly regardless of them sending us cartridges). I called HP and spoke to a product representative and after a brief conversation, I requested that the Instant Ink deliveries be discontinued. After setting up my printer, I just couldn't get it to work no matter what I did. I Downloaded HP Smart to my cell phone and followed its instructions to no avail. I went to the HP site, Youtube, and various sites and nothing helped. Not even calls to Hewlett Packard were helpful. As a last resort I called my computer guy. He came over spent 1+1/2 hours and tried everything. Nothing seemed to work. He asked me if I had an HP account. I told him I had never signed up for an account. He looked around my desk and saw a small box stamped "hp instant ink". He said, "There's you problem!" He told me once I cancelled the Instant Ink deliveries, there's a small chip in the ink cartridge and they cancelled the cartridge's use through that chip. My computer guy told me that if I install cartridges purchased from any store, the printer should work. I bought two (2) cartridges yesterday, installed them and the printer works just fine. The problem is I lost the use of this printer for 16 months because of Hewlett Packard's sneaky tactics. My computer guy charged me $150.00 (more than double the cost of the printer) which never would have happened had Hewlett Packard been conscientious in dealing with their customers. Oh, and by the way, even though I had cancelled Instant Ink package the day after receiving our printer, Hewlett Packard is still charging me. I feel that if Hewlett Packard was an honest, forthcoming company, this incident would never have happened. As far as my purchasing any future products from Hewlett Packard, that depends on them. All I can say is....you need to make this right!

reviewTitle: Enter a pin # every time I scan something? What's up with that???
reviewDescription: Okay. The scanner works well (EXCEPT . . .) and - though I've not really used it much - I am thinking the printer works well too.But . . . BUT . . . Why on earth do I have to enter an 8 digit pin number EVERY SINGLE TIME I want to make a scan??? I tried for several hours to follow the MANY (ugh) different sets of instructions I found online to put an end to this madness but I couldn't get any of them to work for me and my Chrome Computer :-{I'm nearly 80 and - yes - a bit of a Luddite when it comes to 2024 "electronics" (I really miss the old days of "Plug & Play") so I had my nephew and my great niece both over to my house to try to figure the darned thing out. They even talked via facetime with my "computing genius" great nephew who writes code for a huge computer info company. None of them could figure out how to stop the constant demands for my pin number :-{I sell lotsa antique & collectible "stuff" on ebay & elsewhere and this S L O W S me down like crazy.  I really wish I had bought another brand. Does HP think somebody is gonna access my scanner and steal my photos of rare postcards??Sheesh!

reviewTitle: HP Smart & Ink program is slower than molasses.
reviewDescription: The HP ink program and 3 free months of ink is not worth the great deal of added time it takes to have  to print each item by going through the HPSmart App. I have a great internet provider and it has always fast and efficient to click print on my phone and a printed page would be ready in a few seconds. It  took over 5 minutes to print the only page I was able to print. The next day I attempted to print some mailing labels and never could get them to print. I canceled the free ink subscription thinking I wouldn’t have to go through the HPSmart app to print. I was able to print one label in about 15 seconds, before HP communicated with my printer  that I had canceled ink. Then it wouldn’t print anything at all, but nothing tells you that the complimentary ink cartridges that come with every printer I’ve ever purchased, no longer work if you cancel the ink subscription. I had to do an online chat sucking up another 30 minutes of my time waiting on hold to be finally told that the ink cartridges do not work unless you are signed up for the monthly ink charge.  I returned it as in a study done by myself and others, HP sells cheap printers and then overcharge for their ink cartridges that print a fraction of the  copies that their competitors ink charges print. Moral of this story is don’t expect to print a paper for class , or a client presentation real fast and be able to run out the door. It will  not happen. If you happen to get lucky and it prints, it will be so slow that you will be late.

Unfortunately this model won’t work with high speed internetAlso once you are able to connect it it prints fairly slow even though the quality is goodIf I had to buy again o would go with a different modelThe size is okey it’s not tiny but not bulky either

Price was great, B/W printing is acceptable for this casual user, but It does not print in color, despite a new cartridge.  I'm sending the print jobs from a MAC desktop computer.  The test page printed in color, so I know its capable.  What am I doing wrong?!?

This printer is ok for the discounted price I paid.  I don’t use the printer very often so that’s why I chose to buy this particular printer.  The printing quality is fine for my needs.  It was easy to set up, although I did need to watch a couple you tube tutorials on the correct way to load and unload the ink cartridges.  It’s very important to align the printer every time the ink cartridges are changed otherwise the printing quality is very poor (blobby).The ink cartridges are small and will need to be changed frequently if you print frequently so I don’t recommend this printer if you use your printer a lot.  If you only print occasionally this printer is adequate.

I was disappointed when this printer wanted me to purchase a monthly subscription plan. I bypassed that option, but the printer doesn’t work well. It needs to be turned off and back on any time I need to print something. I won’t be buying from this company again.

I bought this printer to use with a 2018 MacBookPro. After several frustrated hours, I discovered the drivers in the laptop are too old to be compatible with the printer. They offered to upgrade my drivers for $150. Haha, to use a with a$40 printer. I didn't open it for a couple of months  and cannot return it.If you consider purchasing this printer, make sure it is compatible with your computer. It's a great price and probably works well.

Got printer set fast but had a few issues.Got everything set  finally ,but got error saying out of in ?Had to go buy a new cartridge of black ink .Cartridge that came with is was defective?Working fine now
I bought this printer to replace my old HP printer 5500. This one is a little more difficult to set up. there's not screen on it. Also, I can't get it to print in color :(What a waste.

I really wanted to like this printer but the service and printer continually have minor issues that are increasingly frustrating. The ink randomly misses text on pages and almost always smudges. The printer will not work without a subscription to HP and requires an app on any devices you want to print from. The app will disconnect the printer and require you to reauthenticate your account. Overall, it's just one thing after another.For reference, I work in the technology industry. I know how to use a printer and have troubleshot this device successfully myself several times. At this point, I am truly convinced this device was made to have several minor printing issues to cause you to have to print one document multiple times. No surprise that HP's subscription model is built on pages per month. Example: Tonight I needed to print 2 pages and it took 5 tries to get two decent prints.Buy a printer that doesn't require apps, subscriptions, or has quality issues like this one.

reviewTitle: Not top quality but is adequate for my purpose
reviewDescription: Doesn't  hold much paper and take longer to print than more expensive models. I use it to print photos  I use as reference  in my art. I print from my phone subjects I am interested in such as close ups of stems and leaves of flowers and plants I see along the roadways. It works for that but it is not good for quality photos.  It is very good for the price. If you want sharp photos this isn't  for you. I compared oe of my prints to a friend's high priced printer and mine was shockingly inferior. But as I said works for me.  Cannot use USB port. Totally wireless

reviewTitle: Printer is OK. Software is garbage.
reviewDescription: It’s a cheap printer so I didn’t have very high expectations. I’ve used and loved HP printers for decades in both my personal and professional life (I’m a tech pro). I bought this because I needed a printer and my business class HP color laser is packed after a move and I can’t find it in the mountain of boxes, so this is a temporary substitute.The printer hardware is cheap but that’s to be expected and it seems to work well. HP software has always been solid and dependable just like their printers, but the new HP Smart App is a disaster. It’s a pretty app with more glitz than substance that is built more to sell you ink than to configure your wifi printer correctly. One of my past job titles is network engineer and I know this stuff very well, so when I state that I couldn’t get the printer to connect to my computer over my wifi network or directly to any of several laptops, know that I exhausted all options. Including network analysis tools.The solution was finally to uninstall the Smart App, purge my Windows registry of all HP entries and install the basic HP driver package (which still tried to install the Smart App), and use a direct USB cable. That worked fine and the printer then worked as expected.So, to recap, use an USB cable, only the basic driver package, and disconnect from the internet while you install it.I would guess that an MBA exec at HP decided to save money by firing US based software engineers and outsourcing app development to cheap labor regions to save money. This results in poorly designed and tested software that frequently fails and ruins the customer experience and ruins the brand’s reputation. It ends up costing more money than it saves. HP, stop letting accountants make operational decisions.

I know what you're thinking: a functional printer for this price? Surely that's worth the gamble, right? And at first, it is. You'll set it up, it'll print a few pages, everything will be fine for a while.But then, sooner or later, it'll all turn sour. It might give you the "PRINTER IS OFFLINE" error message even though it's connected. Or maybe the power button will blink slowly for 10 minutes while the Printer Diagnostics tells you that everything's okay. Sooner or later, this printer will turn on you in the worst way possible. You'll be begging it to work, fighting it, performing every kind of update you can to get it to work. Maybe you'll get lucky, and it'll print your pages; or, maybe it'll simply blink randomly again while you mash buttons in frustration, like an alien console defying your human attempts to master it.I'm begging you. Don't buy this printer. Don't let it worm its way into your life, only to misbehave at every possible opportunity down the line and leave you frustrated and worn. Spend a little more, get a better brand than HP. You'll thank yourself later.

reviewTitle: Would give zero stars if I could.
reviewDescription: I have never disliked a printer more. I set it up and it went alright. the first test page took 2 minutes to print out. I assumed it was just because it was the first page. Then, after the set up process was completed, the printer wouldn’t connect to any device even with the app. The printer was frozen for a couple hours then one page finally printed. It only printed halfway before the printer canceled the job on its own. Ever since then, the buttons have been blinking and giving an error code, even after I’ve done all I can to fix whichever error was appearing on the screen. Even the half page took a couple minutes to print out and the color didn’t come out correct. I have never started a return process faster.

reviewTitle: Worst customer service ever!!! Zero stars!!
reviewDescription: I bought the printer which came with 6 months free ink. I don’t print very often, so when my 6 months expired, I had only received one shipment of ink in the 6 months - that’s all I had printed. I finally ran out of the ink that came with it and put the cartridges from the one shipment in. Now I can’t print. I am writing this while on hold talking to HP support. Apparently when the 6 months of insta-ink expired, they locked the ink cartridges they had previously shipped while I was still within the 6 months. I called IT, ended up transferred to Insta-ink, eventually transferred to registration, to “printer department windows” (what the agent called it). Two different agents have remotes into my phone and laptop and looked at the lights on the printer. I am now at 1 1/2 hrs on the phone. I have repeated the same troubleshooting steps with 3 different people. Hoop after hoop after hoop, same hoops, different agent. This is the worst experience and has reduced me to tears. Now they’re finally going to replace it, but need a credit card to place a hold in case I don’t return the defective one. This is the most ridiculous and traumatic experience. The final length of the call was 1 hour and 43 minutes. I am mentally drained from it.

I bought this printer based on many of the reviews here. I simply needed a printer that would turn on and print things for me when the need arises. Sometimes I have to print documents or scan things for business purposes, but not very often. I just got tired of finding ways to go into town to print things.So I buy this printer and it works exactly the way I expected it to. The set up was fine and I printed many things already. I thought I found the device that would alleviate future headaches. But I was wrong.Because it is not often that I need documents printed, I just keep the printer unplugged from the wall until the day I need to use it again. About 2 weeks after I used it for the first time, I plugged it back in and I began to have wifi connectivity issues with it. It worked fine sitting where it is the last time I printed with it. Finally, after patience of pressing buttons and dealing with online guides to getting it back connected, it printed what I needed. Unplugged it and awaited the next time I would need it.We move on to today. I plug it back in, and it never connects to the wifi. It just sits there blinking. I have to go online and try different things to see if I can get it connected. Nope! Not this time! It has yet to connect to the wifi this time. It's sitting right next to my router. I've reset everything multiple times, tried different suggest button combinations from the web. I'm just lost. It will not simply connect and print.TLDR: I hate this printer.

Previously had an HP printer last about 6-7 years and it quit the other day. Just bought and setup this printer- firstly, it made me sign up for HP+ to finish setup. If you don't already know, this printer will only let you use HP ink due to "security features". Secondly, it comes with 1 black and 1 tri-color HP ink. I installed the HP ink out of the box and it refuses to recognize the black ink cartridge after 1 day. On my old printer, it would have just used the tri-color, but not this one. Printer is now useless until I can drive to town and get more black ink (which I shouldn't even have to do after 1 day and a single print of 2 pages). Very disappointed with this purchase.

I write software for a living and lead a team of 12 developers. I know how Windows works, I know how printers work. This was the most painfully horrible setup experience of my life. I got this setup at home after about 2 hours with my daughter's new laptop for college. After finally getting it setup to do WiFi direct printing, I shipped it up to her. It stopped working as soon as she got it. I spent 2 more hours over Messenger trying to help and troubleshoot to no avail. I never could get it to be recognized as a Bluetooth enabled printer, which would have been much easier. Instead you have to jump through hoops on HP's proprietary "Smart" software...which was terrible. Even after unplugging USB, it still registered as connected via USB. I even unplugged the printer and uninstalled the printer from Windows, but the "Smart" software still saw it as connected over USB and working...not sure how a printer works without being plugged in. This was so painful and it still doesn't work. All I need now is for it to print a piece of paper that says "PC Load Letter" and I'll feel fully justified in taking a baseball bat to it! HP could have spent an extra 0.50 cents and put a screen on the device that actually provides information, like IP address or MAC address instead of you hitting some esoteric button sequence to print network information...which only works SOMETIMES because other times it prints WPS pin numbers (useless!!!). Just a horrible experience. I'd pay $60 to get 4 hours of my life back and never have to see this device and software again.

I Do NOT like this product at all.  I cannot get it to work all the time.  Right now, it won't work at all. I was on the phone with HP for 4:16 hours one day.  It still didn't work right for the scan.  I called another day, and the lady was on the phone with me for about 45 minutes.  It worked at the time but the next time I tried to use it; it didn't work at all.  I called HP both times for the help before the return date was up.  I thought it was fixed.  I got Covid and was out of commission for about 2 weeks.  Now I find the time has run out for returning it.  Now what do I do?

reviewTitle: Never wakes up from sleep mode
reviewDescription: I hate this printer.  I suspect it's far too late for me to return this as I bought it in April and now it's late September.I am not going to waste time discussing anything else other than the problem I am having, which of course, HP refuses to address.  All of their printers come with sleep mode - after a predetermined period of time, which you can change, the printer goes into sleep mode to "save power" - look, HP, I can manage my own electricity, of which I pay for, I don't need your help.  You cannot disable sleep mode.  You can only change how long it remains functional and operational until it decides to shut down and go offline, even though it's in "sleep mode."Now, HP claims that sending a print job to the printer automatically wakes it up.  This is not true.  I can send hundreds of print jobs to the stupid thing and it never wakes up, and that goes for both Windows and macOS.  And iOS.  I doubt it's a faulty model, and it's not like I can do anything about it because HP refuses to offer any assistance whatsoever.I probably won't buy another HP printer ever again because you can't turn off sleep mode and the whole false advertising thing.  The only way I can print anything is to unplug the printer and plug it back in, and I did that shortly before writing this review and it still isn't printing anything.

reviewTitle: Not what I expected from HP
reviewDescription: I've had HP printers since printers were invented and have been totally satisfied with them so when my last printer gave up the ghost, I did not hesitate to purchase another HP.  This printer is a huge disappointment!!  It just seems to be a very cheap version of an HP printer.  It took my son forever to set it up and he was even a little upset with me for purchasing an HP.  After all that, my daughter had to come back the next day because I couldn't get it to print.  She had to work on it for another 30 to 45 minutes and open an HP account in order to get it to print.  All that said, I'm also disappointed with the performance of this printer.  It is as slow as molasses and I'm not that patient.  I've found a used printer exactly like my last one and it'll be here next week.

reviewTitle: Poor quality printing, takes multiple pages at once, POOR customer support
reviewDescription: I've had many printers through my life and this is genuinely the worst I've ever had. I've had HPs in the past and they've always been steadfast and reliable. This one, however, was exceedingly disappointing.It couldn't print colored and black text on the same line - it was always misaligned, even after I did the alignment process on the printer three separate times. When you're printing important documents with certain words highlighted in other colors it is simply unacceptable to see one word slightly above the rest in a different color because the printer couldn't handle keeping the words on the same line. When words were both colored and used black ink, they just looked fuzzy because of this offset.Each time it printed, despite using new printer paper ordered from Amazon, it took 3-5 sheets with each page it printed, sometimes messing it up so it printed on parts of all of those pages, which wasted paper and required me to reprint it.When contacting HP customer support about it, I was offered a free replacement but the agent took 50 minutes to collect my shipping and billing information (because they needed to temporarily charge me $1, which they would refund when they received the old printer back). Beyond this the site he sent to collect payment information didn't work three times in a row. In the end I had to go to an appointment because I hadn't expected the call to take more than maybe 25 minutes so didn't complete the process.When I contacted Amazon again to get in touch with HP support they offered me a refund minus an 18% restocking fee. I took it because I'm tired of dealing with this printer and all the hassle that has come with it.HP printers are now dead to me, which I never thought I would say. Shocking, so incredibly disappointing.
Great value for the money.  However the ink cartridges are tiny and I don't think each will allow very much printing before re-ordering more ink .

Been using this printer for a few months now and it works well. My biggest complaint about this printer is that it doesn’t come off of standby mode and I have to keep unplugging it then plug it back in in order to use it. I press all sorts of buttons to wake it up but it just doesn’t come out of sleep mode. Other than that it is good for the money.

reviewTitle: Good quality, comes with ink, great for college
reviewDescription: I had a lot of connectivity issues with this one, but once it connects I have no issues with it. Was able to print in color and black and white. It’s relatively small for a printer, I store it under my desk. It comes with complementary ink which I always like. If you don’t use printers too much, I’d recommend this printer

reviewTitle: ink costs like the printer itself, so guess what?
reviewDescription: you get ink but it lasts 15 black ink pages with text, and the color is perhaps the same, i ran out of ink in the first 4 days after printing text over 15-20 pages.so if you buy, get extra ink

If you need this for simple home printing, it'll do the job. If you need a lot of print jobs with more complicated print settings, you should get a better printer. But for our simple home needs, it works just fine

So far have only used this printer for printing paperwork for job related stuff.  Pretty easy to set up and once its in use prints items from computer or phone no problem.  Only knock is it does burn through ink rather quickly.  Overall quite satisfied with this purchase.

reviewTitle: Nice buy but dont like the forced HP plans you have to get
reviewDescription: It is a nice house printer to have. However, if you do not subscribe to the plans that HP offers for this printer, you will not be able to use it, especially if you are still trying to use the ink that HP mailed you. You can download the app on your phone and send prints from your phone (so convenient).

reviewTitle: that it is compatible with chromebook
reviewDescription: chromebook is very difficult to find compatible apps and devicies to connect. Sorry I bought a google chrome product

This is a great printer! My only problem is that it took me quite awhile to figure out how to scan things. I had to turn to google. And it also disconnects from my computer often. And it’s only about 3 feet away from it.

reviewTitle: Power cord would not stay plugged into printer
reviewDescription: The power cord would not stay plugged into the printer. Luckily the cord from the Canon printer I was replacing fit and is working just fine. Other than that, printer is working great; much faster and quieter than my two previous printers which were both Canon.

Sometimes it would print and then it wouldn't.  It would go off line.  I finally found a number to call and they insisted I needed to do a remote.  I felt like I didn't have a choice.  They tried to sell me a winzip updater for at least 139.00.  Then nothing about the printer would work.  I am not sure what they did!!!!!I am not sure why you felt this was a positive review.  Anything but.  NOT HAPPY WITH THIS PRODUCT.  I don't think I would ever buy a HP printer again.
I purchased without checking the compatibility of this printing to my Mac Air.  I was impressed with how compact and light the printer was.  Sorry I had to return it.
Arrived in a timely manner. Very well packaged for delivery. Prints well easy to set up. A bit to setup the WiFi.
easy to use color are great the ink durability no jams

I purchased this printer even though it's wireless.  I wanted a USB printer but I guess they're a thing of the past.  We have very spotty Internet and the power goes out quite often so I'm leary about this printer.  The setup was a breeze.  I opted out of HP+/instant ink which was very easy to do.  I'm not a this location year round so instant ink wouldn't make sense.  I downloaded the HP app onto my laptop (I'm not using an app on my phone to  printe things at my desk).  So far, I've only printed a couple of documents so I can't tell you much more at this point in time.  It's very lightweight which is a plus when clearing paper jams on any printer (I usually have to move my printers around to find the jam).  One problem - the power cord is very short!  I'd say it's about 3 feet.  I ordered a 6 foot  power cord for it.  If you're receptacle isn't right near the printer - order a longer  power cord.  I haven't odered more ink so I have no idea what it's going to cost me going forward.  At my location ink does not last so I can't stock up on it.  I'll review again when I've put it to the test.  Wish me luck!
App is a little finicky and my printer disconnects all the time but I needed a cheap printer so 🤷‍♀️
The only issue I have is just how fast the ink goes. Other than that the printers a great deal and works very well.
No issue great price easy to attach to ph as well

reviewTitle: Great size and pretty good quality for quick home printing
reviewDescription: Size of perfect. Doesn’t need much space. Have had for a month now and printing has been super easy and quick. For home use, it’s perfect. If you’re printing a lot of pages at once, it doesn’t have the feature to print two sided unless you flip pages manually but doesn’t bother me since I wanted a printer that was to be used for basic things like printing a shipping label, or confirmations, etc.the color printing is OK but for my needs, does the job

reviewTitle: Have to understand how they market the ink
reviewDescription: Just wanted an adequate copier/printer. It seems to be working satisfactorily.

I thought I got a great deal, I really only needed a printer for every once in a while occasions so I don't need to visit the library to print things off, like boarding passes or confirmations.Set up was simple. It worked on the first try. I rarely use this printer, but it is ALWAYS out of ink. I print a couple pages just fine. Then it needs more ink. The amount of ink i've had to purchase cost way more than the printer.I am not exaggerating when I say you will get about 5-7 normal text pages before it runs out of ink. Then you need to buy $30 of more ink. Don't get stuck in this trap. HP is just trying to make you buy a stupid amount of ink to get this printer to do it's job.

We’ve had this printer for a few years now and my hatred for it grows stronger by the day. It only prints if you enroll with HP Instant Ink which is a monthly subscription for ink and charges you based on the number of pages you print per month… at that point I’d rather go to the library? We’re paying for paper and ink, why am I paying to print pages on top of that? The print quality is also laughable. I’ve attached a photo of our most recent print job which was just a google document, nothing elaborate or crazy. Set up is also a royal pain and the printer only connects to our devices about half the time. This printer and business model are insane. We’ll be tossing this hunk of junk and replacing it with a non-HP printer.

The scanner won't work without HP Smart program. The HP Smart program cannot be loaded onto anything older than Windows 10.  Then, if you do install it, it tries to take over the rest of your computer and replace a bunch of other programs, such as your web browser.  There were about ten different programs I had to tell it NOT to install.I was already upset about the HP Smart app, when 2 weeks after delivery, the printer started feeding paper through the printer 2-at-a-time.  Every single page it tried to feed.  The two pages would jam just as it was entering the print mechanism.  It would feed one inch into the print mechanism, jam, and print the entire page in one spot on the paper.  It would feed-and-print halfway down the page, and then jam.  Trying to print a 5-page document, I had to start the printout maybe 6 times, each time starting it again at the point where it jammed.The next time I tried to use it, 2 days later, I tried hand-feeding one sheet at a time.  Even only feeding one sheet, it fed the paper *crooked*, jammed, and I had to pull it out and reseat it a couple of times before I was able to get a readable copy.HP used to be the most reliable printer on the market for the home user.  Not any more.  The HP Smart program is not safe for the average home user, the scanner cannot be used by any older PCs on your home network, and the printer isn't worth the cost of the plastic it's made from.

I am not one to write reviews. However this thing is horrible. If you need to print something, expect to waste 10-15 minutes (no exaggeration) of trying to print a single document.My documents are usually 2-3 pages. The printer is constantly losing connection midway through the print job. I then have to reprint it.When it does successfully print a document, and I have to print another one, it loses connection and I have to turn it off and back on. That may sound simple, except it takes a minute to turn off and another minute to turn back on.Nothing is simple with this printer. Do not buy this printer. It is a waste of money and your time.Update 08/22/2024: After 2.5 months of owning this printer and not using it. I had a single page to print. The printer will not turn on and now needs to be sent back to hp for “repair.” I cannot stress to the general public how much frustration this printer is. DO NOT BUY, I repeat, DO NOT BUY.

reviewTitle: Being held hostage by a printer
reviewDescription: I wish I could return. Unless you sign up for the ink subscription, you will not be able to use it. You can buy ink elsewhere (and it costs about as much as the printer itself) but I had a million connectivity issues and was not able to use it. I signed up for the subscription (bc I NEEDED the printer) and all connectivity issues were miraculously resolved.I'm essentially being held hostage by HP's ink subscription now. And it limits how many pages you can print. The ink cartridges will stop working once you reach your page limit even if they still have ink. You can buy more pages but some months, I might not need to print as many as the month before or I may need to print more, etc. It's just a bad deal.

I had this printer for under 24 hours and am now returning it. The machine was frustrating to set up by providing me with 3 errors. All of the errors were marked as "unknown", making trouble shooting a challenge. I assumed the issue was that I was using the app (which was suggest via a broken QR code in the packaging). I swapped to my computer after turning on its wireless card (I normally have a wired connection) and it still took a bit of fiddling to get it on the network. Even then, I could not add the print to my computer since it called for a WPS Pin that I did not have and once I figured out how to get the pin (Thank you Youtube!) the pin was not recognized.When I got the printer on the network, I could not print unless I used the HP app for some reason. The machine will not print unless I open the app and select the file, meaning that trying to print in any native way (i.e. using the print command in Word,  Acrobat etc) would result in a failed print job. I originally chalked it up to being a new machine that I am unfamiliar with, but the final straw was this morning. I booted my computer and went to print a test page and my computer could not find the machine on the network. The printer was literally set up the night before and apparently cannot maintain a connection after about 12 hours.I think the worst part is that it has no USB connection - so you cannot plug into it and troubleshoot from there. This might be a firmware glitch that could get an update to fix IF I had someway to connect to the printer since its wifi is crappy. Maybe I got a lemon on this one, but it was a bad enough experience for me to stay away from HP and to ship this printer back to sender.

WiFi was difficult to setup. Once I had WiFi setup, I printed a few pages and it worked fine. I had only printed very few pages when I was trying to print an Amazon return label for my wife and It wouldn't print all of the information. It left pieces out. I was trying to figure that out when I noticed that my scanner wasn't working and print was no longer black but more gray. I went online and followed troubleshooting guidelines, no good. I finally managed to get printer tech support who I allowed to remote into my printer. They asked some questions and looked around in my printer and computer. They determined that I have a virus in my computer which transferred to my printer and I must get it cleared right away or it could do much damage to my printer and computer (scare tactics). She said she could get me in touch with the HP computer tech who could fix this for a base fee of $79. I declined. I talked to my own computer tech who suggested I could be low on ink. I thought that was improbable because I had printed so little. I ended up replacing ink cartridges and that fixed the problem, no virus, no need to pay HP to check it out. This has left me to not want to buy another HP product again.

My issue is not with the printer, but with HP. The printer itself is fine, but HP's customer service is abysmal, leading to my decision to buy another printer and to never buy another HP product ever again. I ran out of ink and ordered replacement cartridges online. I received an email from HP that they had detected a non-HP ink cartridge and that I should remove it or face losing HP+. A little disappointing, but fine - I subscribed to Instant Ink and replaced the off-brand cartridges with the ones from HP+. I continued to receive emails from HP telling me I will lose HP+ if I don't replace the cartridges. I go onto the HP website to talk to tech support to inform them that the cartridges in the printer are from their Instant Ink program, so they shouldn't be detecting off-brand cartridges anymore. I have to add the printer as a device to my account before I can talk to customer support. Fine, I'll add the printer. Except that when I enter the serial number, the website says "service unavailable". Fine, I'll select the option to let HP detect the device since it's connected to my network - and the detection fails. So I'm left with a printer that's going to lose benefits that came with the device despite doing everything HP asked me to do, and thanks to issues with the website being unable to add my device, it is literally impossible for me to talk to someone to resolve the issue. Not to mention HP will remotely turn off the ink cartridges you've already paid for if you get them through the Instant Ink subscription and then cancel your subscription. Frustrated and disappointed - never doing business with HP again.

I was very disappointed with this HP Desk Jet printer from the very beginning.  There were so many red flags and now I'm stuck with it because the return window has expired. The setup was not at all easy.  The printer failed to recognize the black cartridge during the setup procedure and I had to return the printer and have another one shipped to me.  When the replacement arrived, I followed the directions step by step which involved downloading an app to my phone and creating an account with HP.  This was very slow and time consuming.  Once I completed the setup and started using it, I found out that often when I went to print I would receive a "no printer found" message on my screen.  I had to manually power down the printer (it appeared to be asleep and would not wake up and I could not find a setting to keep the printer from going to sleep) before I could print.  I also found that the only print option would be "print to PDF" which I did not want to do.  Also, the free ink promo is a bit confusing.  I did receive free ink automatically during the promo period but I learned that once the promo period ends I would need to pay a monthly fee for this "free ink" and that monthly fee increases depending how how many sheets you print per month!  I have been working with computers and printers going back more than 30 years.  I wish you could simply run the setup without needing an account and a Wi-Fi connection.

reviewTitle: Must download 2 HP apps and create new accounts. Smears on anything but cheap paper.
reviewDescription: Pros: CheapCons: Here's a list...1) To install this printer I had to download 2 apps to my phone and fill out all kinds of information to create accounts. TWICE.2) Anything but the cheapest thinnest paper streaks when going through the machine. I cleaned the heads multiple times. It did not fix it.3) When you reinstall new ink you have to not just wait for it to do the check, but wait for it to print out a color test page. Then you have to put it on the scanner and wait for it to scan. I could never figure out how to avoid this.4) Since you signed up for TWO apps, you'll be getting lots of emails. Sometimes if you just print stuff it will send you an email that says "looks like you are printing a lot". I found this terribly unhelpful.5) The amount of documentation and settings you have to look through to find an answer is huge. Remember there are TWO apps.6) The make the instant ink thing sound like it's a great convenience.  If you print the same amount each week, I guess so. But if you go weeks and don't print and then need to print 40 pages you are going to run out of ink probably. Then you have to wait for them to send you new ink.  I think it's more convenient to have a printer that allows me to stock up on my own ink. I never ran out when I bought my own ink.7) The final straw was that I can't log in to either app now. I've reset the password 4 times. There's no way for me to get in and cancel the subscription. I know have to call support and give them the serial number.Never again HP!
If you don't have Wi-Fi it is hard to use this printer it will print if you scan it and print it. But you have to use a USB port to use with your Chromebook

Slower than I expected. Also larger footprint than I expected. It doesn't really fit well under my computer desk where my old printer was. Set-up was easy. Works fine. Just slower anf bigger than desired.Update: it just jammed again.  I've only had this for a few weeks and it has already jammed a bunch of times.

The printer works ok now that we got past the wonky software set-up. Best be aware: go ahead and order ink cartridges now. They sent cartridges that needed replacement after ten (10) sheets of printing:(
I’m still trying to connect to my wifi. It keeps telling me my key code is wrong and it isn’t! Any ideas?The print looks good on a copy though.

reviewTitle: Setup is WAY more difficult than it has to be. MUST download an app to use it...No Thanks.
reviewDescription: Once upon a time, long ago, nearly ten whole years now...all you had to do to set up your printer was to find your laptop on your wifi and pair it, or even plug the sucker into your laptop with a USB cable. TADA! Connected! Now??? Nope. You have to download an app to your phone, even if you never intend to print from your phone (because it isn't permanently attached to your hand and you can function without it). Then you have to ask for a code. Then you have to pair the printer to your phone. THEN you have to send a link to yourself via email to download to your laptop, so you can pair your printer to your laptop.I have no idea why it is that every single time a "new and improved" version of a piece of tech comes out, it has "improved" so much that it takes an additional five steps to get the thing to work.PS: HP, if you're listening, your tech used to work MUCH better before you "improved" it and added useless steps. I'd buy your products in the future if you hadn't altered your user-friendly setup processes to include mandatory phone tethering and apps. This is the last piece of HP junk I will ever buy--not because it doesn't work. It DOES work. But because I refuse to be forced to jump through hoops to use the machine I've already paid for. Sell me a printer that I can just pair to my wifi or plug-n-play, and I'll buy it. App pairing for simple device use is cheap and invasive to privacy. If I hadn't already ripped all the tape and packaging off this thing, and printed three pages of setup instructions on new ink cartridges, I'd ship this disappointing piece of Chinese garbage back to you.
A little difficult in setting up and connecting to your phone. Ink dies not last long. Had to change the cartridge at 3 weeks with very minimal use.

I personally don’t like printers, either they eat the paper, stop working, ink dries out, or doesn’t connect. This one so far is ok. I had to turn in on and off a couple of times to get it to reconnect to print. But mechanically it’s good. Set up took a few trouble shooting issues. It couldn’t find it. I know there’s a lot of factors.

There is a small damage to it, as pictured, when I unboxed it. It doesn't affect the functionality so I choose not to return it as I need it for a project this week.  There also was no PIN or code included for the 3 month free ink trial. But otherwise seems to be a decent value for the price.
Cheap.  Can't control print quality.  Doesn't fax.  No feed for copies, one at a time.  Basic printing, but okay.
Hard to setup but I was in a hurry. Just moved so I will try again. Test page printed nicely. Speed is decent.

reviewTitle: Good little printer not for heavy volume use
reviewDescription: This is a good little printer for occasional use, not recommended for heavy volume.  Description says it will print 2-sided, but printer is not duplex and requires manual intervention to flip paper to finish printing on back side.  Print jobs take a while to queue up and printing is slow, especially if printing pictures or internet shots.  Printer loads paper from top rear making it awkward to print from a bookshelf or inside a cabinet —it is compact and pretty enough (and better) to display it openly on a desk or counter.  Looks to be more suitable for single sheet printing.  Printer is lightweight and feels a bit filmsy, but is pretty sturdy albeit hard to pop open some of the compartments for fear of breaking the doors.  No problem printing from all of your devices.  Fairly easy to install, but a bit surprised by complexity of installation.  It is not like the old wireless printers that you plug in, turn on and the computer detects a new device, installs it, and you are good to go.  HP (and me) recommend using the HP app for installation.  Does install wirelessly and also with an ethernet cable.  HP will walk you thru install if you don’t want to download app.

reviewTitle: Excellent Printer, Especially for the Price -- NO FREE INK WIRED
reviewDescription: This really is a great little printer.  It is exactly what I wanted, and after reading all the positive reviews, my mind was made up, especially in light of getting 6 months of free ink.  The printer set up in less than 5 minutes right out of the box.  I have it WIRED, not wireless.  My PC is also HP, so I was printing right away.  Great print quality!  Here's the rub -- I was really enticed by the 6 months of free ink.  I spent probably an hour online trying to set that up, but it wouldn't work, so I had to contact an HP tech to help set it up.  Spent an hour with the first tech who couldn't figure it out, and was then transferred to a second tech.  after another hour and a half, the problem was still not solved.  It turns out you have to have both your printer and your PC on wifi in order to get the free ink.  I don't want to have my PC on wifi because wireless communications are more easily hacked.  So I can't get the free ink because I prefer to have my PC WIRED and SAFER.  SUX.  Five minutes to set up, 3 and 1/2 hours to find out I can't get the free ink if my PC is wired.  Why can't they just tell you that?  It would certainly save a lot of frustration.  And you can't get the automatic refills, either, because without the PC and printer communicating on wifi, the signal doesn't go out to request new ink.  Seriously SUX!  Other than that, the printer is great.UPDATE:  A year later and I am LOVING this printer, despite the problems I had during setup.  It works like a charm and is VERY RELIABLE.  If I needed a second printer, I'd buy this one again, for sure!!

reviewTitle: YOU NEED THE HP SMART APP TO INSTALL THIS PRINTER, ALTHOUGH IT IS MENTIONED NOWHERE ON INSTRUCTIONS
