reviewDescription: Let me save you HOURS of frustration and misery. To properly install this printer, you will need the HP Smart app from the App Store (or Android/PC equivalent). This app is in addition to the setup installer they instruct you to install.If you automatically go to the setup installer like the instruction tell you to, there's a big chance the installer will tell you that there is "no printer found" and to check all of your power cords, USBs, etc. I spent half an hour accepting the fact that this was going to be much more complicated than that.I came back a few hours later and was ready to figure this printer out. This would not defeat me. It was too affordable. Anyway, I was clearly stuck at the phase of the printer being found on "my network." To make a painful story short, I finally concluded that there was apparently an HP App that was downloadable to your COMPUTER. Nowhere is that explained. Nowhere. This very, very simple piece of information would have saved me an afternoon of madness.Other than that, if I had been told the manual even mentioned this (or the app itself once on any piece of paper included with the printer), the setup would have taken about 15 minutes. No sweat.The app itself tries to interface directly with your browser, and will continually switch between using the app window and the browser window, so make sure you have an up-to-date browser. That would have saved me about an hour, but honestly was my fault. Although I will say, I don't see much point or convenience to the app needing to have you access HP.com on your browser continually. Unnecessarily complicated.You'll also need to create an HP account. Odd to assume everyone already has an HP account and the app installed beforehand without instruction. They easily could have just stated this, which would have simplified the entire process.After all of this, the printer works flawlessly. Superfast, super quiet, and the setup ink is more than enough to cover you for a while. It was well worth the low price, and I don't regret my purchase, although I'm still mildly infuriated that they couldn't just come out and say that I'd need to download another one of their products (the app). It wasn't sneaky; it just made it more annoying.
Easy to set up and works great
Muy bueno
So far works as expected

reviewTitle: Very nice butfairly basic all in one printer
reviewDescription: My old printer finally died.  I purchased this model as the replacement and so far, so good.  The print quality is pretty good and so far, the ink consumption has been manageable.  All and all, a pretty good deal for the price.

Had a great deal of trouble getting it to work.  Talked to HP trouble shooters twice and final found out our internet is not fast enough to support this printer. Talked to numerous people about not including this information anywhere on the package or discrimination.
Great value for price! Easy to use and connects simply enough and very quiet overall.
This is a reliable printer. Setup had a bump or two but I prevailed. The wireless connection works well.
I had a really hard time connecting it to my laptop but after 3 people helped meI got it running

reviewTitle: I don’t want the automatic delivery of ink.
reviewDescription: It is easy to use. Printing and scanning.
Lite weight and easy setup
I would've gave a five star but it doesn't give directions on how to scan. I had to utubeTo find out.  Maybe I'm a little outdated :-) but overall it does what I need it to do.

The color ink cartridge ran out of ink after printing 5 sheets in draft mode. This does not equal 3 months of ink. I've had to reinstall it after unplugging it and I shouldn't have needed to do that. I also don't like that it needed access to the internet. I miss the old plug in and use printers that worked well with every windows system.
Inexpensive, functional, wireless (only supports 2g). Print quality is good.

My previous printer just died after 7 years. I was looking for a cheap printer because I don’t really print much and didn’t want to spend too much. Despite some of the negative reviews I took a shot with this one.I spent about 40m setting this thing up. I’ve set up quite a few printers in my life, for me, friends and family and this has been the most tedious and time consuming one. All the setup has to be done from the HP app. The app failed multiple times while setting up. I had to restart every time. After finally getting it connected to my network, it printed a test page and all the letters were doubled. I had to do a print head alignment, which you sort of have to dig around in the app to find. Then it had to do an update so that took a while. I swear I almost packaged this thing back up to return, but just practiced a bit of patience.After all of that, I was able to get some quality pages to print.It’s a bit slower then my past more expensive printers and it is a little loud but I won’t be using it too much for that to bother me.The saying stays true, you get what you pay for. It is a budget printer after all and it gets the job done. I see some reviews where others seem to get this thing setup in a few minutes. I guess it’s a hit or miss with the one you get.If you print once in a while then I think the price is fair, just be prepared incase you get one that doesn’t want to play nice during setup.

Wished I would’ve purchased the next higher-priced HP printer. This printer works well but not the quality and design of my previous one so was a bit disappointed in my choice. Did have a bit of a problem with customer service over an issue but after an hour was transferred to the right personnel to assist. It is easy to use except when changing ink cartridges.

reviewTitle: Blink & you are out of ink after 10 pages
reviewDescription: The HP printer is lightweight,  small and connected easily, I purchased this printer because of the ratings, but failed to read about the ink. I purchased it 2 days ago and printed 15 copies and and out of black and colored ink. I will ve sending back. You get what you pay for. I would not recommend it at all.

It's a piece of junk. I've printed 0 things with color, no photos no nothing. Only a few pages of text with black ink. Now it won't print Anything. I am so mad. It says it doesn't have ink. It is online on the proper network and it's garbage.

HP sells you an idea to never run out of ink when you purchase their subscription. It was cool at first getting free ink, but over time it was starting to add up. They charge you 30 pages for .99 cents a month and over a certain pages they would charge you additional fees. I remember my friend going on a printing rampage and printed 30 pages. We were charge around $9 plus another fee on the side. Sounds  great right? If you don't print much I wouldn't recommend it. It gave me a fear to print because I would not know how much I would get charge every month. On top of that after you cancel your subscription, HP PUT A PROGRAM TO BLOCK YOUR PRINTER FROM USING THEIR INSTANT INK, so I am sitting here with a bunch of leftover ink. There is a 3rd party you buy ink to use for the printer however I heard it might be difficult and risky because ether have a program to block that as well. (Which they are using to track if you are connected to wifi) also the printer is basic printing which isn't bad, but if you're doing heavy projects I wouldn't recommend it. I also had a lot of wireless connectivity issues. Thank you for reading this review and that's all I could say. Time for a new printer :)

The printer, when it decides to prints, black and white prints, but the color is of poor quality if you do not use it enough. Do not buy the instant print subscription. You are charged and amount every month but are only allowed to replace your cartridges IF the company’s computer system tells the company you need one. Basically it is monitored to how often you print and the quality of printing from the device at the company and not the actual print that has printed at your house or company. Connection is determined by the company’s computer not the actual connection you have at your house or business. The printer itself is not user friendly and do not bother calling the company because on their end the connection is at full capability. Also, be ready to be at the printer when printing because it does not have an effective holder for what it being printed, so it well be in a cascaded mess that you will have to place what you printed in the correct order of the project printed. Do not add too much paper or it will jam and not work, not enough and you will wait to continue to add paper so what you are printing will be able to print all papers. It is useless unless you are printing a black and white cartoon that your child can color. Again, you can only do that if your printer decides to connect to the device you are printing from. I am currently looking for the email about the printer may not work as well unless you order from them.

We purchased this product to print out a series of forms to enroll our child in school, since they could only take a signed hard copy... (and didn't have any available that i could pickup and bring home) and since I do not have any further use for a home printer, figured we'd save a few dollars and purchase this.The good - It was fairly wallet friendly. Its aesthetically pleasing. And when it works, is on the more quiet side.The bad - It requires proprietary software to install and get assigned to a network, Ink is laughably expensive, and best of all out of seven assigned jobs... the only thing its actually printed is HP stuff that i was required to print/copy for setup. Every single job I have assigned it just sits in the queue... waiting. I tried printing from the proprietary app, and from the desktop, and my phone. And its waiting. And waiting. And guess what else it does... It waits (3h in queue at this time). Good luck finding help or answers with an AI assistant, or in the help documentation.I am not amused and will consider this experience going forward anytime that I see ANYTHING branded with the initials HP.

reviewTitle: Wish I had paid attention to bad reviews
reviewDescription: I bought an HP printer in the uk when I lived there. Loved the convenience. If you are a new user, I probably would recommend this for convenience, even if the print quality is subpar compared to what used to be available in the 90s and 2000s for consumers (why is it suddenly so hard to get a decent consumer print?!). Anyway… moved to the USA. Bought a new HP and added it to my account. And that’s where it all went downhill. Couldn’t subscribe to instant ink no matter what I tried - app, website, nothing. Kept getting an error right when it was about to connect. Fine, I thought. I’ll just make a whole new account. So I did. Got to the instant ink section, another error. Fine, I thought, maybe it’s an app thing and I need to go to the website. Got to the sign up, only to be told my country is… Australia? I didn’t add anything about Australia into any settings. I’ve looked everywhere on my NEW account for a country, even added an American address - the instant ink sign up still doesn’t let me change from Australia for my shipping address. Bear in mind that this email address is an entirely new one with a new domain. Customer service is AI, and from googling I found out you cannot change countries unless you make a whole new account. Which I did. The over complication of this, the fact that I have to chase up customer service to find a human (who I know will give me yet another run around and give suggestions I already tried) makes the so called convenience not worth it at all. I would rather have paid for a printer where I can control my ink - this is now a glorified paperweight.

I bought this printer last year hoping it would live up to the good reviews. When I bought it, it came with some kind of subscription to "Instant Ink", which I didn't fully understand, but OK I guess it could be convenient to have ink shipped when I'm running low.The problem - the printer almost NEVER responds because, for some reason, after being connected to my network for a day or so, it loses it's IP address but remains connected to the WiFi. This causes it to show up on my computer and in the HP Smart app as being "connected" - but will not respond to print requests because of the stupid Instant Ink tracking, which needs an IP address apparently in order to keep track of how many pages I'm printing.This has been nothing short of infuriating. I don't need to print documents very often but when I do need to, it is urgent. So unfortunately, it took me many months where I hardly printed anything before I realized this is a constant problem. Lately, every time I've had to print something I basically have to spend an hour with HP's online support before we can get it working. Then the next day, it just doesn't work again. Nobody has been able to send me clear directions on how to fix it, and the HP documentation online is confusing and outdated, often giving directions from outdated versions of the app that no longer have the same settings, features, etc.I wish I could just return it, but unfortunately I had it for several months before I realized it was an issue, and it was only after continually encountering the same problem that I realized basically, if I need to print something, I can count on losing 30-60 minutes of my day troubleshooting things so this piece of junk will actually work.I'm about to just go full Office Space on this thing - DO NOT BUY ONE. Spend more money to get a good printer that doesn't require you to be signed up for some scammy ink tracking service.

reviewTitle: I'd almost rather have my 15-year-old printer back
reviewDescription: I bought this printer to replace my super old one that took 10 minutes to work itself up print anything and fundamentally refused to connect to wifi, despite that being one of its features. I'd had it for probably 15 years before it finally got a fatal error. Then I looked into a new printer and found this one.The setup wasn't bad, but man do I wish I could return this thing. The paper tray does not guide the paper in well, and it isn't clear if the paper is sitting properly in the slot for the rollers to grab. Half the time, it only feeds the paper halfway through and gets stuck. Sometimes it eats the paper and crinkles it.The quality of the print is not good. The very first thing I printed should have been the red flag I needed to return it, but I wanted to give it a chance. The text was blurry and actually looked like it had a doubled text effect like a drop shadow. Except there was no drop shadow. It was just a low-quality print. Much worse than my archaic printer.But my biggest gripe is that without fail, I have to print at least one copy of something to throw away before it will print mostly correctly. Just look at that photo I submitted. That's a 3-page contract for my business where every 4th line or so on the first and second pages got cut off, and the third page is unreadable. This is the copy I printed first (so it isn't a matter of running out of ink), and then I print another, which prints mostly fine, with the occasional first letter of a word smudged. The amount of ink and paper I waste just getting this thing to do its one job is disgraceful. And considering you're set up automatically on their ink program that tracks how much ink and paper you use, it's really not a good look.I would recommend buying a different printer. Or, if you've already bought this printer and it's outside the warranty, a really nice baseball bat and a different printer.

reviewTitle: HP inks are the worst. Might be the reason for a 6 month free trial inks
reviewDescription: I got this printer months ago and kept it stored until the outgoing buggy Canon one ran out of ink.  That was my mistake. I should have tested it, so I could return it within the return window.The ink dried up (IN IT'S (supposed to be airtight) PACKAGING?!) and I had to print something for an emergency (a Motor vehicle registration form) and the printout was SO terrible.  Fading out blacks.  Things were line-y, and the text was garbled.This is not the first time HP inks have died out prematurely on me.  We have another HP photo printer and the ink of that one dried out and didn't print anything any more.  The next replacement ink I got I had to remove it and store it in an airtight container, but when I tried to use it again the cartridges were reported damaged by the printer.  So I had to get a third batch.  I haven't used the photo printer (the other printer) in a while, and I'm not confident the ink will work again, considering its shelf life.Note to any buyer: If you don't print at least 100 times a month, don't get HP.  The ink expires when not in use (possibly after a week).  What the hell, even?

Do you like babysitting little children who are basically feral? Ever wanted to have a(nother) child, but get stuck between the ages of 1 and 2 forever? Do you like micromanaging little children who need constant attention, monitoring, asking of “what’s wrong” and then not getting a response? Do you have hours and hours of free time every day and are completely and utterly bored? Do you love to gamble if items that you purchase that should work as it states actually works or not?  If so, then this is the printer for you!Not only do you have to monitor every single job, just in case it randomly decides to stop printing, needs to skip ONE item in your queue (usually one that you’ll need to go waaay back and figure out which particular item didn’t print correctly and then woe be to you if you happened to close the page your were on. But you’ll also get to watch it just stop! Just like that  No reason. No error. No message. Nothing. It will just. randomly. Stop. And you then get the pleasure of disconnecting and reconnecting the plug (sometimes works), opening and force-closing and then reopening the HP Smart (not so smart) app (also, sometimes works), or have the awesome pleasure of sitting in a chat with someone from support for four hours who may or may not find something wrong (sometimes works).Indeed, sometimes, in the middle of the night, after you’ve gone to bed, hours after giving up on your printing queue, at 2:00am, the printer will just randomly decide that it’s ready to finish printing your queue, and will whip it up for you in 30 seconds flat! But only sometimes. Just like a little, pouty, tantrum-having toddler.So if whiny toddlers are your thing, if wasting hours of your days are cool, then I would definitely recommend this printer. If, however, you expect a printer to accept a print job, print it, and then be done, you may want to look elsewhere.ZERO STARS.

reviewTitle: The Worst Printer and Service, Avoid
reviewDescription: I have never had so many issues with a printer on so many different areas. Seriously, if one aspect doesn't work, then the printer and service won't work. It is the biggest waste of money - if you sign up for their ink delivery, you can only print a limited amount of pages (50 or so, so this is terrible if you're a student or rely on paper copies of docs for editing) before they cut you off (unless you pay more, of course).My printer never connected properly to a computer I bought after having it connected to an original. It never corrected. I had to use the wireless printing option and, because of this, when my black ink ran out, the ink service that I paid for month after month never sensed how low it was. I literally could not print with black ink and had to use color. Until the color ink started to run out. And because it never connected properly, I couldn't get replacements, even though I was still paying.I tried their troubleshooting app. I tried reinstalling drivers. I tried everything.The only con is that it was so light, I had no trouble bringing it to the garage room.DO NOT BUY HP PRINTERS, THEY ARE MONEY-SUCKING PIECES OF GARBAGE

reviewTitle: Never buy a HP printer again. Additional information.
reviewDescription: Read the end which is my most recent revision. While I gave one star in reality it deserves a minus ten stars and so does Amazon!!!While the delivery was one day sooner than expected, it took several hours to set up even with a grandson who is extremely computer literate. I have never had a problem in setting up any computer devices before. The instructions are pitiful and the web site is a joke. I'll try Epson or another vendor next time that I need a printer. Now HP says they will be cancelling my account for automatic ink. Its just as well - this thing is a expensive door stop. Their help is a joke as is the printer. On line I found that the problem of entering the sleep stage is a problem that they are aware of but the pitiful instructions to correct this have tell me to press a button that simply do not exist on my printer. their service is a joke. They just lost a long time customer. Shame om Amazon for recommending this product. It makes me question the validity of any Amazon recommendation. Two months of trying to fix this I get a virtual assistant who get me on an endless loop. Needless to say there is no understanding on the HP site. The printer did work for one day then fell asleep again. My daughter has the same model of printer purchased the same time as mine and has no problems YET. This is reason not to buy anything from Amazon. Shoddy products. I am considering to buy locally in the future -  not from Amazon!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!update. I tried to order Instant Ink and was continually told that I did not supply complete information but I did and that the order was cancelled but after 6 months they started to bill me. I contacted HP and after a few hours they closed my complaint case file. I suffered a stroke years ago and lost function in my right hand. I type with one finger on my left hand. It is a slow process but apparently too slow for HP and they closed my case because it took me too long to state my case. AMAZON SHOULD INVESTIGATE. I AN GOING TO CANSEL MY CREDIT CARD THAT THEY ARE BILLING. THEY WILL PROBABLY SUE ME FOR NON-PAYMENT. BRING IT ON THEY WILL HAVE A LARGE SUIT.

What they don't tell you when you're considering this purchase, and even after, is that the cartridges provided aren't standard ink cartridges. They are, as the technician on the phone informed me, included only for the purpose of printing test pages and, as such, only include enough ink for about a dozen pages. Further, for whatever reason, they never really show up as being empty, even after all the ink has been used.I rarely use a printer, so I was able to get a few prints off of the included cartridges, thinking they were just standard ones. After several months, I go back to use the printer, and I'm a little perplexed as to why I have very low ink levels  ...allegedly still usable, but low. Worse, I try to print something and only two colors show up, very faintly. I assume there must be dried ink on the printheads, so I proceed with the cleaning function and am gifted with a blank test page. I try the next level cleaning and get the same result. The app then suggests I call customer service or initiate a chat with a technician. I chose the latter and after about 20 minutes of troubleshooting, I'm informed about the hobbled cartridges sent with the printer from the factory. After installing new cartridges, the printer now functions normally. I was relieved because I was giving serious consideration to throwing the thing into a wood chipper. (not really) Again, nothing in the installation instructions mention the need to buy additional cartridges. Considering the cost of buying ink, suddenly the price of the printer doesn't seem like that great of a deal. Sure, they offer "six-months of free ink", but that requires giving over credit card information and signing up for a subscription. Shady.Some other frustrations are about how I have to open an account with HP in order to print something in my own home. That just seems like some creepy corporate big brother BS. I'm also not very impressed by the app. It's overly complicated and often non-responsive, forcing me to reboot either the app, the printer or both.All in all, I wish I had been given better information so I could have made a more informed decision about whether or not to purchase this unit. Frankly, I very likely would have bought something else.

I had an HP Envy 4512 that finally stopped working.  I came across this printer and wrongfully assumed it would be as good or better than my last one.  Boy was I wrong!  First of all, I duplex quite often.  This printer can duplex but only manually.  In other words print one side, flip the pages and reinsert and pray that you inserted the pages the correct way.  My old printer automatically duplexes.My old printer had a paper tray.  One wouldn't think this is a new concept.  After all, the printers I had more than a decade ago had that feature.  The paper feed at the back of the printer is a pain.  I make simple copies of report forms for church.  I generally print 10 at a time.  At least that's the number I manually input on the printer panel. I never know how many I will actually get because the printer randomly pulls extra paper through the feed.  Yesterday it was pulling all of the paper through for each page.  Of course yesterday, I wouldn't have needed as many pages if the software allowed for edits like my old HP.I have only used the printer a few times since purchase.  There is no way it prints as fast as it claims to.  Instead of 5.5 pages per minute(or whatever the claim is), it's more like 5.5 pages per hour.Certainly printer technology should be improving.  With this printer I felt more like I was taking a trip in the way back machine.

reviewTitle: Wireless operations are compatible with 2.4 GHz operations only
reviewDescription: Make sure you read the details before purchasing or you too might be very unhappy. Compatible with 2.4 GHz WIRELESS NETWORKS only. This means if your home has a 5GHz network, you might want to be sure you have the option of turning on a 2.4 so you can switch when you need to print.Or always run your home computer on a slower 2.4 wifi connection? Thanks HP. This is not at all helpful.

You get what you pay for here. It works good enough in a pinch but the prints aren’t clear. Text is pretty blurry but still legible for the most part. Also very slow command connection so it takes like 5 minutes for it to print after telling it to do so via WiFi/Bluetooth. The printing itself is also very slow. Setup was a little confusing as well but we figured it out. I do like that it came with ink included and doubles as a scanner and copier. For the price, I guess I shouldn’t have expected much better.

reviewTitle: theee most basic yet frustrating printer
reviewDescription: this printer is good for literally the bare minimum, and even then it struggles. It's constantly disconnecting from the wifi and refusing to reconnect, the scanner warps colors so bad, and it will sometimes take minutes to print a single page. I print maybe 2 pages a week and every time I do its a 20 minute ordeal.

reviewTitle: Was a nightmare to set up
reviewDescription: I have always had HP printers my whole life and they have been relatively easy to set up, but this one was a nightmare for me to set up and maybe because it’s the cheapest printer I’ve ever bought but after a couple of hours, it was ready to print my return label That I desperately needed for FedEx pick up in the morning so overall it will serve its purpose

When setting up your printer, if you choose to make it a HP+ printer, you'll be only allowed to use HP ink cartridge. That is, a $49 printer using a pair of cartridge at $53! You may join instant ink program to save some, but for a casual user who doesn't print a lot, locking into a monthly subscription is too restrictive. I'd rather purchase OEM cartridge at a much lower price when I need it.Note that HP+ is a contract that you can't back out. So I have to return the printer just to get out of it.

The printer quality is great, black/white and color. The ink is so easy to change out. The only issues I have been having is any time I print something I have to press the paper feed button to get it to start printing, i don't understand how this is an issue because I use the recommended paper.

The whole HP app and printer system is so bipolar....sometimes it will print, sometimes it doesnt want to connect. You can print one document and immediately after try to print something else and it won't work. It's really frustrating. and then you try to troubleshoot and it can't identify the problem.

I just needed a basic printer for use in my home office.  Seems to fit the need.  The set up was fairly easy,  connected to my WiFi with no problems and also to my iPad.  Not the fastest printer in the world for sure so if you are printing high volume this would not be a good printer for you.  And it only holds a small amount of paper in the feeder.  I don’t know the exact count.  Maybe 20 sheets if I had to guess.  I could not find any documentation on how much it held.  I’m trying out this “instant ink” thing HP seems to be on a kick about.  Not sure if I will like it.  Seems like they want to charge you by page?  I very much doubt I’m going to like that but I have a 3 month free trial so I will see how it works out.  I did like that they immediately send you a free ink kit right after you register.  Scanner works nicely too and has pretty intuitive software.  While you can only scan one sheet at a time you can use the software to scan a multipage document into one PDF.

I wish I could return this piece of junk!  Never connects after the initial setup.  Print quality is good, when you can get it to connect.  Tried mobile or desktop and neither is automatic. I have to go through the entire set up every time i want to use it.  30 min later i can print 1 page!Update 06/2024: after lots of trouble shooting turns out the application is what stinks.  Don't expect the app to be of any help when it comes to printing.  Printing from the drop down menu on your computer or mobile phone is the only way to get this to work.  Initial setup will be with the app in order to connect the printer to your wifi network is the only time you'll need it. Sounds pretty obvious, but one would expect an application in this day and age to function.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviewDescription: Good print quality but very difficult to set up software with Android devices and only works on 2G networks!! What's with that??

reviewTitle: Very light weight and ink runs out very fast.
reviewDescription: The printer is very light, in weight and the ink runs out very fast for general memo documents.

It did come scuffed up but otherwise its still great for me as a college student. The plug in the back to keep it on doesn’t stay in, like its not a tight fit like plugs should be. I had to hold it in the printer to make sure it worked.

Power cord too loose to connect to printer and stay put, had to replace. Can't just ask for them to replace the connecting cord, have to return the entire printer. Printer seems to work great, with new cord provided by me. Boo. Might be a trend, worth mentioning.

reviewTitle: It's cheap, but you'll need to be patient.
reviewDescription: I struggled with this printer for five hours, and I ended up getting tech support. Luckily, it was late, but it was capable of 24 hours of test support, so I connected to my computer and set up my printer remotely. It took a whole day. I subscribed to printer paper and ink. It's not a bad choice because I'm a student and I don't use my printer often. But I just bought it from Walmart because the paper is expensive and delivery is late. The printer has 300dpi 600 and 1200 options, but if you choose 1200, the printer will get errors and is very slow. I just recommend 300dpi, which is not clear, but fast. If you print it to the paper, the picture always cuts. That's quite annoying. To prevent that, you can make it into a pdf or jpg file and use the word to specify the paper margin. I'm happy with the cheap purchase of the printer. But sometimes I feel tempted to get this printer out. The printer has a clear start, but often has cloudy results towards the end. Leave a lot of space at the bottom of the paper.

reviewTitle: The 3 month supply of free ink lasted 2 days!
reviewDescription: Tricky to get printer to scan.  I had to get help from a computer expert.  Also, the advertised 3 months of free ink lasted just 2 days after printer approximately 20 pages.  Not such a great deal considering the price of the ink!

I bought this printer because it was a HP printer. While it prints great it will not stay connected to the WIFI. After the internet went down all day it would not connect even after I did all the things support said to do.

reviewTitle: It took 3 hours to set up
reviewDescription: I printed out 11 pages in color and I got the message that is low in ink.  Really?!

Took too long to install. Never had a new printer take more than 20 minutes to start working. Had to keep trying several times over an hour+ for it to work, even with a fairly new hp laptop and fast internet connection. Frustrating.

reviewTitle: Great, but I had to google how to use it to scan--which is mostly why I bought it
reviewDescription: For the price, this is a fine printer. It's about typical size and easy to set up. It comes with printer ink and because I don't print a lot, don't anticipate needing to spend a lot there. The scanner is great but you do need to use a program called HP Smart. It's free and once you figure it out (I was quite frustrated initially thinking I had managed to buy a printer that didn't scan so kudos to the fine humans who post videos about such things), scanning to a file on your linked computer is easy. I can't wax on about it too much more. It's a multi-function printer. It does what it should do. I've had it for a couple months and have had no issues.

This is a beginner friendly basic printer. I wanted something that was very simple to use. Only issue I have come across was connecting to other devices. But is a good printer overall. I do not print much but is still very convenient. Also, it is annoying when an instruction page automatically prints out instead of just advising on the screen, instead it needs to print out a page on how to fix which wastes ink in my opinion. I have not printer much but I already need to replace my black ink as it automatically prints unnecessary pages.

I bought this during Prime deals! Great price. Was offered 3 months free ink but I could never get anyone or the website to work to receive free ink without entering cc info and getting a subscription plan. I still like the printer, it’s small, printers well.
It was easy to connect and use - wish there were a little morning that goes with the printer because u don’t want to buy any u til u know it works well - but otherwise a decent printer

reviewTitle: You have to flip the pages when printing on both sides.
reviewDescription: The printer works AMAZING. Very easy to set up. Good color and ink. BUT, and I know this is probably my fault, but I didn't realize that you have to FLIP the pages manually every time you print on both sides. As an author... you can imagine this is a dealbreaker for me. It's too late to send it back so I'll just keep it for smaller print jobs, but as an automatic printer, it is NOT.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for!
reviewDescription: This is one of the more affordable printers I came across on my rushed journey to replace my printer before my approaching finals. The set up took a little bit, but was pretty straightforward between the manual provided and the step-by-step given by the HP Smart application.This printer itself runs a little slow, and doesn’t print double sided automatically (it prints the odds on one side, then you have to reload so it’ll print evens on the other side) which isn’t the most convenient, but also not the most bothersome for personal use. I wouldn’t use this printer for larger jobs based on this fact alone.I’ve only had it for about 24 hrs but the internet connectivity was easy to set up and hasn’t given me any issues thus far. I’ve not experienced any type of paper jamming issues, and the noise seems pretty on par with your average printer; not too loud but not necessary quiet.Overall I’m giving it 4 stars because while it’s not the best printer I’ve ever used, I think it more than decent considering it’s a third of the price of other printers on the market!

Nice printer, but the functionality is a bit confusing. I also wish that two sided printing was a bit easier. My old printer didn't require me to flip the sheet. The print speed is decent. The printed pages appear smooth with no streaks or bare spots. The ink seems to last a while, however I signed up for hp instant ink and didn't need to. Only sign up if you print a lot of pages! Overall, I like it!

My last one lasted about 7.5 years.  That's pretty good nowadays where nothing seems to last more than a day or two past the return window.  I like their Free Ink plan.  I rarely use a printer but absolutely need to have one for those rare occasions when I do.  In fact, I usually dry out before I run out.  The free ink is awesome.  And since I rarely use it, the speed and quality are more than good enough for a recipe or whatever.  Yay, HP!

I've been happy with this since I've gotten it. Only problem is that I thought it had scanning, but can't seem to figure that part out. I'm also curious how much ink refills are and how long they last. But, seems to work just fine for what I'm using it for which is pretty basic.
Has worked out great. Took a little time as this model does not allow for Ethernet cable connection (WIFI Only)I downloaded scanner app and all was good

reviewTitle: It only works on a 2.5G network!
reviewDescription: I pay for a high speed internet connection and use a 5g network.  Why in the world will anyone want to buy a printer that forces all devices to use it to switch to 2.5g?  Also, I even set up the 2.5g and could not connect either.  Tech support suggested connecting directly to the cox panoramic router and eliminate my  mesh?  Let’s see,  adapt your entire network so this cheap printer works?  I ended up returning and buying the 6055e that is 5g compatible and it connected perfectly with 5g using the mesh for just $40 more.

Nice printer, if you have a router. I don’t have internet (router) now and used it through wi-fi direct, so they stopped seeing information about my ink level, and stopped sending ink to me with instant ink program.  Now there is an error which they are not able to fix without internet connection. I spent the whole day on the phone, trying to get someone who can help me with that error, and what they said, we need a router on your house, with hotspot they are not able to fix it and I can’t take the printer to the HP authorized service center under their warranty, that what they said by the phone!  Great, also for fixing your printer they will ask you to share the screen of your phone, what also not very safe, in my opinion. Customer service is awful, if you order a call back on their website, they will never call you. So it’s better to call them, and not spending your time with chat or waiting for a back call.

reviewTitle: Ink that comes with printer is not compatible.
reviewDescription: Printer shows E0 unsuitable cartridge.That’s the ink that came with printer.

This is the second one I received. The first one did not connect and would never print. This one is temperamental and I can only get it to print from my cell phone not from my Internet connection or computer. 👎🏽

reviewTitle: Nightmare to set up - See instructions in comment
reviewDescription: It took 3 hours to set up. The reference guide does not include instructions. Customer service said I had to PAY for assistance. How to set up: install HP Smart App on your phone or tablet. Follow prompts to add new printer. THEN you can go to settings on your computer and add new printer. Follow the prompts. The PIN next to the ink cartridges in the printer does not work, but thankfully you do not need it when you set up using the instructions above. I skipped the setup for 3 months of free ink as they were asking too many questions and seemed fishy to me.  I will update in a few weeks regarding the ink quality and if it seems to be lasting for a reasonable amount of time.
The price of the printer was great, but sometimes you get what you pay for.  I am know out of color ink so quickly.  I  signed up for instant ink and really need color ink now!

I disliked the fact the the printer ink cartridges were no good. So as far as a review wasn’t happy!  Instant cartriage error tried putting cartridge in and out trouble shooting did everything except buy new ink
Got as a present. Feels cheap and not great quality.
If you need something for 50 pages or less a month. This is it. It does print slower than other HP printers, but is perfect for here and there printing. Had no issues setting up and getting started.
Good price for home use.  Not easy to install.

I love HP printers I have used them for the past 20 years. I love this series the WiFi printing works great. Scanning is easy to use. I like the digital display and the white color instead of black. Looks good, prints well and meets all my printing needs.

It's a great little printer/scanner. For what I need it's perfect. I can print and make copies. I like that I can print from any device and everything is pretty seamless, only thing I don't like is that you have to sign up for a stupid monthly payment plan with hp for ink. I would much rather just buy what I need and not pay someone for things I don't use, and even though I'm on the payment plan it limits my prints!?! Hp has gone downhill in that sense. But other than that it's a great little combo printer.

reviewTitle: Decent Inexpensive Home Printer, Copier, Scanner
reviewDescription: As a budget item, it's fine for casual home use.  However, there are two things to note:1.  The ink cartridges that come with the printer won't last long as there isn't much ink in them.  After printing the initial alignment page (it auto renders in color for it), the ink level monitoring software automatically opened / popping up on my screen and graphically showing the level of the color ink cartridge was "down one notch" from full.  Really, from just printing the alignment page?  Bad HP, Bad Indeed.As a set, the regular HP replacement ink cartridges will set a person back almost $50 so, as it's been for years now, these inexpensive combo printers are a money grab for the ink required to use them.  Fortunately, I don't print much at all these days so the included tiny cartridges will probably last me many months.  I do not recommend the HP Ink Program; it's a shortcut used by HP to get quicker access to consumers' money and from what I've read online about it, it's ink monitoring software is skewed to influence the frequency of the automatic ink orders; so not cool HP!  Plus, in addition to the expensive HP Ink being shipped more frequently than actually necessary, the program is structured as a subscription based service.  Again, not cool!2A.  I bought the combo printer because I wanted to connect it thru USB rather than wirelessly.  The last two HP printers bought over the years were wireless ones and though I'm computer savvy and have been online and printing for 30 years, the 2 wireless printers had network connectivity issues regularly even though they were both close to the PC and the combo modem/router.  The various indicator lights on the printers flashed often indicating communication / network problems so, since the printers were fairly cheap anyway, as I tired of network, router/modem/printer resets and reboots, I gave them to Goodwill.2B.  Once the HP123 setup was initialized, I realized this install program has bias toward a wireless connection set up rather than a wired USB.  On the first setup screen, the only option is to choose the wireless network the printer detected and another option that says something like "choose a different network".  The screen is missing a clickable direct link to a USB setup.  However, by clicking the "choose another network" option, on the screen that follows, the user can then choose a wired USB connection. C'mon HP, you can do better!All in all, as a hard wired USB printer, scanner, copier, it's decent.  I have no knowledge of its wireless connectivity and use when connected that way.
So far it has been working well for this new HP Printer 2855e model

This printer works well for home use. It is a bit cumbersome for work when scanning multiple documents. It sits well next to the desk and doesn't take up much room. Print quality is good and the replacement cartridges are reasonable priced. Definitely a good deal.
Not enough step by step instructions to easily connect to iPhone or iPad. Not noisy at all; print quality is good.
Good printer, just always issues when I scan through the doc feeder.

reviewTitle: It’s good I need more ink
reviewDescription: It’s good printed from my phone and my home computer

reviewTitle: Perfectly Sufficient for My Printing Needs
reviewDescription: I needed a simple printer for the occasional printing needs and I wanted something as compact as possible.This one gets the job done and has been perfectly sufficient.Set-up was fine.  No issues following the instructions and I don't recall it taking longer than anticipated.I do appreciate the wireless capabilities of this printer.  I routinely print from my phone which is a convenience I didn't anticipate using or needing.  As reliant as I am on my phone, I now find it's more convenient to just print from my cell.  I keep the printer connected to my wifi so I can seamlessly print from either my computer or my phone.I haven't used the scan or copy capabilities yet so I can't speak to those.  It's quiet when printing though.  The noisiest part if when I forget to pull out the paper tray prior to printing and my print falls to the floor.I don't print frequently - a couple of times per month and usually in B&W.  Despite this the ink doesn't seem to last very long.  I've replaced it ~6 times since March 2022.  The print quality is fine with no smudges or smears.  B&W prints appear sharp and color prints seem vibrant enough.

reviewTitle: Outside Of The "Free" 6 Months of Ink, It Is GREAT!
reviewDescription: I took a chance on this printer given it was being sold at a great price, and I finally realized I need a printer.  I actually bought this printer TWICE: once as a wedding gift and for myself.  I don't understand what all the criticism is about: the set up and functionality has not been a problem for myself or the couple I got it for.  If all you need is a printer to print basic documents periodically and scan documents, then this one should fit you perfectly.  The set up is extremely easy, if you follow the directions, and the printer is really easy to use.  I was worried initially given the amount of low reviews, but I'm unsure if that is the printer's fault necessarily (maybe it is, just given my experience this is my conclusion).  The only reason I don't give this a five star is the ink situation...  With the title "6 Months of Free Ink", you'd think it would come with the printer, right?  Wrong - You have to sign up for the subscription service they offer, and the printer only comes with enough black/colored ink for the test print.  Therefore, I recommend buying ink when you buy the printer.  Usually there is a "bundled together" section that shows the ink you need for the printer.  Overall though I'm really satisfied!  If you need a simple printer that works, at a good price, then this is a good choice!To update: After a couple months of use/having this printer, I have not had some of the issues others have commented on (ex. wireless connection issues).  I still recommend 100%!
The printer works fine, but you’re constantly replacing ink cartridges. This Makes it a waste of money

reviewTitle: Wifi settings cannot be changed after setup.
reviewDescription: At first I was satisfied with the printer. However after 5 weeks of use, I need to change the wifi settings to accomodate new wifi settings. The product is incapable of such change. Sadly it is too late to return and will not function.

reviewTitle: Product arrived very damaged--poor shipping method
reviewDescription: I ordered this not realizing that the company would take no precautions in packing this printer to be shipped. As soon as I opened the box, there were glass shards everywhere inside. The shards got everywhere when I removed the printer from the box, and upon inspecting the printer, I saw that the pane of glass for the scanner was completely broken (photos included). So, that part of the printer was useless straight out of the box.I believe this happened because the company just slapped the shipping label on the original printer box and sent it out with no further impact protection (photo included). I guess that's just the chance you take when you order something like this online, but I just expected the company to take more care in ensuring the integrity of its product. I was unable to return it within the return window because I'm a college student, and I desperately needed anything that would let me print at home.I rated it two stars because I guess it is capable of completing small print jobs. Setup and wifi connection was easy. I was only able to test it once, and it ran out of ink before it could finish printing all the documents. However, I was trying to print a slideshow, so the ink might've lasted longer if I was just printing plain text. I was also using the original ink that came in the box with the printer, which might've been faulty.I have no way to assess the quality of the scanner, but the HP app seems good. Overall, my experience with this printer has not been good.
I had a hard time setting it up. I don't like the wireless connection
Terrible printer. Purchased 2 of them. Both had problems working. Returned them both.

This is a good printer for home office. I would have given 5 stars except for the instant ink issue I had. I didn't realize I signed up for the instant ink program until I received the ink in the mail. Trying to cancel was a nightmare, I finally got through to a person and cancelled . I tried to print something and my printer would not print, I found out because instant ink was in the printer when I cancelled that also cancelled the ink that was in the printer to print. Another nightmare to get to a representative, they informed me since my instant ink was cancelled so was the ink that was in the printer. If I wanted to print I had to resubscribe to instant ink or go buy new ink somewhere else. I had a full black and full color cartridges in the printer that were useless. I did not resubscribe and bought new ink. Just be aware of this scam they pull on you that they do not tell you about when you subscribe to the instant ink program!

I have had this printer since June and unfortunately am unable to return it. I have had two Canon printers before this HP and they were great. However,  I wanted to try the HP for the Instant Ink program. I regret my decision. While I have received great help through customer service twice so far, this printer is not easy to fix. I am pretty tech proficient but it doesn't matter with this printer. I have had issues with the printer not connecting to my devices. I learned that the printer has to connect to my phone or computer at 2.4ghz. My devices typically default to 5.0ghz so I have to change this before printing or it will not print and causes more problems. I had issues with my printer not responding last week and when I called to speak with customer service, the representative was very helpful. However, there were multiple steps that we had to go through to get it to work again. I was motivated to write this review today but I have yet another problem with the printer. When I try to print today, it tells me that the printer is in use and will not print any actual documents. I have restarted my computer and the printer. There's no paper jammed in the printer. It's just not working so I feel like I will have to call customer service once again. At least they are helpful and are great at troubleshooting. I just don't like there are so many issues. It does print well, if you can look past the less than user-friendly tech issues.

reviewTitle: Air printing is not reliable and trial ink only
reviewDescription: Setup was super easy, I thought. Reliability is not great so far for air printing. You also only receive a trial size of ink - they are about 25% full which is super fun as I'm trying to print things for my classroom.

reviewTitle: Tthis printer only supports a 2.4 GHz wifi network.
reviewDescription: I am never disappointed with HP products, until today.  The printer is nice, doesn't weigh much, comes with ink, and powers up with ease.  I did not get to print anything as it was not compatible with my Wi-Fi network. This only supports a 2.4 GHz network.  I did not find this information in any of the product description before I made my purchase.

Bought this as a teacher expense. Thought I should get a printer with how much I need to print and instead I ended up with a paper weight now. I have had this printer just over a year and it just stops working. I’ll print about 30 pages and it will just stop. And I have upgraded to more page allotments over and over to see that is the issue. I have use hp virtual assistant and that was no help. Can’t find anything wrong with it seems like the printer just gives what it wants and then that it.
My bad, thought it faxed too.  For the price, it's All Good!
Great printer but if you are looking for something on the smaller end this is not for you. It was much bigger than expected.

It is not easy to use if you change wifi. You have to pay for an HP subscription to do stuff like that easily. Otherwise it's a pain to re-format it so it will print.Print quality and speed is pretty good. Copier is great.

When trying to set up the printer, turn to YouTube right from the start! The directions are not complete whether they are written, on the HP website or given by their tech support!! But….YouTube has the detailed steps and then it’s a breeze to setup!
came on time, it's just what I needed.

reviewTitle: Great price for all that it does.
reviewDescription: This printer does it all. Copy scan print fax.Remote Wi-Fi operation.Only issue I’ve had was installing it to my computer.After I completed it, it worked for a bit but then unfortunately not able to print to it (remotely or direct).Finally called HP tech services. They were able to remotely tie in and correct the issue.Been fine since.
This printer is easy to use. I wish I had read carefully before purchasing it. This printer does not print on both sides.

reviewTitle: Love the product not the instructions
reviewDescription: The quality of the printer and the prints is amazing .Also included is a 3 month free subscription for ink and after only 4.99(assuming you decide to keep the subscription )What I didn’t like was the instructions there was a few sets of instructions none of which were helpful.  You need a computer to set it all up , couldn’t figure out set up on my phone without first getting  on my laptop.All in all a good purchase. I do suggest you read online how to set it up because in my opinion the instructions were not clear.
It is tricky to set up this printer with your computer.It prints great and nice and quiet.
